The correct pronunciation is Bao Xuan Dao Ling. The Heavenly Emperor’s inner text is Xu A; the hidden sound is Na Tian. These four characters are secret to the Purple Chamber Palace of Heaven, which governs the deliverance of souls for rebirth.

The Luminous River Lad Heaven, also called the Radiant Heaven. Its color is black, next to Shi. Those who cultivate forty virtues and purify three sense faculties are reborn here. Alternately called the River Lad. The Buddhists call this the Suyāma Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Yuan Yu Qi Jing. The correct pronunciation is Ming Sheng Jiu Zhen. The Heavenly King’s hidden name is Yuan Yu; the perfected one’s inner text is Qi Jing. These four characters are secret to the Nine Dawns Palace of Heaven, which governs the promulgation of governance and teachings.

The Mysterious Womb Nurturing Heaven, also called the Brahmanic Heaven or the Trāyastriṃśa. Its color is red, next to Wei. Those who cultivate sixty virtues and purify four sense faculties are reborn here. The Buddhists call this the Tuṣita Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Liu Du Nei Xian. The correct pronunciation is Piao Han Mo Ran. The Heavenly Emperor’s hidden name is Liu Du Nei Xian. These four characters are secret to the Primordial Scenery Palace of Heaven, which governs the summoning of demons and promotion of immortals.

The Primordial Brightness Literary Flourishing Heaven, also called the Transformative Joy. Its color is blue-green, next to Xu. Those who cultivate eighty virtues and purify five sense faculties are reborn here. The Buddhists call this the Nirmāṇarati Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Chou Fa Lun.

The correct pronunciation is Kai Sheng Shu. The Heavenly Emperor’s inner name is Nei Wen Chou, with the alternate name Fa Lun. These three characters are secret to the Moon Palace of Heaven, governing the circulation of primordial qi.

The Upper Bright Seven Luminaries Ma Yi Heaven, also called Transformative Joy, referring to the utmost of sensual pleasure. Its color is black, next to Nü. Those who cultivate one hundred virtues and purify six sense faculties are reborn here. The Buddhists call this the Parinirmita-vaśavartin Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Tian Huai Yan. The correct pronunciation is Yan Xu Ming; the Heavenly Emperor’s inner sound is Tian Huai, with the hidden name Yan. These three characters are secret to the Great Yin Palace of Heaven, governing the deliverance of those in dark distress.

The Void Transcending Heng Heaven, also called Initial Brahman. Its color is blue-green, next to Niu. Though the heavenly beings here have purified their six sense faculties, they remain bound by the dust of form and thus ascend to this heaven. The Buddhists call this the Brahmā-pāriṣadya Heaven of the First Dhyāna. The Emperor’s name is Zheng Ding Guang. The correct pronunciation is Jing Wu Qiao; the Heavenly Emperor’s inner name is Zheng Ding Guang. These three characters are secret to the Great Mystery Palace of the Archer, governing the supreme Dao.

The Supreme Ultimate Meng Yi Heaven, also called Upper Brahman. Its color is purple, next to Dou. Those whose coarse dust of form is purified ascend here. It is also called the First Dhyāna Heaven. The Buddhists call this the Brahmā-purohita Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Qu Yu Jiu Chang. The correct pronunciation is A Nan Jing Ming. The Heavenly King’s hidden name is Qu Yu, with the complete name Jiu Chang. These four characters are secret to the Mystery Capital Palace of Heaven, governing the refinement and deliverance of decayed remains.

**The Eight Southern Heavens**
The Primordial Beginning accumulates the three yang breaths of Brahman to form eight heavens, belonging to the Form Realm. Four heavens pertain to coarse dust, and four to fine dust. Their regalia consist of blue crowns, red tassels, and vermilion robes.

The Crimson Bright Harmonious Yang Heaven, also called Lesser Light. Its color is white, next to Ji and Dou. Those whose second coarse dust is purified ascend here. It is also called the First Dhyāna Heaven. The Buddhists call this the Mahābrahmā Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Li Jin Shang Zhen. The common correct pronunciation is Zhi An Bao Xian; the Heavenly King’s hidden name is Li Jin Shang Zhen. These four characters are secret to the Ever-Bright Palace of Heaven, governing the refinement of immortals into perfected beings.

The Mysterious Bright Reverent Flourishing Heaven, also called Resounding Light. Its color is yellow, next to Ji. Those whose third coarse dust is purified are reborn here. It is also called the Second Dhyāna Heaven. The Buddhists call this the Parītta-ābha Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Kong Yao Chou Yin. The correct pronunciation is Fei Yin Qi Ling; the Heavenly Emperor’s inner name is Kong Yao Chou Yin. These four characters are secret to the Eastern Florescence Palace, responding to and transforming all things.

The Radiant Bright Ancestral Fluttering Heaven, also called Immeasurable Light. Its color is green, next to Wei. Those whose fourth coarse dust is purified are reborn here. It is also called the Second Dhyāna Heaven. The Buddhists call this the Apramāṇa-ābha Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Chong Guang Ming. The correct pronunciation is Qiao Zhen Ying; the Heavenly Emperor’s complete name is Chong Guang Ming. These three characters are secret to the Vast Origin Palace, governing those who study immortality at the kalpa’s end.

The Bamboo Grove August Jia Heaven, with the alternate name Initial Purity. Its color is blue-green, next to Xin. Those whose fifth coarse dust is purified are reborn here. It is also called the Second Dhyāna Heaven. The Buddhists call this the Ābhāsvara Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Mo Yi Miao Bian. The correct pronunciation is Nan Xuan Ming; the Heavenly Emperor’s hidden name is Mo Yi, with the inner sound Miao Bian. These four characters are secret to the Pure Mystery Palace, governing the trial of demonic tests for learners.

The Void Bright Hall Radiance Heaven, with the alternate name Solemn Purity. Its color is red, next to Fang. Those whose sixth coarse dust is purified, yet retain fine dust, are reborn here. The Buddhists call this the Parītta-śubha Heaven. The Emperor’s name is A Lan Lou Sheng. The correct pronunciation is Mi Lun Xuan Ming; the Heavenly Emperor’s hidden sound is A Lan, with the Brahmanic name Lou Sheng. These four characters are secret to the Double Florescence Palace, governing the deliverance of learners.

The Contemplative Bright Upright Tranquility Heaven, with the alternate name Pervasive Purity. Its color is blue-green, next to Shi. Those whose first fine dust is purified are reborn here. It is also called the Third Dhyāna Heaven. The Buddhists call this the Apramāṇa-śubha Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Yu Mi Luo Qian. The correct pronunciation is Lang Guan Yao Ming; the Heavenly Emperor’s hidden name is Yu Mi, with the inner name Luo Qian. These four characters are secret to the Radiant Florescence Palace, governing the deliverance of heavenly beings.

The Mysterious Bright Reverent Celebration Heaven, also called Immeasurable Purity. Its color is black, next to Kang. Those whose second fine dust is purified are reborn here. It is also called the Third Dhyāna Heaven. The Buddhists call this the Śubha-kṛtsna Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Long Luo Pu Ti. The correct pronunciation is Wei Qing Dao Xuan; the Flying Heaven’s inner sound is Long Luo, and the Heavenly Lord’s hidden name is Pu Ti. These four characters are secret to the Opening-Closing Palace, governing those who attain the Dao.

The Supreme Resplendent Jade Heaven, with the alternate name Victorious in Blessed Love. Its color is blue-green, next to Jiao. Those whose third fine dust is purified are reborn here. It is also called the Fourth Dhyāna Heaven. The Buddhists call this the Puṇyaprasava Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Wan Li Yuan Yan. The correct pronunciation is Dong Zhen Yong Guan; the Heavenly King’s inner name is Wan Li Yuan Yan. These four characters are secret to the Imperial Peace Palace, governing the instruction of learners.

**The Eight Western Heavens**
The Primordial Beginning accumulates the seven yang breaths of Brahmanic splendor to form them. Two heavens belong to the fine dust of the Form Realm, and six to the light dust heavens. Their regalia consist of blue crowns, golden tassels, and white robes.

The Primordial Qi Kong Sheng Heaven, also called Bliss. Its color is purple, next to Miao and Jiao. Those whose fourth fine dust is purified are reborn here. It is also called the Fourth Dhyāna Heaven. The Buddhists call this the Puṇyaprasava Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Kai Zhen Ding Guang. The correct pronunciation is Kai Guang Jing Zhen; the Heavenly Lord’s inner sound is Kai, with the hidden name Zhen Ding Guang. These four characters are secret to the Longevity Palace, governing the refinement of souls.

The Supreme Peace August Cliff Heaven, with the alternate name Ultimate Bliss. Its color is white, next to Zhen. Those whose fifth fine dust is purified are reborn here. It is also called the Fourth Dhyāna Heaven. The Buddhists call this the Bṛhatphala Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Po Lou A Tan. The correct pronunciation is Yun Mo A Hun; the Heavenly Lord’s hidden sound is Po Lou, with the demonic inner name A Tan. These four characters are secret to the Elder’s Opening Brightness Palace, governing the deliverance of the virtuous.

The Manifest Stability Supreme Wind Heaven,

Or it is called Broad Joy. Its color is yellow, next to Wing. Though the celestial beings’ fine dust is purified, they still retain subtle defilements and are reborn here. It is also called the Fourth Dhyāna Heaven. The Buddhists call this the Asaṃjñisattva Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Zhao Zhen Tong. The correct pronunciation is Hui Qiao Wei; the Heavenly Lord’s secret title is Zhao Zhen Tong. These three characters are secret to the Great Crimson Palace, governing the deliverance of souls with meritorious virtue.

The August Filial Flourishing Heaven of the First Emperor,
Or it is called Supreme Wonder. Its color is green, next to Spread. When celestial beings purify their single subtle defilement, they ascend to this heaven. The Buddhists call this the Anāgāmin Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Sa Luo Lou Wang. The correct pronunciation is Jun Hua Da Quan; the Jade Perfected’s hidden script is Sa Luo Lou Wang. These four characters are secret to the Great Cinnabar Palace, governing the unveiling of night and the opening of darkness.

The Supreme August Visiting Floating Countenance Heaven,
Or it is called the Heaven of Color’s Ultimate. Its color is blue, next to Star. As the dust of color gradually fades, it is called the Heaven of Color’s Ultimate. When the two subtle defilements are purified, one ascends here. The Buddhists call this the Ābhāsvara Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Min Ba Kuang. The correct pronunciation is Hui Wei Guang; the Heavenly Lord’s inner script is Min Ba Kuang. These three characters are secret to the Flower Canopy Palace, governing the summoning of demons and the gathering of perfected beings.

The Thought-Free River Origin Heaven,
Or it is called the Most Supreme Wonder. Its color is red, next to Willow. When celestial beings purify their three subtle defilements, they ascend here. The Buddhists call this the Sudarśana Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Ming Fan Guang. The correct pronunciation is Lang Ming Fa Yuan; the Heavenly Lord’s inner title is Ming Fan Guang. These three characters are secret to the Bright Hall Palace, governing the deliverance of virtuous souls.

The Upper Delving Joyous Heaven,
Or it is called the Self-Mastery Heaven. Its color is dark green, next to Ghost. When celestial beings purify their four subtle defilements, they ascend here. The Buddhists call this the Sudṛśa Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Bo Bo Jian. The correct pronunciation is Yu Wu Zhen Xing; the Heavenly Emperor’s inner script is Bo Bo, with the inner title Jian. These three characters are secret to the Spirit-Moving Palace, governing the classification of celestial beings.

The Boundless Vow Heaven,
With alternate names Great Self-Mastery and Non-Return. Its color is black, next to Well. When celestial beings purify their five subtle defilements, they ascend here. The Buddhists call this the Akaniṣṭha Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Piao Nu Qiong Long. The correct pronunciation is Fei Zai Xu Ying; the Heavenly Demon’s inner script is Piao Nu, and the Heavenly Lord’s hidden name is Qiong Long. These four characters are secret to the Central Void Palace, governing the deliverance of immortals.

**The Eight Heavens of the North**
The Primordial Beginning accumulates the five yang breaths of pure qi to form them. Four heavens belong to the Formless Realm, and four heavens belong to the Seed-People Realm. Their regalia are azure crowns, white pendants, and black robes.

The Luminous Court Rosy Dawn Heaven,
With the alternate name Non-Empty. Its color is jade green, next to Legs and Well. Though celestial beings’ subtle defilements are purified, residual habitual tendencies remain, and they ascend here. The Buddhists call this the Ākāśānantyāyatana Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Hui Jue Hun. The correct pronunciation is Wu Qing Ming; the Heavenly Lord’s inner sound is Hui Jue Hun. These three characters are secret to the Jasper Jade Palace, governing the deliverance of disciples through skillful means.

The Abyssal Penetration Primordial Cavern Heaven,
With the alternate name Great Non-Empty. Its color is purple, next to Legs. When celestial beings forget all dust of form but retain consciousness, they ascend here. The Buddhists call this the Vijñānānantyāyatana Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Fan Xing Guan Sheng. The correct pronunciation is Xi Quan Dao Guang; the Heavenly Lord’s inner sound is Fan Xing, with the hidden name Guan Sheng. These four characters are secret to the True Origin Palace, governing the deliverance of disciples.

The Supreme Literary Grace Wondrous Completion Heaven,
With the alternate name Non-Thought. Its color is white, next to Beak. When celestial beings forget both consciousness and perception, their qi-observation gradually becomes wondrous, and they ascend here. The Buddhists call this the Ākiṃcanyāyatana Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Na Yu Chou Ying. The correct pronunciation is Ling Xun Hui Guang; the Heavenly Demon’s inner script is Na Yu Chou Ying. These four characters are secret to the Spirit Seclusion Palace, governing matters of governance and regulation.

The Supreme Plain Elegant Joy Forbidden Upper Heaven,
With the alternate name Neither-Thought-Nor-Non-Thought. Its color is yellow, next to Net. As celestial beings gradually forget their habitual tendencies, their qi-observation becomes increasingly wondrous, and they ascend here. The Buddhists call this the Naivasaṃjñānāsaṃjñāyatana Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Long Luo Jue Chang. The correct pronunciation is Yang Wei Yao Qing; the Heavenly Emperor’s inner script is Long Luo Jue Chang. These four characters are secret to the Nine Spirits Palace, governing the recording of demon kings.

The Supreme Void Supreme Eternal Fusion Heaven,
With the alternate name Immovable. Its color is green, next to Pleiades. When celestial beings suddenly forget their habitual tendencies and gradually enter divine observation, they ascend here. The Buddhists call this the Bṛhatphala Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Zong Jian Gui Shen. The correct pronunciation is She Ling Zhen; the Heavenly Emperor’s inner sound for subduing demons is Zong Jian Gui Shen. These four characters are secret to the Power and Blessing Palace, governing the assessment of disciples’ merits and demerits.

The Supreme Release Jade Eminence Soaring Victory Heaven,
With the alternate name Great Immovable. Its color is blue, next to Stomach. When celestial beings suddenly forget their habitual tendencies and their divine observation becomes increasingly wondrous, they ascend here. The Buddhists call this the Mahābṛhatphala Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Miao Miao Xing Yuan. The correct pronunciation is Kong Wei Dao Ming; the Heavenly Lord’s hidden title is Miao Miao Xing Yuan. These four characters are secret to the Sun Canopy Palace, governing the summoning and assembly of immortals and sages.

The Dragon-Transformed Pure Deliverance Heaven,
With the alternate name Supreme Wonder Heaven. Its color is red, next to Harness. When celestial beings attain purity without defilement and realize the non-empty fruit, they ascend here. The Buddhists call this the Supreme Wonder Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Yun Shang Xuan Xuan. The correct pronunciation is Ju Ling Miao Guang; the Heavenly King’s inner script is Yun Shang, and the Jade Perfected’s general sound is Xuan Xuan. These four characters are secret to the Numinous Treasure Palace, advancing immortals to sagehood.

The Supreme Ultimate Balanced Nurturing Splendid Heaven,
With the alternate name Most Supreme Wonder. Its color is dark green, next to Straddling. When celestial beings thoroughly enter the wondrous Dao and realize the supreme mystery of enlightenment, they ascend here. The Buddhists call this the Most Supreme Wonder Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Da Ze Fa Men. The correct pronunciation is Yong Xuan Jiu Sheng; the Heavenly King’s general script is Da Ze Fa Men. These four characters are secret to the Heavenly Treasure Palace, universally delivering disciples.

The thirty-two heavens, the thirty-two emperors, the hidden names of the heavens, the hidden titles of the heavens—within the heavens’ emptiness, the numinous chapters arise naturally. The hidden rhymes of the heavens are the sounds within the heavens, the revered within the heavens, the spirits within the heavens, the great demons within the heavens, the numina within the heavens. Nine harmonizes with ten, transforming into the Upper Clarity. The boundless mysteries are profound beyond full explication.

The divine perfected scatter and spread, universally delivering heavenly beings and humans.

Master Shangyang says: The Heavenly Emperor’s inner scriptures, hidden names, colored robes, and root-dust—all these the Heavenly Honored One, in compassion for the benighted, commanded the Heavenly Perfected Sovereign to annotate, descending to teach those who have not yet heard. See the *Cavernous Spirit Sutra*, *Inner Sound Sutra*, *Dragon’s Soaring Sutra*, *Root-Boundary Sutra*, *Heavenly Duke Sutra*, and others. Huang and Zeng reached the Seven Luminaries and Six Heavens of the Desire Realm—this is the lower realm. At first emerging, with worldly desires not yet extinguished, the people of these heavens touch things and become stained. In the first two heavens, bodily union is desire. In the next two, hand-clasping is desire. In the following five, speech is desire. In the next six, eye-gazing is desire. Because of desire for form, yin and yang intermingle, hence it is called the Desire Realm. Due to their indulgence in desire, signs of decay become apparent, lifespans end, and they sink back into the various destinies. If one gradually cultivates and abandons desire, ascending into the Form Realm, this is the Small Vehicle Dao.

When the great kalpa turns, fire arises from the root of Kunlun, burning the world. Flames surge to the Harmony-Sun Heaven, primordial qi disperses, and the heavens collapse. Passing through to the Vow-Swearing Heaven marks the Form Realm—this is the middle realm. The people of these heavens possess six colors and eighteen dusts. When one dust is purified, one ascends to a heaven; when all eighteen dusts are purified, one ascends to the Formless Realm. If one clings even slightly, one falls back into the Desire Realm—this is the Middle Vehicle Dao.

When the great kalpa turns with water, it arises from the Eastern Well, vast springs churning waves that flood to the Ultimate Wind Heaven. Primordial qi disperses, and the heavens collapse. From the Radiant Court to the Four Heavens of Elegant Joy is the Formless Realm—this is the upper realm. Only when all dust-stains are purified does one ascend to these heavens. The *Great Perfected Regulations* states: In the Formless Realm, the utmost perfected are without emotion, do not intermingle yin and yang, and if humans are transformed and born there, they only consume true qi, no longer possessing physical form. When one cultivates to a heaven, only the mind-consciousness remains; if the mind-consciousness is extinguished, one ascends step by step. When qi is observed and the Dao is accomplished, one penetrates into spontaneity, ascending to the Seed-People Heaven. The Buddhists call this the Bodhisattva-Striving Heaven—the Great Vehicle Dao.

When the great kalpa turns, neither water nor fire reaches it, only wind vast and surging. From Filial Might to the Six Heavens of Cloud-Soaring, the wind destroys them; from Primordial Cavern to Elegant Joy, primordial qi scatters and then recombines, with no further kalpas. From Constant Fusion to the Four Seed-People Heavens of Level Nurturance, penetrating into the true Dao, one ascends to these heavens—this is the Most Supreme Vehicle. When the great kalpa turns and the Three Realms are utterly destroyed, these heavens give birth again to sages as the seed of the people, hence they are called the Seed-People.

The secrets of the Heavenly Emperor, demons, spirits, and numinous chapters are all formed from the qi of emptiness and cavernousness. All spirits rely on them for transformation, just as the returning elixir depends on the primordial ancestral qi, the work of nine harmonizing with ten, to form the golden embryo. The embryo transforms, and the body enters the Upper Clarity. Of boundless mysteries, this elixir is the most wondrous and transformative, deeply hidden and beyond full explication.

"Scattering and spreading" refers to the divine perfected dispersing the true scriptures, arranging them throughout the heavens, commanding them to be upheld, universally delivering heavenly beings and humans, all attaining the wondrous Dao. This is the comprehensive explanation of the Dao’s application and worldly dharma.

The ode says:
The thirty-two heavens in total are dust,
When form and mind are both quiescent, the whole body appears.
Nine harmonizes with ten, the scriptural work complete,
In the Golden Watchtower Palace, one attends the Jade Emperor.

Today, joyously celebrating this deliverance, passing through the barriers of all heavens, we request the eradication of the Three Evils, severing the root of earth, flying through the Five Passes, with one’s name recorded in the Great Mystery. The Demon Kings vouch for you, unbound by the Heavenly Gates. The Eastern Dipper governs lifespan, the Western Dipper records names. The Northern Dipper casts down death, the Southern Dipper bestows life, the Central Dipper’s Great Chief oversees all spirits. The Azure Emperor guards the hun-soul, the White Emperor attends the po-soul, the Vermilion Emperor nurtures qi, the Black Emperor circulates blood. The Yellow Emperor presides at the center—none of the myriad spirits transgress him.

The Azure Heaven Demon King is Ba Yuan Chou Bo.
The Vermilion Heaven Demon King bears the heavens and carries stones.
The White Heaven Demon King reverses mountains with six eyes.
The Black Heaven Demon King oversees the ugly and fragrant.
The Yellow Heaven Demon King bears the heavens with horizontal strength.

The Five Great Demon Emperors are the lords of all spirits, flying and drumming in procession, commanding ghostly soldiers. Waving banners and beating drums, they roam and observe the great void. Proclaiming themselves resplendent, all heavens share in the merit. Ascending to heaven to deliver people, they strictly govern the Northern Feng. The Divine Duke receives the mandate, universally sweeping away inauspiciousness. The Eight Mighties spew poison, fierce horses spread in four directions. Heavenly Soldiers lead the way, great marshals wield banners. Casting fire for ten thousand miles, flowing bells in eight directions. Should any dare to test or obstruct the perfected, the golden axes strike first, the giant天后 metes out punishment. Slaughtering and severing ghostly brilliance, wind and fire never cease. Thousands upon thousands of heads are cut off, ten thousand upon ten thousand forms are sheared. Demons dare not trespass, ghosts dare not be monstrous. The Three Officials of the Northern Feng inspect the ghostly camps—none may conceal themselves, the golden horse’s courier route. Universally proclaiming without end, all spirits heed.

The Five Emperors of the Three Realms report to the Upper Clarity.

Master Shangyang says: The earlier mention of "today’s recording" refers to the practitioner refining the self to accumulate merit. This mention of "today’s joyous deliverance" refers to refining qi to return the elixir. For the great cultivator, the rarest attainment is today; when lead meets the arising of gui, today; where the yellow sprout arises, today. Having attained today is having attained the proper time. Moreover, possessing both the talent and the person—this is the joyous deliverance.

Passing through the barriers of all heavens, should one desire communion between heaven and humanity, one must first establish sincere communication, beseech the eradication of the Three Evils, sever false karmic ties, cut off the root of earthly existence, and fortify the true nature with steadfast resolve. Gathering and refining the primordial Brahman qi of the Origin, one soars through the Five Gates to return to the origin, thereby inscribing one’s name in the Great Mystery.

The Heavenly Gate is the Gate of Destiny. When entering the chamber, the Demon Kings oversee the true undertaking, ensuring the Gate of Destiny remains unobstructed. As the Green Yang first returns, the Dipper of the East governs reckoning. When the Golden Flower blooms, the Dipper of the West records names. Drawing the yang from Kan, the Northern Dipper marks death. Mending the deficiency in Li, the Southern Dipper bestows life. When qi returns to the Yellow Court, the Central Dipper oversees all spirits.

The Green Emperor, surnamed Chang, styled Jingming, guards the hun-soul and governs the liver. The White Emperor, surnamed Hun, styled Rushou, attends the po-soul and governs the lungs. The Red Emperor, surnamed Yan, styled Dongdan, nurtures qi and governs the heart. The Black Emperor, surnamed Xuan, styled Mingmeng, circulates blood and governs the kidneys. The Yellow Emperor, surnamed Ma, styled Zhongshen, presides over the Yellow Hall at the center, commanding all spirits.

The *Register of the Jade Emperor of the Great Cavern* states: The Five Emperors exist coeval with heaven and earth; when yin and yang first divided, they transformed and gave rise to the Five Phases. For the great cultivator, the Five Emperors descend their spirits to refine the golden liquid, infusing qi to congeal the fetal embryo.

The Demon King of the Green Heaven, surnamed Bin, styled Chicheng. The Demon King of the Red Heaven, surnamed Fo, named Yousu. The Demon King of the White Heaven, surnamed Chi, named Zhangshi. The Demon King of the Black Heaven, surnamed Xu, named Zhishi. The Demon King of the Yellow Heaven, surnamed Tianmen, named Bokuang. All preside over greed and desire, depleting and agitating the spirit-qi, hence they are called Demon Kings.

The Five Emperors and Great Demons are the Heavenly Kings, corresponding to the five organs of the human body. They bestow the power of generation and nurturing, presiding over the wondrous Dao of the golden elixir, carrying out the edicts of the Heavenly Worthy to subdue and command. Each manifests in imperial form, thus they are called the Five Emperors. Dwelling in the Desire Realm, they test practitioners with the demons of form, sound, scent, taste, and touch, hence they are called Great Demons, the ancestors of all spirits and the sovereigns of the body.

Long ago, the Heavenly Worthy descended these five demons, and in the *Comprehensive Divine Writ for Subduing Demons*, commanded the talisman-officers of the Five Emperors to guard the five directions. The talisman-officer of the Green Emperor is named Qihua; of the Red Emperor, Mingzhen; of the White Emperor, Maocheng; of the Black Emperor, Shouyuan; of the Yellow Emperor, Shengming. Each secures their direction, safeguarding the divine writ to repel demonic trials.

When the Dao is in practice, the Four Emperors and Great Demons submit to it, containing the primordial Brahman qi. They are also called the Myriad Heavens, the Golden Duke, the Grand Unity, or the White Tiger. Only the Great Demon of the Green Emperor of the East belongs here, wielding the handle of life and death. He is also called the Original Spirit of Destiny, the Positionless True Person, or the Vajra Divine King.

Soaring in flight, drumming in procession, the Four Emperors and Great Demons traverse the Three Realms, rallying their retinues to assemble the ghostly troops of the Desire Realm, demonstrating the path of lustful folly. When demons test the practitioner, they brandish banners and beat drums. This Great Demon of the Green Emperor, waving his pennants and striking his standards, though dwelling in the Form Realm, is not swayed by desire. Endowed with the true mandate of primordial Brahman qi, he inspects evil and exhorts goodness, thus he is said to roam and observe the great void. He styles himself the sole sovereign of awe-inspiring majesty, sharing in the generative power of the Four Emperors and the Myriad Heavens.

When the heavens deliver humanity, among the Four Emperors and the Myriad Heavens, the most virtuous is said to be the one who, in delivering humanity, ensures that wondrous transformation begins with strict conduct. He summons the Northern Capital of Fengdu, inspects and severs the root of attachment, to refine and return the elixir. Thus, the Divine Duke receives his mandate.

The Divine Duke is our original spirit, styled Malongshi, named Kuoyi. Endowed with the true mandate of primordial Brahman qi, he sweeps away all inauspicious ghosts of greed and lust. The Eight Mighties spew forth poison—the Eight Mighties being the six senses of eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind, combined with the storehouse and transmission consciousnesses to form the eight consciousnesses, called the Eight Mighties. They expel the poisonous harm of form, sound, scent, taste, touch, and dharmas, preventing disturbance and disorder.

Then the Vajra Divine King mounts a fierce steed with four steeds abreast, dispatching Heavenly Ding as vanguard, advancing with valor and discipline. The great marshal wields his banner, marching with steadfast resolve. Casting fire for ten thousand leagues, its light blazes brilliantly; the flowing bells of the Eight Directions resound with perfect roundness. Should the Four Emperors and the Myriad Heavens dare to interfere, obstructing the heavens’ deliverance of humanity and hindering the true qi of the primordial Origin from returning to the origin, the Vajra Divine King advances with his golden axe, while the mighty Heavenly Warriors wield their massive halberds in punishment. They slaughter the lustful demons of the Five Turbidities with the swiftness of wind and fire, without pause for even half an hour, emphasizing urgency and speed.

A thousand thousand heads are severed, a thousand demons retreat in disarray; ten thousand ten thousand forms are cut down, ten thousand specters flee in terror. Those who do not interfere or transgress remain unharmed.

The Three Officials are the Three Origins. The Northern Fengdu is the true nature. Thus, the Three Origins exclusively govern the true nature, penetratingly illuminating and inspecting the lairs of ghosts and demons, allowing no concealment. The primordial Origin’s Brahman qi is the Golden Horse and the Yellow Path. The post route is swift transmission. This qi races along the Yellow Path to return to the divine chamber, universally proclaiming without end. Wherever this qi arrives, the myriad spirits heed its command. The Three Realms are the Three Fields and the Five Emperors, which are the Five Officials, all arrayed in speech to report their merits to the Supreme Clarity.

By worldly standards, as the scripture states, it is clear even without explanation.

The ode says:
Resplendent and majestic, the true command prevails,
Demons dare not transgress, ghosts lose their might.
Once the ancestral qi returns and the elixir is complete,
The Three Realms report in ranks to the Supreme Clarity.

The *Primal Cavern Jade Chronicle* spans the Dragon Han and Yan Kang eras. Through countless eons, within the primordial chaos, above there was no color, below no abyss. Wind and marsh pervaded the void, the Vajra qi rode the heavens. Between heaven above and heaven below, there was no darkness, no obscurity, no form, no shadow, no limit, no end. The vast Brahman qi stretched boundlessly, without light.

When the Crimson Clarity unfolded the chart, the kalpas turned naturally. The Primordial Origin settled and stabilized, unfolding the Five Scriptures. Crimson writings on jade, the eight mighty dragon scripts, preserved and regulated the kalpic cycles, ensuring the heavens endured forever. The Brahman qi suffused the cosmos, myriad patterns unfolded, the primordial net flowed and evolved, forming the thirty-two heavens. Revolving without form, they circled the ten directions. The Dipper rotated past the Winnowing Basket, cycling through the Five Constants. Thirty-five divisions gathered the qi of the Upper Origin. The Eight Sceneries merged in darkness, qi entered the profound mystery.

Master Shangyangzi said: This second chapter is the pulse of the scripture, the marrow of the elixir. Why? This chapter concerns the refinement of the golden liquid and the return of the elixir, thus revealing the crimson script as the tool for gathering the medicine. From the ten directions, they float through the void to arrive together before the Emperor, where they gather essence and unite spirit. Only today, rejoicing in deliverance, do they finally compose the elixir. Once the primordial qi returns to the origin, the Five Dipper Emperors within the body perform their duties, driving away evil and expelling the yin demons and ghostly qi, thus demonstrating the merit of "ten thousand ten thousand forms cut down."

*Laozi* says: "Inferior virtue acts with deliberate purpose." This describes the present chapter. This chapter concerns the refinement of the jade liquid great elixir, thus revealing the *Jade Chronicle* as the beginning of the kalpic record. The absence of darkness and obscurity, form and shadow, arises because the qi, having just returned, has not yet settled. Once the Primordial Origin’s Brahman qi stabilizes, myriad patterns unfold, leading to the ascension of the myriad qi as immortals.

The *Nine Grades Scripture* says: In ancient times, during the primordial chaos before the division of the heavens, the Primordial Origin first took shape. In the fifth kalpa, the initial transformation began, and the Brahman Origin Ancestral Dawn Dao Lord was commanded to record the celestial origin, governing the five kalpas. Thus, the *Primal Cavern* signifies the completion of the ancestral qi, while the *Jade Chronicle* records the celestial origin.

From the division of the primordial qi, the three causes formed the nine. Like dragons or stalks, they coiled through the nine paths, boundless and infinite, encompassing the origin of the nine yang ancestral qi. The Most High then harmonized the Brahman qi, initiating the ancestral qi of the Azure Heaven. Thus, the East received nine qi to divide its celestial realm, the kalpa named Dragon Han. The South received three qi to divide its realm, the kalpa named Crimson Clarity. The Center received twelve qi to divide its celestial realm, the kalpa named Supreme August. The West received seven qi to divide its realm, the kalpa named Yan Kang. The North received five qi to divide its celestial realm, the kalpa named Kai Huang. Once the five kalpas had run their course, the vast heavens took form. The primordial qi merged with the Dao, the Eight Sceneries radiated light. The Eight Emperors manifested, the Nine Empyreans differentiated, coalescing the five yang qi of the Primal Cavern into the *Jade Chronicle*. The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign was then commanded to record the initial kalpic cycles of the Primal Cavern, the origin of the revolving kalpas, and the merits of the Heavenly Perfected and Heavenly People in cultivating immortality, along with the path of ascent and retreat.

The Azure Origin Perfected said: The formation of heaven and earth began in the Dragon Han and ended in the Yan Kang. How many times have they nearly formed, nearly collapsed? Beyond reckoning. Hence, it is called "countless." With each kalpic destruction, heaven and earth dissolve, mountains and seas melt away, all phenomena vanish, leaving no trace of form or substance. Only the qi of the Primal Cavern remains undivided, indistinctly beginning its construction—this is called the primordial chaos. At this time, the true unity of water was enveloped in darkness, the five phases yet unformed. Above, there was no color; below, no abyss. Above, wind; below, marsh. The void was pervaded by emptiness, the Vajra qi bearing the root of heaven. "Obscurity" refers to what is hidden and manifest; "form and shadow" refer to phenomena. "Limit" refers to boundaries. "Vast expanse" describes boundless space.

Within the primordial chaos, between heaven above and heaven below, hidden and manifest, boundless and vast, phenomena were indistinguishable. Boundaries were undefined, only the vast Brahman qi stretched endlessly, without light or shadow. Later, when the golden wind qi rubbed to generate fire, the four images combined to produce earth, which bore heaven and earth and nurtured the myriad beings. This is called the Three Realms’ lofty perfected ones transcending calamitous kalpas. Compared to sentient beings, mired in birth and death, endlessly revolving, the return of the golden elixir to the origin is like enduring the trials of kalpic cycles. Now, fortunately, the Brahman qi has returned to the origin, yet remains without form or image.

When the Crimson Clarity unfolded the chart, in the first year of Crimson Clarity, the *Jade Chronicle* established the record. Heaven and earth, sun and moon, mountains and rivers, phenomena and forms divided and grew—just as the elixir finds its place. The four seasons progressed, each in its proper order, thus it is called "the kalpas turn naturally," akin to the primordial work of the elixir.

The Primordial Origin settled and stabilized, unfolding the Five Scriptures. The Primordial Origin observed the Brahman qi coalescing into form, carving jade into cloud-seal celestial scripts, bearing the five wondrous elements of the primordial spirit and true Dao. Thus, it is called the Five Scriptures. Those who awaken to its wonders enter its wonders; those who awaken to its origin enter its origin; those who awaken to its spirit enter its spirit; those who awaken to its truth enter its truth; those who awaken to its Dao enter its Dao.

Thus, exhausting wonder merges with the Primordial Origin; exhausting the Primordial Origin merges with spirit; exhausting spirit merges with truth; exhausting truth merges with the Dao.

The script is refined by fire, hence called the "Red Writ." The Eight Mighty Dragon Scripts depict the forms of the Azure Dragon, Giant Wyrm, Golden Master, Qilin, White Tiger, Dark Leopard, Vermilion Serpent, and Great Xiezhi—these are the Eight Might. Their script safeguards against kalpic destruction, ensuring the heavens endure forever.

The Brahman qi pervades all, transformed from the primordial qi. Established before heaven and earth, it is the root of the Great Dao. The Primordial Origin relies upon it to govern the cosmos; heaven and earth depend on it for generation and completion. It blankets the Three Realms and envelops the myriad heavens. Once the Two Modes unfolded, all phenomena and forms spread forth—thus it is said, "the ten thousand patterns open and expand." The Brahman qi is the guiding principle of primordial transformation, flowing through the Thirty-Two Heavens like a turning wheel. From the Formless Realm, it circulates through the ten directions, from the Dipper to the Winnowing Basket, revolving through the Five Constants. With the sun, moon, five planets, and twenty-eight constellations, it forms the Thirty-Five Divisions. Receiving the qi of the Supreme Heavenly Origin, the Eight Luminaries merge in profound obscurity to accomplish the mysterious work—thus it is said, "qi enters the Mysterious of Mysterious." All this is likened to the elixir’s formation of the fetal embryo.

The ode states:
Though formless and traceless, seek its thread,
A single qi circulates, revealing sacred work.
Most wondrous is the numinous elixir’s place—
Expanding the ten thousand patterns, vast are its divine powers.

Within the Mysterious, the Supreme August One, the Lofty Perfected of the Emperor,
Drifts upon the grand auroras, chanting the cavernous chapters.
The Golden Perfected shines resplendent, its echoes flowing through the cloud camps;
Jade tones gather qi, numinous winds amass mist.
The Purple Void flourishes in elegance, aiding the myriad immortals.

A thousand harmonies, ten thousand unions—naturally perfected in truth;
Within truth dwells spirit, the Great Lord of Longevity.
The Peerless Duke, the White Prime Honored Spirit,
The Great One who Oversees Destiny, Peach Vitality and Union Longevity,
Grasp talismans and hold registers, preserving life and rooting existence.
Ascending to the Supreme Clarity, entering and exiting the Flowery Chamber,
Within the Eight Obscurities, amid the subtlest realms,
They descend to guard the human body, settling in the Muddy Pellet and Crimson Palace.
Centering the five qi, blending the hundred spirits,
Ten revolutions return the numinous, ten thousand qi unite in immortality.
The immortal Dao values life, boundlessly delivering beings.

Above, the Eight Gates open, the Dharma Wheel of Flying Heaven turns.
Sin and fortune, prohibitions and precepts, karmic causes and conditions—
Universally received and delivered, the dead soul revives in a new body.
Once the body attains rebirth, its name ascends to the myriad heavens.
Above the heavens, each has its Gate of Life.

Master Shangyang said: This elucidates the application of the golden elixir’s Dao.
The "Mysterious Within" is the Celestial Heart, the true center of the human body.
The "Supreme August One" is the Primordial Origin, the ancestral qi—called the Treasure of the Dao.
The "Emperor" is the Lord of the Dao, the Golden Mother—called the Treasure of the Scriptures.
The "Lofty Perfected" is the Venerable Lord, the elixir’s body—called the Treasure of the Dharma.
Together, they form the Three Treasures as One.

The Buddhist explanation speaks of the pure Dharma-body as essence, the perfect Reward-body as wisdom, and the thousand hundred million Transformation-bodies as practice. Essence and life unite; yin contracts while yang expands. Drifting upon the grand auroras, chanting the cavernous chapters—
The Brahman qi first arises, floating and swimming within primordial harmony.
The Golden Duke suddenly returns, joyously chanting the verses of the cavernous chapters.
The Golden Perfected shines resplendent, golden qi circulating, its echoes flowing through the cloud camps.
Qi camps in brilliance; jade tones gather qi—jade liquid refines lead, numinous winds amass mist.
Lead restrains mercury; the Purple Void flourishes in elegance—mercury congeals into purple blossoms, aiding the myriad immortals.
With external merits complete, a thousand harmonies and ten thousand unions smelt into one mass—naturally perfected in truth.
The fetal embryo formed, within truth dwells spirit—the embryo has consolidated spirit.
The Everlasting Lord governs the heart; the Peerless governs the liver; the White Prime governs the lungs; the Great One governs the head; the Overseer of Destiny governs the spirit; Peach Vitality governs the spleen; Union Longevity governs the kidneys.
Grasping talismans and holding registers, refining qi to unite with spirit,
Ascending to the Supreme Clarity, Brahman qi rises upward, entering and exiting the Flowery Chamber from crown to sole.
The head has the Three Flowery Courts; the body has the Curved and Secret Chambers.
Within the Eight Obscurities, qi circulates everywhere; amid the subtlest realms, it reaches all places.
Descending to guard the human body, ascending to the Muddy Pellet, descending to the Crimson Palace;
Centering the five qi, dwelling in the Yellow Court, uniting the hundred spirits.
Ten revolutions return the hundred numinous powers to me; ten months unite the ten thousand qi in immortality.
A body beyond the body—the Perfected One manifests.
The immortal Dao values longevity; the Most High boundlessly delivers beings.
The Eight Gates include the Gate of Longevity; the Dharma Wheel is the path of revolving transformation.
The worldly have sins and fortunes; the immortals of karmic destiny rely solely on precept merits and causal conditions.
Form and spirit universally receive deliverance; all dead souls attain rebirth.
This body achieves longevity, its name ascending to the myriad heavens.
The heavens review merits and deeds, determining the Gate of Life according to rank.
Those with great merit serve in the Golden Towers; those with perfected conduct ascend to the ranks of immortals.

Master Shangyang of the Southern Marchmount, attending Master Zhao, heard someone recite the *Scripture of Deliverance* and asked: "What is meant by 'Vajra'?"
The Heaven-Riding Master replied: "Do not be confused. Let us begin from the start.
First, I ask you: what is the *Chaotic Crimson Writ*?"
The disciple bowed and asked: "Upon hearing these four words, my whole body broke into a cold sweat."
At that moment, he awakened, penetrating this scripture in one stroke.
The master then said: "Now you understand the Vajra Heaven-Riding."
The disciple replied: "My entire body is drenched in sweat."
The master said: "Inquiry must be true inquiry; awakening must be true awakening. Speak further of what lies beyond."
The disciple said: "Now I have transcended the Formless Realm."
The master snapped his fingers and said: "Thus, thus! Such words are the thrust of the sword’s edge. Neither sin nor fortune, prohibitions nor precepts—how recklessly you reveal them!
The scripture’s essence relies on this. In the future, even the Demon King of the Yutian Heaven will surely endorse you."
This scripture’s sublimity is beyond measure, hence it is the supreme treasure of the Three Caverns and the foremost of the Daoist Canon.

Yet the intent of the Primordial Origin lies solely in preserving the Dao/Way.
Expounding scriptures clarifies the Dao/Way, that people may revere it;
Revealing scriptures unfolds the Dao/Way, that people may practice it.
Thus the Dao/Way is the essence of scripture, and scripture the function of the Dao/Way.
Through scripture the Dao/Way is revealed; through the Dao/Way scripture is sought.

Worldly commoners, upon hearing scripture, show reverence;
Upon hearing the Dao/Way, they laugh.
Encountering scripture, they chant it aloud with fervor;
Hearing the Dao/Way, they gather to slander it.
Yet the Dao/Way is the mother, scripture the child—
Never has the world loved the child while reviling the mother.

The Dao/Way is that by which heaven and earth unfold,
By which sun and moon are raised,
By which wind and rain are dispensed,
By which thunder and lightning are commanded.
Yet when people hear thunder and lightning, they cover their ears;
When they hear the Dao/Way, they ridicule it.
Though the Most High is merciful and does not punish,
How dire is the self-inflicted downfall of such people!

What is the Dao/Way? What is scripture?
That which completes the transformations of yin and yang is called the Dao/Way;
That which fulfills the essence and function of life and nature is called scripture.
Without yang to balance yin, it cannot be the Dao/Way;
Without function to complement essence, it cannot be scripture.
Thus the Dao/Way is the root of yin and yang,
And scripture the function of life and nature.
To unite true nature with primordial life is to pair yin and yang;
To harmonize outer form with inner spirit is to complete essence and function.

The Dao/Way of the Primordial Origin’s returning elixir is akin to the conception of human life.
When a person receives the essence and blood of ordinary parents,
It too begins as a formless, chaotic vastness.
Once essence and blood settle, in the first month it becomes an embryo;
In the second, a fetus;
In the third, the hun-soul is born;
In the fourth, the po-soul is fixed;
In the fifth, the five viscera take shape;
In the sixth, the six bowels open;
In the seventh, the seven orifices become clear;
In the eighth, the eight luminous scenes are complete;
In the ninth, the limbs are fully formed;
In the tenth, the qi is whole, and the child emerges from the womb.

The Dao/Way of the returning elixir follows the same pattern.
When it receives the wondrous qi of the numinous father and sagely mother,
Only after nine harmonies and ten unions does the golden qi arrive—
Also a formless, chaotic vastness, an empty and boundless expanse,
Without color or depth to rely upon,
Without form or shadow to depend on.
Once the primordial qi is settled,
The five phases unfold,
Enveloping and revolving in silent fusion,
Radiant and resplendent,
Returning to the void,
Gathering and nurturing,
Conceiving and bearing the true.
The five viscera are born,
The five qi are ordered,
The hundred spirits are united,
The fetal immortal is knit—
This is called the yang-spirit, emerging and transforming through divine power.
Yet while ordinary people receive the essence and blood of mortal parents to form their bodies,
The golden elixir is nurtured by the numinous father and sagely mother,
Enabling transformation and flight—
This is the dual cultivation of life and nature, the wondrous union of form and spirit.

A hymn says:
*By this scripture, the hundred spirits merge in harmony;
This scripture’s sublimity is most clear.
Within the heavens, the celestial qi perfects the fetal immortal;
The myriad qi ascend together as immortals to the Jade Capital.*

Within it are the empty and resounding chants,
The demon-subduing scriptures of the numinous chapters,
Their verses attuned to the loftiest perfected beings.

First, the celestial hymns of the Desire Realm in flight:
*The human path is faint, the immortal path vast.
The ghostly path delights—yet it is the gateway of human life.
The heavenly path values life, the ghostly path values death.
The immortal path is ever auspicious, the ghostly path ever ominous.
O exalted, pure, and numinous soul,
Sing your lament, resounding through the great void!
I wish only for the immortal path’s fulfillment,
Not for the human path’s exhaustion.*

*The Northern Capital, the Spring-Curved Prefecture,
Holds a host of ten thousand ghosts.
They seek only to cut short human destiny,
To sever the gateway of life.*
The adept sings the cavernous chapters,
To subdue the Northern Feng.
Binding and dispatching demonic spirits,
Severing the blades of the six ghosts.
*The qi of the heavens surges boundlessly;
My Dao/Way flourishes day by day.*

Master Shangyang said: *The Scripture of Numinous Treasure Methods* states that the cavernous chapters are the *Cinnabar Yellow, Flying Mystery, Purple Writ* of Mount Gui—
Not the work of demon kings.
When Perfected Lord Yin attended the Most High on the Western Terrace of Mount Gui,
He entered the Seven Treasures Garden,
Observed the proper method of its composition,
And disseminated these three chapters to the world,
That people might awaken and transcend the Three Realms.

In ancient times, when the Heavenly Worthy subdued the demons,
The demon kings all bowed their heads and accepted their charge.
The Heavenly Worthy commanded Demon King Yumo to govern the Desire Realm,
Demon King Moluo to govern the Form Realm,
And Demon King Wuoming to govern the Formless Realm.
Each sang their hymns,
Transforming and soaring through the void,
Warning and admonishing heavenly beings,
Banishing desire-demons.
That people, upon hearing these celestial hymns in flight,
Might turn from the suffering of sensual desire
And return to the gate of purity.

From the Yellow Citadel to the Mafi Realm is the Desire Realm;
When the six desires are wholly purified, one ascends to the Form Realm.
*The human path is faint, its yang lost in obscurity;
The immortal path is vast, lofty and hard to fathom.*
The *Gateway of Life* is the portal of human and all beings’ birth,
The gateway of becoming an immortal or a buddha.
Perfected Lord Zhongli said:
*The gate that gives me life is the door that takes my death*—
This is that very gate.
If one fails to awaken, desire-demons delight in this gateway.

The *Exalted, Pure, and Numinous Soul*—
The exalted one, with a pure heart and numinous nature,
Sings with forthright lament,
Pitying the deluded,
Their chants resounding through the great void.
Master Ge’s *Song of the Flowing Pearl* says:
*Flowing pearl, flowing pearl,
You drive me to toil endlessly.
Hurrying, bustling,
Forgetting sleep and food.
Now at sixty, I fear the three wretched destinies.
A perfected one delivers me—
It takes a great man!*
Pondering these words,
Is this not the lament resounding through the great void?

The intent of the Most High in leaving these scriptures
Is that the world’s people cultivate and realize the immortal path,
Not that they follow the deviant path to their ultimate ruin.

The *Northern Capital, Spring-Curved Prefecture*—
The world’s sea of desire—
Holds a host of ten thousand ghosts,
All of the realm of sensual forms.
If one is lost in infatuation,
They will cut short one’s destiny and sever the root of life.
The adept, dwelling in the Form Realm,
Sings the cavernous chapters at times,
Subduing Feng of the North.
For the Northern Feng is the root of human desire.
When the root of desire stirs,
Feng arises in billowing black clouds,
The six ghosts clash their blades,
And demonic spirits rush forth in a deluge of suffering.

When the adept reaches this stage,
They must subdue and transform it,
Turning the Realm of Desire into Eternal Bliss,
Refining the elixir to transmute ghosts and demons into the hosts of heaven.
By bestowing the numinous medicine,
The radiant qi of golden light billows forth,
And my Dao of the elixir flourishes day by day.

A hymn says:
Busy day and night, sharp and clever,
Who distinguishes hell from heaven?
With a cold eye, observe the floating world,
Awaken the adept to sing the cavernous chapters.

**Second: The Chapter of the Color Realm’s Demon Kings**

Lofty and vast, resplendent,
Luminous qi soars in the four directions.
The Brahma-conduct heavens encircle the ten directions,
Boundless great spirits—all arise from my body.
I possess the cavernous chapters,
Ten thousand recitations make one an immortal.
The Dao of immortals values deliverance,
While the ghostly path clings to the Realm of Color.
Heaven and earth stretch boundless,
Defiled qi swirls thickly.
The bliss of the Three Realms—
Pass beyond it to abide forever.
When the body crosses my realm,
It merges with the natural.
At this moment of bliss,
All is by my grace.
The Dragon Han era flows on—
How can one discern the true?
My realm is hard to cross,
Thus I compose the cavernous scriptures.
Transforming and soaring through the void,
I test your body.
Success or failure, slackening or retreat—
How few are those who cross!
I laugh at those who do not cross,
Thus I sing this melody.

From the Heaven of Self-Exceeding Conduct to the Heaven of Cloud Vows,
Eighteen heavens comprise the Realm of Color.
The people of these heavens possess form but no desire,
Distinguished by coarse, fine, and subtle dust—eighteen specks in all.
When the dust’s defilements are wholly purified,
One ascends to the Formless Realm.

Lofty and vast, the heavens of color stretch far and wide,
Luminous qi soars in the four directions,
Brahma-qi shines brightly,
Boundless great spirits.
My body is tested by demons,
The cavernous chapters recited ten thousand times,
All habitual tendencies forgotten.
The Dao of immortals values deliverance,
Emerging from the Realm of Color.
The ghostly path entices people,
Clinging to the Realm of Color.

Master Danyang, a wealthy man of the Eastern Land,
Indulged in pleasure day and night.
Patriarch Chongyang specially sought to deliver him.
At their first meeting, he said:
“I come to support a drunken man.”
Danyang angrily asked: “What is the Dao?”
He replied: “Where the five phases do not reach.”
Danyang had a great awakening,
Followed him to study, and ascended as an immortal.
Is this not the value the Dao of immortals places on deliverance?

Heaven and earth stretch boundless,
The bounds of the color realm endless.
The *Nanhua Sutra* says:
Things come without end,
But my mind has its limits.
Defiled qi swirls thickly,
Congealing and not dispersing.
The bliss of the Three Realms—
Pass beyond it to abide forever.
Beyond this Realm of Color,
Transcend the heavens of the Three Realms,
Ascend to the Upper Clarity,
And there you may abide forever.
When the body crosses my realm,
It merges with the natural,
Transcending the forms of color,
No longer deluded by them.
Attaining great freedom,
All is by my grace.
Through the scriptures, one awakens to the Dao.
The Dragon Han era flows on—
True and false cannot be distinguished.
My realm is hard to cross.
If the forms of color are not eradicated,
How can one escape the demonic realm?
Thus I compose the cavernous scriptures to encourage you.
Again, transforming and soaring through the void,
I test you with demons.
Few succeed; many fail, slacken, or retreat.
I laugh at those who cannot emerge from this realm of color,
Thus I sing this song.

A hymn says:
In the heavens of the Color Realm, eighteen specks of dust—
If this mind is not pure, it is not true.
To know how hard my realm is to cross,
Ask how many now cross it.

**Third: The Song of the Formless Realm’s Demon King**

Above the Three Realms,
The vast and distant Great Luo.
No root of color above,
Clouds tower in layers.
Only the Primordial Beginning,
The home of kalpas vast,
Governs my realm,
Presiding over the Mysterious Capital.
Those who transgress my realm
Enter the Jade Void.
I, the supreme king,
Rectify and govern the hosts of demons.
Ten thousand transformations in the void,
Defiled qi blooms like flowers.
Few preserve the true,
Many are deluded.
The Dao of immortals is hard to stabilize,
The ghostly path easily turns deviant.
The human path lies in the heart—
Truly, it does not depend on others.
The Dao of immortals values substance,
The human path values splendor.
If you do not delight in the Dao of immortals,
How can you pass the Three Realms?
If you turn to the five paths of desire,
What can I do for you?

From the Heaven of Luminous Courts to the Four Heavens of Elegant Joy is the Primordial Color Realm.
The *Statutes of the Supreme Perfected* says:
In the Formless Realm,
The utmost true are without emotion,
Both color and desire empty,
No longer troubled by form or substance.
When cultivation reaches one heaven,
Only mind and consciousness remain.
Entering the qi-observation,
When qi-observation is perfected,
One ascends to the next heaven.
Again, one can eliminate mind and consciousness,
Attaining non-action,
And ascend further.
If the myriad dharmas reside in the mind,
Whether existent or non-existent,
One ascends again.
If qi-observation becomes wondrous,
All habitual tendencies forgotten,
Merging with the natural,
One ascends to the Heaven of Seed People.

The *Sutra of the Fundamental Limit* says:
Afflictions are knots,
Learning and practice are habits.
When knots and habits are exhausted,
One transcends the rank of seed people,
Merges with the Dao’s realm,
And rises or falls with the qi,
Beyond the reach of calamity.

Master Qingyuan of the Azure Origin says:
Though in the Formless Realm one can leave defilement and forget color,
One still cannot dispel forgetfulness,
And mind and consciousness remain a trouble.
Thus defiled qi blooms like flowers,
And the ghostly path easily turns deviant.
If control is momentarily lost,
One falls into the Realm of Color.
One must forget the mind,
Naturally dispel and observe emptiness to enter the wondrous.

The *Scripture of Lord Lao* says:
What is empty is already non-existent,
Even non-existence is non-existent.
Profoundly and constantly quiescent—
Only then is it true stillness.

Formerly, the Immortal Liu Changsheng of the Prodigal Son
Spent three years in Luoyang,
Daily observing emptiness and dispelling forgetfulness.
When the root of attachment stirred,
He would recite:
“The Northern Capital, Spring-Curved Prefecture,
Holds a host of ten thousand ghosts.
They only desire to cut short one’s destiny,
Sever the gate of life.”
Reciting this song,
The root of attachment was suddenly severed.
Is this not the adept singing the cavernous chapters
To subdue the Northern Feng?

This is true and solid work—
What the Dao of immortals values as substance.
The world is all infatuated,
Not delighting in the Dao of immortals.
Turning the wheel of the five sufferings,
What skill can one employ?
What can be done?

A hymn says:
In the heavens of the Formless Realm, so much grinding and nothingness—
This time, let your mind not be muddled.
These are not idle flowers and grasses,
But the true body entering the Jade Void.

Above the Three Realms,
In the midst of soaring through the void,
The demon kings’ songs,
Their melodies interwoven with the cavernous chapters.

Reciting it a hundred times, one crosses the Southern Palace;
A thousand times, demon kings come to safeguard and welcome;
Ten thousand times, the Way is complete—ascending to fly through the Great Void.
Passing beyond the Three Realms,
One’s rank attains that of an immortal lord.

Hearing the numinous sound,
Demon kings show reverence in form,
Commanding earth spirits to attend and escort.
Drawn forth from the earthly gate,
The five sufferings and eight hardships are overcome.
Seven generations of ancestors ascend,
Forever departing the demonic palace.
The soul crosses Crimson Mound,
Refined and reborn—
This is called boundless,
Universally delivering the limitless.

There are secret celestial texts,
Revered by all heavens.
To leak or slight them is to fall into hell,
Bringing calamity upon seven generations of ancestors.

Above the Three Realms,
There is nothing not inhabited by demon kings.
Amidst flight through the void,
Everywhere songs and hymns resound—
Demons test one’s resolve,
Yet they may aid the wondrous Way,
Thus interweaving with the cavernous chapters.

The Heavenly Worthy expounded the recitation of scriptures,
Enlightening worldly people to practice the Way.
Reciting it a hundred times
Is like the first return of primordial qi—
Thus it is called crossing the Southern Palace.
A thousand times
Is like the formation of the fetal embryo—
Thus demon kings safeguard and welcome.
Ten thousand times, the Way is complete,
The embryo transforms and the spirit departs—
Thus one flies and ascends to the Great Void.

This is called the completion of the Way.
Without cultivating the Way,
Merely reciting it ten thousand times in hope of ascension
Would be difficult indeed.
When the merit of scripture is perfected,
One crosses the Three Realms;
When the elixir’s work is fulfilled,
One’s rank attains that of an immortal lord.

Hearing the numinous sound—
Once in ten thousand kalpas—
Demon kings show reverence in form,
For the Way is lofty and virtue profound.
Commanding earth spirits
Is the decree of primordial qi.
Earth is the flowing *wu* of *wu* merging with *si*,
Returning to the root and restoring the origin.
Drawn forth from the earthly gate,
Yin dissolves and yang grows.
The five sufferings and eight hardships
Transcend the reckoning of the five phases,
Uprooting the eight consciousnesses’ roots.
Forever departing the demonic palace,
Yin severs the gate of *kun*,
The soul crosses Crimson Mound,
Yang gathers in the palace of *li*.

There are secret celestial texts.
For those who study the Way,
Beholding the scriptures, they treasure and cherish them;
Refining the elixir, they cultivate in seclusion and secrecy.
This is called "secret."
Revered by all heavens,
When the elixir’s Way and the scriptures are both complete,
All heavens revere and look up to them.

What is meant by "leaking and slighting"?
To act carelessly and recklessly,
Hearing but not practicing,
Or practicing without secrecy—
All incur the calamity of leaking and slighting,
Fearing a fall into hell.
As for bringing calamity upon ancestors,
This is to exhaust one’s primordial qi,
Then blame the alchemical scriptures as false,
Or call the Most High’s words empty—
Would they not reflect upon their own fault in leaking and slighting?

A hymn says:
Why do hymns interweave with cavernous chapters?
Only because of hell and heaven.
Knowing that hell is created by the mind alone,
One should strive toward heaven in earnest.

The Dao says:
These two chapters are the hidden sounds of the Celestial Thearchs and the most numinous demon kings,
All words of the Great Brahma,
Not common speech of the world.
Their language lacks ornate beauty,
Their melodies lack florid embellishment—
Thus they are called profound and obscure,
Difficult to fathom in detail.

Treasured by heaven,
They are secreted in the Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace of the Dark Capital,
Transmitted once every forty thousand kalpas according to the Mysterious Statutes.
If a perfected person pledges gold and treasures with sincerity,
Following the old protocols to swear oaths before the Ten Heavens,
Only then are they entrusted.

Master Shangyang said:
This scripture crowns all others,
For its beginning and end correspond,
Its front and back follow in sequence.
As in the upper scroll,
The Heavenly Perfected One recorded the Jade Dawn,
The Dao Lord narrated the words of the Primordial Heavenly Worthy—
That ten thousand generations later,
Those who recite this scripture
Are as if personally witnessing the events of that time.
This is its wonder.

The present chapter and the *Jade Calendar* are the main scriptures.
The demon kings’ songs of the Three Realms,
Appended after these two chapters,
Do not belong to the main scriptures.
Yet because their texts test the practitioner’s merit extensively,
They are interwoven at the end of the *Primal Cavern*—
Thus called "sounds interweaving with cavernous chapters."
What follows are the Heavenly Perfected One’s further transmissions of the Dao Lord’s words.

These two chapters are the *Crimson Text of the Chaotic Cavern* and the *Jade Calendar of the Primal Cavern*.
The *Crimson Text of the Chaotic Cavern* clarifies the returning elixir of the primordial, original, and mysterious One;
The *Jade Calendar of the Primal Cavern* clarifies the wondrous Way of the posterior, effortless, and perfectly true.
These two chapters,
Unique and unparalleled,
Are the hidden sounds of all Celestial Thearchs—
Nothing but the interplay of yin and yang.
The most numinous demon kings
Fully rely on spiritual efficacy,
Their hidden sounds the mysterious pass of the One Aperture.
The words of the Great Brahma—
Lead, silver, cinnabar, mercury—
In scripture, they are the hidden secrets of the Celestial Thearchs and demon kings;
In the elixir, they are the Brahma-words of the Mysterious Female’s knife and measure,
Not common speech of the world.

Foolish people of the world open their mouths to discuss the Way,
Yet do not know what the Way is,
Nor what its substances are for—
This is called "not common speech of the world."
Their language lacks ornate beauty—
True words are not embellished;
Their melodies lack florid embellishment—
Flourish is not substance.
Thus they are called profound and obscure.
Though Yan and Min were wise, they could not guess;
Though Huang and Lao had no teacher, they could not comprehend—
Treasured by heaven.
The first scripture alone is secreted in the celestial palace,
Not commonly used in the world.
Transmitted once every forty thousand kalpas,
It is not to be given to just anyone.
The "perfected person" is one of utmost sageliness.
Pledging gold and treasures is exchanging wealth for the Dharma.

Gold and treasures are what the world values.
Foolish people take gold and treasures as their lives;
Petty men take fame and rank as their lives;
Righteous scholars take reputation and integrity as their lives;
Perfected persons take virtue and the Way as their lives.
Thus perfected persons refine the nine-return divine elixir of golden liquid,
Using gold and treasures as Dharma-wealth.
With Dharma but no wealth, matters seldom succeed;
With wealth but no Dharma, one is no different from a fool.
When scriptures circulate,
Dharma and wealth are both employed.
Following the protocols to swear oaths,
Only then may they be entrusted.
To act presumptuously and recklessly is difficult to complete.
This is the explanation of its use in the Way.

As for worldly matters,
One has never seen someone pledge gold and treasures as earnest money to request a scroll of scripture—
Even in forty thousand kalpas, none would exist.
Why?
How would they know this scripture contains the Way of long life and enduring vision?

If one speaks of the application of the Dao, such cases may yet exist. Why? Those of superior roots and proper Dharma-vessels, by virtue of karmic affinities from past lives, have already gained some understanding within the alchemical scriptures. Though they may not yet fully grasp the profound essence, upon suddenly hearing the sublime truths of this sutra, they offer gold and treasures in unwavering faith.

The methods of nine-return and seven-reversion require the external medicine to merge with the internal medicine. Without gold and treasures as earnest, how could one obtain the wonders of this sutra? How could one subdue the tiger to descend the dragon? How could one draw the primordial qi from the midst of emptiness?

In this present age, when foolish and impure men hear of Dharma-wealth, they invariably burst into laughter, claiming that cultivators must be utterly destitute, stripped bare, and devoted solely to rigid sitting, drifting into hollow stillness. Such people toil in vain until old age, never understanding the use of gold and treasures to seek the wondrous sutra. This is the principle of employing both Dharma and wealth.

The Perfected of Mystery and Silence’s *Entering the Chamber Poem* says:
*Entering the chamber, what makes it unique?*
*Golden flowers bloom day after day.*
*The numinous sprout rises from the earth,*
*Fragrant medicine descends from the heavens.*

It also states:
*To yearn for the treasure of heaven,*
*One must first move worldly wealth.*
*Within the jade caves of Penglai,*
*The nine-returned cup is brewed.*

The Perfected Wang Ding says:
*If mortals seek the affairs of heaven,*
*They must first use the wealth of the world.*
For the treasure of heaven and the affairs of heaven are the subtle mechanisms of immortals’ practice—far removed from the deluded grasping of heterodox paths.

When Faduo Migajia received the master’s teaching, he asked, “How should one repay?”
The master replied, “If you prepare five hundred *kārṣāpaṇa*, it will fully express your profound sincerity.”
Thereupon, Migajia searched the earth, and having gathered them, presented this verse:
*Abundant wealth, many treasures,*
*Spring’s attributes all fulfilled.*
*Certain of bodhi,*
*Ever abiding in the Dharma.*

This verse left by Faduo Migajia, the teacher of gods and men, serves as the eye and guide for later generations to realize the Dao and attain Buddhahood—unlike the practices of heretical demons. Carefully observing these words, one sees that this sutra must be entrusted only after pledging gold and treasures with sincerity, thereby attaining its wonders.

The ode says:
*Unmoved by even a speck of wealth,*
*How can gold and treasures ferry others?*
*I, of Qingcheng, was personally entrusted,*
*For the elixir of return, only the tiger and dragon suffice.*

**End of the Middle Scroll of the *Commentary on the Supreme and Wondrous Scripture of the Primordial Limitless Salvation of Beings*, Upper Chapter**

**The Lower Scroll of the *Explanatory Commentary on the Supreme and Wondrous Scripture of the Primordial Limitless Salvation of Beings from the Numinous Treasure of the Cavernous Mystery***
*Commentary by Chen Guanzhen of Shangyang*

The Dao says:
The revolutions of heaven and earth also have their ends;
The sun, moon, and five planets also wax and wane;
Even the most sagely and divine persons also have their limits;
And the ignorant and unlearned also suffer illness and harm.

For all such calamities, those of shared qi must unite in heart to perform purification rites, burn incense in the six periods, and recite the scripture ten times—whereupon virtue and power will descend at once, dissolving all inauspicious omens. The boundless text universally delivers the limitless.

Master Shangyang says: When the revolutions of heaven and earth are spoken of in terms of the Dao, then the human body receives the central qi of heaven and earth. The head resembles heaven, the feet resemble earth—thus the human body is called a small heaven and earth. The transformations of heaven and earth give birth to humans and all beings; the transformations of the human body give birth to buddhas and immortals.

The *Lingbao Complete Methods* states: The Dao gives birth to the myriad things. Among them, heaven and earth are the greatest, and humans are the most numinous. If one seeks the Dao separately, humans are equal to heaven and earth. The heart corresponds to heaven, the kidneys to earth; the liver is yang, the lungs are yin. Rising and falling, gazing upward and downward, one may fathom their mechanism. Beginning and ending, measuring and calculating, one may grasp their principle.

The *Book of Changes* says: Heaven is noble, earth is lowly—thus Qian and Kun are established.
The *Laozi* says: There is a thing formed in chaos, born before heaven and earth. I know not its name, so I style it the Dao.

Master Zhang the Perfected says:
When sweet dew descends, heaven and earth unite;
Where the yellow sprout arises, Kan and Li merge.
First take Qian and Kun as the crucible and vessel,
Then gather the crow and hare to refine the medicine.

Thus, the golden elixir uses heaven and earth as its crucible and vessel.

In worldly reckoning, the revolutions of heaven and earth are vast—ancients took the great unity as heaven. The scripture says: Within the realm are four great things: the Dao is great, heaven is great, earth is great, and the king is also great.

The *Huntian Theory* likens heaven to an egg, with earth like the yolk within. The great earth lies within the body of heaven. The north and south poles of heaven are like the pivot and axle of a wheel. Heaven rotates once in a day and night, circling the two poles without leaving its original place. The comparison of heaven to an egg refers to its imperfectly round shape—ancients knew the resemblance of its form and thus used it as an analogy. It merely illustrates that earth lies within heaven, and heaven envelops earth.

Master Yuanduzi says: Heaven is like a brocade ball, containing a half-sphere of water. Upon the water floats a board, which represents the great earth. The objects placed on the board represent the myriad kinds of humans. The ball constantly rotates, yet the objects on the board remain unaware. Heaven rotates day and night, while earth abides within it. Humans and beings upon the earth remain unmoving—this analogy of the floating board is most apt.

The *Huntian Theory*’s claim that earth lies within the body of heaven does not mean heaven’s body is visible. Rather, observing the rising and setting of the stars in the east and west, governed by the two poles with fixed degrees and no cessation, one infers the stars’ attachment and posits it as the body of heaven.

The *Gexiang* states: The body of heaven is round like a pellet, and the center of this round body is the target of the six directions. All around, above and below, it is square and equal—this is called the center of heaven. The center of heaven extends straight upward to the zenith. In ancient times, measuring shadows at Yangcheng yielded the shadow of the zenith’s exact center. Gazing upward at the North Pole, its emergence and submergence above and below the earth total thirty-six degrees—this is the center of heaven, not the center of earth. As for the earth’s axis, the center of the four directions should be sought at the farthest reaches of the four seas. The source of the Yellow River is Kunlun, the highest place on earth. The Western Barbarians call it Mount Memuli, from which waters flow in four directions. The mountain lies less than twenty thousand *li* from the Eastern Sea and over thirty thousand *li* from the Western Sea. Yangcheng is closer to the Eastern Sea but farther from Kunlun. Most of the world’s land lies to the west, yet Kunlun still stands in the eastern lands. One must know that the true center of the great earth lies west of Kunlun.

The *Huntian*’s comparison of heaven to an egg, with the yolk as earth, implies less heaven above earth and more below. The *Gexiang* claims the opposite—more heaven above earth and less below—which also has its logic.

Regarding the height of heaven, the *Jade Book* says: Between heaven and earth, the distance above and below is eighty-four thousand *li*, and their qi and substance cannot interact. Heaven seeks Qian from Kun and returns to the center of earth, its yang bearing yin upward. Earth seeks Kun from Qian and returns to the center of heaven, its yin embracing yang downward. Rising and falling, they revolve within the Dao.

The *Sanwu Liji* states: When heaven and earth opened, the clear yang became heaven, and the turbid yin became earth. Pangu was born between them, divine in heaven and sagely on earth. Heaven is extremely high, earth extremely deep, and Pangu extremely tall. Later came the Three Sovereigns, whose numbers began with one, stood upon three, were completed by five, flourished in seven, and resided in nine—thus heaven is ninety thousand *li* from earth.

Both accounts agree: from earth to heaven is ninety thousand *li*, and from earth below to heaven is also ninety thousand *li*—thus the body of heaven is one hundred eighty thousand *li* in height. Anciently, three hundred sixty paces made one *li*. As in previous chapters’ notes on the generation of the various heavens, the hundreds of thousands of *li* mentioned are not literal. They signify that those of superior roots who cut off desire and joy become equal to sages and worthies, far removed from the people of the lower realms.

Similarly, the breadth of the earth: from the eastern shore of the Eastern Sea to the western shore of the Western Sea is over fifty thousand *li*. The width of the seas is another thirty thousand *li*, and beyond the seas, twenty thousand *li*—thus from the farthest east to the farthest west spans one hundred fifty thousand *li*. Compared to the height of one hundred eighty thousand *li*, the *Huntian*’s likening of its shape to an egg is apt.

The Dao of heaven rotates left, circling the three hundred sixty-five and a quarter degrees of the celestial sphere once each day and night, without end.
