chunks.original_text: 无色界之下三十六万里，生色界一十八天； 色界之内，有轻尘六天，细尘六天，粗尘六天。 色界之下三十万里，生欲界六天。 欲界之下五百二十亿万里，化生五亿诸天，八圆世界。 四种民天之上，布日月星辰，主持万物，故曰开明三景。 人之生，亦类是也。 父精母血，包于母腹，精血未凝，如珠似露，凝结之后，生形五瓣，头与四肢； 男子先生左肾，次右命门。 女则反是，本性继种於两贤之间，妙化之炁自然生发，次则上生两瞳神水，以至化生五脏六腑、九窍百脉、筋骨齿发，炁足形金，脱胎而生。 故老君曰：天地媾精，阴阳布化。 一月为胞，精血凝也。 二月为胎形兆胚也。 三月阳神，为三魂，动以生也。 四月阴灵为七魄，静镇形也。 五月五行分五脏，以安神也。 六月六律定六腑，用资灵也。 七月七精开七窍，通光明也。 八月八景神具，降真灵也。 九月宫室罗布，以定精也。 十月炁足，万象成也。 故神布炁满，三万六千关节，根源本始，一时生神。 此为化生诸天，开明三景，是为天根。 《本经》曰：夫道得三乃成，故三合成德。 道不满三，诸事不成。 以内言之，则曰铅、汞、砂，直指其物，则我真性并日用妙化、阴阳二炁合而成三。 上无复祖，唯道为身。 《老君化胡经》曰：道者，元炁虚无，天地从之，而生万物，资之而形，皆祖炁之妙化。 在道则曰金丹，故曰上无复祖，唯道为身也。 五文开廓，普植神灵。 在丹则一炁复而变造五行，五行具而成金胎； 在经则玉字出而结为赤文，五文具而植神灵。 五行者，铅、汞，砂、银、土。 天一生水，坎中藏铅； 地二生火，离中产砂； 天三生木，震龙主汞； 地四生金，兑虎体银； 天五生土，中宫结丹。 道非此不光，文非此不明，身非此不立，丹非此不成，炁非此不度，药非此不生，是为大梵天中之天。 大梵者，先天炁凝而五行大备。 天中之天者，身中有身也。 郁罗萧台，脑际也。 玉山上京，泥丸也。 上极无上，泥丸之上大罗玉清太玄也。 太玄内秘一机，名日月高奔，神化脱胎之要。 《黄庭经》曰：高奔日月吾上道，乃见玉清虚无老。 渺渺劫仞，至高至尊，若亡若存。 即张真人云：视之不可见其形，及至呼之，又却应三华。 离便顶颠，属南。 南本三数，顶为华盖，又曰圆盖。 南属离，离为午位。 三华为金华、玉华、九华。 内丹已结而顶有三华。 大有妙庭，即上丹田，乃百关总会之穴。 金阙玉房，日宫为金阙，左目也； 月宫为玉房，右目也。 森罗，星宿也。 言日月星宿列布，而一身九窍霐澄。 大行梵炁，即先天妙炁。 周回十方，言妙炁营卫，金胎神室，温养大丹。 如上皆道用略注。 尚有至妙之妙，心传方可。 内景既露，外景须明。 今复释以世法，庶几贤愚各具眼目也。 混洞赤文，自混沌之炁结而成赤文，文字既出，而妙经行； 妙经行，则祖炁具在人身，散分于物类之内，是曰无无上真之谓也。 元始祖劫化生诸天。 元始以道祖而镇大劫，以祖炁而化生诸天，祖炁分三炁而隶大罗三清之界，故曰开明三景。 要知此炁遇大劫而不坏，故曰是为天根。 此炁即太极之始炁而生天生地、生五行、生人物已，故曰上无复祖。 道之在人身，亦犹炁之在天地间，故曰唯道为身。
chunks.translated_text:
Beneath the Formless Realm, at a distance of three hundred sixty thousand *li*, lie the Eighteen Heavens of the Form Realm. Within the Form Realm are six Heavens of Light Dust, six Heavens of Fine Dust, and six Heavens of Coarse Dust.

Below the Form Realm, at a distance of three hundred thousand *li*, lie the Six Heavens of the Desire Realm. Beneath the Desire Realm, five hundred twenty billion ten-thousand *li* distant, five hundred million heavens are transformed and generated, along with the Eight Round Worlds.

Above the Four Heavens of Seed People, the sun, moon, and stars are arrayed, governing and sustaining the myriad things—hence called the Three Luminaries of Illumination.

Human birth follows a similar pattern. Father’s essence and mother’s blood gather within the mother’s womb. Before essence and blood congeal, they resemble a pearl or dewdrop; after congealing, the fivefold form takes shape: the head and the four limbs. In males, the left kidney forms first, followed by the right Gate of Life. In females, the reverse occurs. The root of inherent nature continues the lineage between the two kidneys, and the wondrously transforming *qi* naturally arises. Next, the divine waters of the two pupils form above, followed by the generation of the five viscera, six bowels, nine orifices, hundred vessels, sinews, bones, teeth, and hair. When *qi* is sufficient and the form is complete as metal, the fetus emerges from the womb.

Thus, Lord Lao said: "Heaven and Earth unite their essence; yin and yang spread and transform. In the first month, it is the embryo—essence and blood congeal. In the second month, it is the fetus—form begins to take shape. In the third month, the yang spirit becomes the Three Hun, moving to give life. In the fourth month, the yin numen becomes the Seven Po, still to stabilize the form. In the fifth month, the Five Agents divide into the five viscera to settle the spirit. In the sixth month, the Six Pitches determine the six bowels to nourish the numen. In the seventh month, the Seven Essences open the seven orifices to convey radiance. In the eighth month, the Eightfold Splendor of the spirit is complete, descending with true numen. In the ninth month, palaces and chambers are arrayed to secure essence. In the tenth month, *qi* is sufficient, and the myriad images are complete."

Thus, when spirit spreads and *qi* fills the thirty-six thousand joints, the root-source and original beginning simultaneously generate the spirit. This is the transformation and generation of the myriad heavens, the Three Luminaries of Illumination—this is the Heavenly Root.

The *Fundamental Scripture* states: "Only when the Dao attains three is it complete; thus, three unite to form virtue. If the Dao does not reach three, nothing can be accomplished." Internally, this refers to lead, mercury, and cinnabar. Directly pointing to the matter, it is our true nature, the wondrous transformations of daily use, and the union of yin and yang *qi* to form three. Above, there is no further ancestor—only the Dao is the body.

The *Scripture of Lord Lao’s Transformation of the Barbarians* states: "The Dao is the primordial *qi* of emptiness and nothingness. Heaven and Earth follow it to generate the myriad things, which rely upon it for form—all are the wondrous transformations of the ancestral *qi*. In the Dao, this is called the Golden Elixir; thus, it is said, 'Above, there is no further ancestor—only the Dao is the body.'"

The Five Scripts open and expand, universally planting the divine numen. In the Elixir, the One *Qi* returns and transforms to generate the Five Agents; when the Five Agents are complete, the Golden Embryo forms. In the scriptures, the Jade Characters emerge and coalesce into the Red Script; when the Five Scripts are complete, they plant the divine numen.

The Five Agents are lead, mercury, cinnabar, silver, and earth. Heaven One generates water, and within Kan (☵) lies lead. Earth Two generates fire, and within Li (☲) cinnabar is produced. Heaven Three generates wood, and within Zhen (☳) the dragon governs mercury. Earth Four generates metal, and within Dui (☱) the tiger embodies silver. Heaven Five generates earth, and within the Central Palace the Elixir coalesces.

The Dao is not illuminated without these; the scriptures are not clarified without these; the body is not established without these; the Elixir is not completed without these; *qi* is not transcended without these; the medicine is not generated without these—this is the Heaven within the Great Brahmā Heaven. The Great Brahmā is the primordial *qi* congealed, with the Five Agents fully prepared. The Heaven within Heaven means there is a body within the body.

Yu Luo Xiao Terrace is the region of the brain. Jade Mountain’s Upper Capital is the Muddy Pellet. The Utmost Supreme is the Great Canopy of Jade Purity and Supreme Mystery above the Muddy Pellet. Within the Supreme Mystery lies a secret mechanism called the High Ascent of Sun and Moon—the essential method for spirit transformation and shedding the embryo.

The *Yellow Court Scripture* states: "Ascending the sun and moon, I attain the Dao above, and behold the Jade Purity of Emptiness and Nothingness, the Ancient One." Vast and immeasurable, most high and most revered, it is as if absent, as if present. Thus, Master Zhang said: "Gazing upon it, one cannot see its form; yet when calling it, it responds with the Three Flowers."

Li (☲) corresponds to the crown of the head, belonging to the south. The south is originally the number three; the crown is the Flower Canopy, also called the Round Canopy. The south belongs to Li, and Li is the position of *wu* (午). The Three Flowers are Golden Flower, Jade Flower, and Ninefold Flower. When the Inner Elixir has coalesced, the crown bears the Three Flowers.

The Great Wondrous Court is the Upper Cinnabar Field—the cavity where the hundred passages converge. The Golden Gate and Jade Chamber: the Sun Palace is the Golden Gate, the left eye; the Moon Palace is the Jade Chamber, the right eye. The Forest of Stars refers to the constellations. It speaks of the sun, moon, and stars arrayed, and the nine orifices of the body becoming clear and luminous.

The Great Flowing Brahmā *Qi* is the wondrous primordial *qi*. "Circulating through the ten directions" describes the wondrous *qi* nourishing and protecting the Golden Embryo’s divine chamber, warming and nurturing the Great Elixir. The above are brief annotations of Daoist practice. There are yet more wondrous subtleties, which must be transmitted heart-to-heart.

Once the inner landscape is revealed, the outer landscape must also be understood. Now, I further explain in terms of worldly methods, so that the wise and foolish alike may each possess eyes and vision.

The Red Script of Primal Chaos emerges from the *qi* of primordial chaos congealing into the Red Script. Once the script emerges, the wondrous scriptures circulate. When the wondrous scriptures circulate, the ancestral *qi* resides within the human body, dispersing into the categories of things—this is called the Supreme Truth of No-Nothingness.

The Primordial Beginning transformed and generated the myriad heavens through the great kalpas. The Primordial Beginning, as the ancestor of the Dao, governs the great kalpas and, with the ancestral *qi*, transforms and generates the myriad heavens. The ancestral *qi* divides into the Three *Qi*, which belong to the Three Pure Realms of the Great Canopy. Thus, it is called the Three Luminaries of Illumination.

Know that this *qi* remains unharmed even through great kalpas—hence, it is called the Heavenly Root. This *qi* is the primordial *qi* of the Great Ultimate, which generates Heaven and Earth, the Five Agents, and the myriad beings. Thus, it is said, "Above, there is no further ancestor." The Dao within the human body is like the *qi* within Heaven and Earth; thus, it is said, "Only the Dao is the body."

chunks.original_text: 亿乘万骑，浮空而来，倾光回驾，监真度生。 上阳子曰：十方飞天大圣，皆元始道炁分形。 东方讳总，南讳飞，西讳云，北讳无镜，东北讳梵，东南讳那郁，西南讳度仙，西北讳镢炁，上方讳瑛，下方讳落。 一曰十方长生大圣，一曰十方救苦天尊。 奉元始命，掌十方三界校量功德，开度无量，总括生死，陶铸学人。 藏经载八方诸天，皆有无极大千世界。 东方无极诸天安大堂乡大千纳善世界，南方无极诸天宛黎城境大千弃贤世界，西方无极诸天福堂洲大千咸行世界，北方无极诸天郁单野大千清静世界，东北无极诸天福集都大千长安世界，东南无极诸天元福田大千用贤世界，西南无极诸天延福乡大千仁静世界，西北无极诸天福德野大千延贤世界，上方上清玉真三十六天玄都无极世界，下方黄曾三十二天八圆无极世界。 无量大神，主监得道、长生、度世之事。 青元真人曰：舆辈轮盖，皆阳精之炁所成； 凤鹤龙鸾，乃阴精之炁所化。 上圣之人，具真常之道，呼吸合散，随意现前。 阴阳炁谐，如歌似曲，皆炁所为，并非外物。 人若还丹功成，阴魔亦化阳神，元气一呼，万神咸听，五脏神灵，各随方色自现。 舆辇仪卫来迎，百骸众神前导，后从升举朝元，与此无异。 五老启途，东方青灵始老，姓关，讳开，字灵威仰； 南方丹灵真老，姓洞浮，讳极炎，字赤熛弩； 中央元灵元老，姓通班，讳元氏，字含枢纽； 西方皓灵皇老，姓上金，讳昌开，字曜魄宝； 北方五灵玄老，姓黑节，讳灵会，字隐侯局。 十方大圣，道位高尊，乃感五老启途而群仙翼辕，亿乘万骑，浮空而来，然皆法身之神。 《丹经》有曰：神御炁，炁留形。 倾光回驾，玉光飞云，回旋天尊之法座，领监众真，较度君品。 以丹言则倾光回驾，乃坎离既济，阴阳已交，真神化生，温养胎室，故曰监真度生。 颂曰：无极天真集药宫，丹与缘辇御浮空。 倾光回驾群仙庆，阳长阴消妙化功。 诸天丞相，南昌上宫，韩司主录，监生大神，执箓把籍，齐到帝前。 随所应度，严校诸天。 普告三界，无极神乡，泉曲之府，北都罗酆，三官九署，十二河源。 上解祖考，亿劫种亲，疾除罪簿，落灭恶根，不得拘留，逼合鬼群。 元始符命，时刻升迁，北都寒池，部卫形魂，制魔保举，度品南宫。 死魂受炼，仙化成人。 生身受度，劫劫长存。 随劫轮转，与天齐年。 永度三涂五苦八难，超凌三界，逍遥上清。 上清之天，天帝玉真无色之境梵行。 上阳子曰：此道用、世法，两事俱明。 世法； 诸天丞相。 天天各有丞相，一云即大罗神公。 南昌即丹天世界，上宫即朱陵火府。 韩司宫中丈人，即司命也。 主炼度文籍之事。 主录，乃天中宰协特宸主录。 勒籍之司监生，主生魂铸魄也。 太上说经，各持录籍，齐到帝前。 校其应受。 度者，或宿名玄图，骨相合仙，或修齐奉戒，功德积感，或敬奉三宝，善功彻天、或供养师宝，为三官所称。 名在诸天者，各为严行考校，据功量品，随其高下，应受升度也。 以道用，则执箓把籍，元始炁分而阴阳判，三才既立而文籍生。 《内义》曰：显诸仁，则为录籍； 藏诸用，则为阴阳。 幽明无录籍，功罪何所记； 天地无阴阳，造化何由成； 故帝前即中宫神室，帝之所御，四海辐凑，神之所舍，万炁混凝；
chunks.translated_text:
Myriad chariots and ten thousand riders arrive floating through the void,
Their radiant light turned back, they oversee the perfected and deliver the living.

Master Shangyangzi says: The Flying Heavenly Great Saints of the Ten Directions are all emanations of the Primordial Dao’s qi. Their taboo names are:
East: Zong
South: Fei
West: Yun
North: Wujing
Northeast: Fan
Southeast: Nayu
Southwest: Duxian
Northwest: Jueqi
Above: Ying
Below: Luo

They are also called the Ten Directions’ Great Saints of Longevity, or the Ten Directions’ Heavenly Worthies Who Save from Suffering. By the mandate of the Primordial Beginning, they govern the weighing of merits and virtues across the Ten Directions and Three Realms, opening deliverance to the boundless, encompassing life and death, and refining the adepts.

The *Hidden Canon* records that in the heavens of the Eight Directions, there exist Boundless Great Thousandfold Worlds:
The Boundless Heavens of the East hold the Great Thousandfold World of Nadatangxiang, the Realm of Gathering Goodness;
The Boundless Heavens of the South hold the Great Thousandfold World of Wanlichengjing, the Realm of Forsaking the Worthy;
The Boundless Heavens of the West hold the Great Thousandfold World of Futangzhou, the Realm of Universal Conduct;
The Boundless Heavens of the North hold the Great Thousandfold World of Yudanye, the Realm of Purity;
The Boundless Heavens of the Northeast hold the Great Thousandfold World of Fujidu, the Realm of Eternal Peace;
The Boundless Heavens of the Southeast hold the Great Thousandfold World of Yuanfutian, the Realm of Employing the Worthy;
The Boundless Heavens of the Southwest hold the Great Thousandfold World of Yanfuxiang, the Realm of Benevolent Stillness;
The Boundless Heavens of the Northwest hold the Great Thousandfold World of Fudeye, the Realm of Extending Worthiness;
The Upper Heavens of Supreme Purity’s Jade Perfection hold the Thirty-Six Heavens of Xuandu, the Boundless World;
The Lower Heavens of Huangzeng hold the Thirty-Two Heavens of Bayuan, the Boundless World.

The boundless great spirits oversee the affairs of attaining the Dao, longevity, and world-deliverance.

The Perfected of Azure Origin says: Chariots, wheels, and canopies are formed from the qi of yang essence; phoenixes, cranes, dragons, and simurghs are transformations of the qi of yin essence. The perfected saints, possessing the constant Dao, harmonize their breath—gathering and dispersing at will, manifesting as they please. The harmony of yin and yang qi resembles song and melody, all wrought by qi, not external things. When a person’s returning elixir is complete, the yin demons are also transformed into yang spirits. With a single breath of primordial qi, the myriad spirits all heed; the spirits of the five viscera each appear in their directional colors. The chariots, carriages, and retinue come to welcome, the hundred bones’ host of spirits lead the way, and the following ascent to the Primordial is no different.

The Five Elders who clear the path are:
The Azure Spirit Elder of the East, surnamed Guan, taboo name Kai, style Lingweiyang;
The Cinnabar Spirit Perfected Elder of the South, surnamed Dongfu, taboo name Jiyan, style Chibiaonu;
The Primordial Spirit Primordial Elder of the Center, surnamed Tongban, taboo name Yuanshi, style Hanzhuniu;
The Radiant Spirit August Elder of the West, surnamed Shangjin, taboo name Changkai, style Yaopobao;
The Dark Spirit Mysterious Elder of the North, surnamed Heijie, taboo name Linghui, style Yinhouju.

The Great Saints of the Ten Directions, exalted in their Dao rank, thus evoke the Five Elders to clear the path while the host of immortals flanks the procession. Myriad chariots and ten thousand riders arrive floating through the void—yet all are the divine bodies of the Dharma.

The *Elixir Canon* states: The spirit rides the qi, and the qi abides in form. Their radiant light turned back, jade light and flying clouds swirl around the Dharma-throne of the Heavenly Worthies, leading and overseeing the assembly of perfected, assessing and delivering the ranks of lords. In alchemical terms, “turning back the radiant light” signifies the completion of the Kan-Li union, the intercourse of yin and yang, the transformation and birth of the true spirit, and the nurturing of the embryo chamber—hence, “overseeing the perfected and delivering the living.”

A hymn says:
The Heavenly Perfected of the Boundless gather in the Palace of Medicines,
Cinnabar and simurgh carriages ride the floating void.
Turning back the radiant light, the host of immortals rejoices—
Yang grows, yin wanes: the wondrous work of transformation.

The Chancellors of the Heavens, the Supreme Palace of Nanchang, the Recorder Han, the Great Spirit Who Oversees Life—holding registers and grasping ledgers, they all arrive before the Emperor. According to whom deliverance is due, they strictly assess the heavens. Universally proclaimed to the Three Realms, the Boundless Spirit Regions, the Yellow Springs’ courts, the Northern Capital of Fengdu, the Three Offices and Nine Bureaus, the Twelve River Sources: the ancestors and forebears of a thousand kalpas, the kin of countless eons—swiftly erase their ledgers of sins, sever their roots of evil, and forbid their detention or coercion into ghostly throngs. By the talismanic mandate of the Primordial Beginning, they ascend in due time. From the Cold Pool of the Northern Capital, their forms and souls are escorted, demons restrained, and merits protected—delivered to the Southern Palace for ranking. The souls of the dead undergo refinement and transform into immortals; the living who receive deliverance endure through kalpas, everlasting. Through kalpas they revolve, their years equaling Heaven’s. Forever delivered from the Three Paths, Five Sufferings, and Eight Difficulties, they transcend the Three Realms and roam freely in the Supreme Purity.

The Heaven of Supreme Purity is the Realm of the Heavenly Emperor’s Jade Perfection, the Formless Realm of Brahma-conduct.

Master Shangyangzi says: This Dao employs both the methods of the Dao and the principles of the world—both must be understood.

In worldly terms:
The Chancellors of the Heavens—each heaven has its chancellor, also called the Great Luo Divine Duke. Nanchang is the world of the Cinnabar Heaven; the Supreme Palace is the Scarlet Numinous Fire Mansion. The Venerable One of the Han Bureau is the Controller of Destiny. He oversees the affairs of refining and delivering the records. The Recorder is the celestial minister who assists the Heavenly Emperor in recording. The Office of Registers oversees the forging of souls. When the Most High expounds the scriptures, each holds their ledgers and arrives before the Emperor to assess those due for deliverance. Some are destined by their names in the Mysterious Register or their bone configurations for immortality; others accumulate merits through cultivation, observance of precepts, or reverence for the Three Treasures, their good deeds piercing Heaven; still others make offerings to the masters and treasures, praised by the Three Offices. Those whose names are in the heavens undergo strict examination and assessment, their merits measured and ranks determined—according to their excellence, they receive ascent and deliverance.

In Daoist terms:
Holding registers and grasping ledgers, the qi of the Primordial Beginning divides, and yin and yang separate; the Three Powers are established, and the records arise. The *Inner Meaning* states: Manifesting in benevolence, they become ledgers; concealed in function, they become yin and yang. Without ledgers in the hidden and manifest, how could merits and sins be recorded? Without yin and yang in Heaven and Earth, how could creation be accomplished? Thus, the Emperor’s presence is the divine chamber of the Central Palace, where the Emperor resides—all seas converge like spokes to a hub, where spirits abide—all qi coalesces in harmony.

chunks.translated_text:
Just as yin and yang converge within the Central Palace’s divine chamber, so it is said: grasping ledgers and holding registers, all arrive in unison before the Emperor. The Heavenly Worthy’s scriptural teachings are no empty words—they urge people to practice the Way.

Those who cultivate and study must first correct their faults and turn toward goodness, uphold precepts and guard against lust, abandon deceit and still their scheming, purify the heart and reduce desires. Alas! Worldly people chase the trivial and forget the fundamental, devalue life and treat the body lightly. The heroic and bold are enslaved by fame and merit; the wise and exceptional are shackled by ambition; the well-clothed and well-fed are trapped by their schemes; the poor and destitute are burdened by their bodily needs. Even those who leave the dusty world, delighting in ease and comfort, mistakenly believe that emptiness and non-action alone constitute cultivation—how could they ever attain the convergence of yin and yang within the divine chamber?

As for those who are to be delivered, the Way of the Golden Elixir demands true effort, and rewards follow according to merit. With ten parts effort comes ten parts reward; even a single lapse yields a corresponding deficiency. Though one’s practice may be most secret and one’s deeds unknown, in the vast Heaven of Great Purity, all is strictly examined and recorded.

A universal proclamation is issued to the Three Realms—the Realm of Desire, the Realm of Form, and the Formless Realm—as well as to the Three Realms of Heaven, Earth, and Water. The boundless divine homeland, the ten directions’ infinite worlds, are also the divine courts of the Three Realms, the bureaus of the Temple of the Yellow Springs. In the north lies the great sea, where the viscera spirits manifest in colors corresponding to their directions.

Chariots and carriages, ceremonial guards come to welcome; the myriad spirits of the body lead the way, followed by ascension to audience with the Primordial. This is no different. The Five Elders open the path: in the east, the Azure Spirit First Elder, surnamed Guan, named Kai, styled Lingwei Yang; in the south, the Cinnabar Spirit True Elder, surnamed Dongfu, named Jiyan, styled Chibiao Nu; in the center, the Primordial Spirit Primordial Elder, surnamed Tongban, named Yuanshi, styled Hanzhu Niu; in the west, the Radiant Spirit August Elder, surnamed Shangjin, named Changkai, styled Yaopo Bao; in the north, the Five Spirits Mysterious Elder, surnamed Heijie, named Linghui, styled Yinhou Ju.

The great sages of the ten directions, whose Dao-ranks are most exalted, move the Five Elders to open the way, and the host of immortals flanks their carriage—countless chariots and myriad riders arrive floating through the void, yet all are the divine bodies of the Dharma. As the *Elixir Canon* states: “The spirit rides the qi, and the qi sustains the form.” The light pours forth, the chariot turns back; jade radiance and flying clouds swirl around the Heavenly Worthy’s dharma-seat. Leading and overseeing the host of perfected ones, they assess and deliver according to rank.

In elixir terms, the pouring forth of light and turning back of the chariot signify the completion of the Kan-Li union, the convergence of yin and yang, the transformation and birth of the true spirit, the nurturing within the womb-chamber—hence, “overseeing the perfected and delivering the living.” The ode says:
*In the Infinite Heaven’s true alchemy palace,*
*Elixir and karma-chariots ride the void.*
*The light pours forth, the chariot turns—hosts of immortals rejoice,*
*Yang grows, yin wanes: the wondrous work of transformation.*

The celestial chancellors of the various heavens, the Southern Prosperity Upper Palace, Han the Controller of the Registers, the Great Spirit overseeing life—grasping ledgers and holding registers, all arrive in unison before the Emperor. According to those who are to be delivered, the heavens are strictly examined.

A universal proclamation is issued to the Three Realms, the boundless divine homeland, the bureaus of the Yellow Springs, the Northern Capital of Fengdu, the Three Offices and Nine Bureaus, the Twelve River Sources. Ancestral karmic bonds spanning kalpas are dissolved; sins are swiftly erased from the ledgers, evil roots severed. They must not be detained or forced into the company of ghosts. By the Primordial Beginning’s talismanic decree, they ascend in due time from the Northern Capital’s icy pools. Their forms and souls are guarded, demons restrained, merits protected, and ranks delivered to the Southern Palace. The dead souls undergo refinement and transform into immortals; the living receive deliverance and endure through kalpas, turning with the cycles of time, their years equaling Heaven’s. Forever delivered from the Three Paths, the Five Sufferings, and the Eight Difficulties, they transcend the Three Realms and roam freely in the Upper Clarity.

The Heaven of Upper Clarity is the Heavenly Emperor’s Jade Perfection, the formless realm of pure conduct. Master Shangyang said: “This concerns both the application of the Way and worldly principles—both must be made clear.”

Worldly principles:
The celestial chancellors of the various heavens. Each heaven has its own chancellor, also called the Great Purity Divine Duke. Southern Prosperity is the Cinnabar Heaven world; the Upper Palace is the Vermilion Numinous Fire Bureau. The Venerable Han of the Controller’s Palace is the Director of Destinies. He oversees the refinement and deliverance of records. The Controller of the Registers is the Celestial Prime Minister who assists the Heavenly Emperor in managing records. The Bureau of Engraved Registers oversees the forging of souls and refining of spirits.

The Most High expounds the scriptures, each holding their ledgers and registers, all arriving in unison before the Emperor to assess those who are to receive deliverance. Deliverance comes to those whose names are inscribed in the mysterious charts of former lives, whose bone configurations align with immortality; or those who cultivate and uphold precepts, whose accumulated merits and virtues move Heaven; or those who revere the Three Treasures, whose good deeds reach the heavens, or who honor the master’s treasure and are commended by the Three Offices. Those whose names are recorded in the heavens undergo strict examination and assessment, their merits measured and ranks determined—according to their excellence, they receive ascent and deliverance.

In Daoist terms:
Holding registers and grasping ledgers, the qi of the Primordial Beginning divides, and yin and yang separate; the Three Powers are established, and the records arise. The *Inner Meaning* states: Manifesting in benevolence, they become ledgers; concealed in function, they become yin and yang. Without ledgers in the hidden and manifest, how could merits and sins be recorded? Without yin and yang in Heaven and Earth, how could creation be accomplished? Thus, the Emperor’s presence is the divine chamber of the Central Palace, where the Emperor resides—all seas converge like spokes to a hub, where spirits abide—all qi coalesces in harmony. This illustrates the convergence of yin and yang within the Central Palace’s divine chamber, hence the saying: grasping ledgers and holding registers, all arrive in unison before the Emperor. The Heavenly Worthy’s scriptural teachings are no empty words—they urge people to practice the Way.

chunks.original_text: 其有出尘之士，只乐逸豫，以为清净无为是修行，误矣。 何能得阴阳交会於神室哉！ 随所应度，金丹之道，要实工夫，随功受报。 十分工夫有十分受用，一或灭裂，其报亦灭裂。 虽所修至密，所为莫知，然渺渺大罗之天，无不严校而纪录者。 普告三界，欲界、色界、无色界，亦天、地、水三界也。 无极神乡，十方无极世界，亦三界神庭，庙杜泉曲之府。 北有大海，之弦炁也。 命，妙也，铅也，阴中之阳，虎之弦炁也。 经云：常无欲以观其妙，常有欲以观其窍。 故先哲云：书符不知窍，反被鬼神笑。 《老子》曰：窍兮冥，其中有精； 其精甚真； 其中有信。 此信即符信也。 此为元始符命，其以元始真炁符合命门之祖炁。 何哉？ 夫人之身，禀元始祖炁而生，至于盛壮，蹶趋於醉梦之场，而此炁奔失。 若修行人，先炼阳中之阴，以留真汞，次炼阴中之阳，以求真铅，一时刻中凝结成丹，则可觊升迁矣。 北都，即性根，蕃生真汞。 寒池，即命门，蕃生真铅。 当此铅汞交姤，性命混融，直须把握一念，部卫形魂。 若形全魂复，脉住炁停，还丹始结，故能制魔保举，度品南宫。 所谓枯槁形骸、将死之魂，受此铅火炼度，得神仙妙化之道，以成真人矣。 生身受度，天尊显此一句，证出还丹之旨，盖此经非只为死者言，乃修行人生身，受此真炁以度。 且生身则阴阳可全，而造化可掬，学人能以有生之身，倒用五行，修此大丹以成高仙，则劫劫长存，随劫轮转，与天齐年，永度八难之苦，超欲界、色界、无色界，凌四种民天，而逍遥上清。 薛幽栖曰：上清有三十六天，天帝皆道齐元始，位列玉清。 故云玉真在无色之境之上，出造化之外，凭梵省炁而行，出入无间。 非如三十二天在乎三界之内也。 故曰梵行。 颂曰：天帝玉真六六天，丹成道备与齐年。 形神俱妙经功满，劫劫长存位上仙。 他本有以此天帝名讳作《元始灵书上篇》者，非也。 殊不知《天公经》云：大罗天自有《灵书上篇》并观觉郁缆龙篆正文，在《灵书中篇》。 前蜀本或置于下篇，亦非也。 青元真人曰：当从《天公经》。 是矣。 东方八天 元始积九阳梵炁以成。 六天为欲界，二天为色界。 天帝冕服皆青。 太皇黄曾天， 异号净天，或称睹史。 色黄，次奎璧。 人修十善功，凡一根净者，生此天。 释云四天王天。 帝郁鉴玉明。 正音开玄摄明。 天帝内讳郁褴，帝魔隐意玉明。 四字秘天之紫极宫，主长生箓。 太明玉完天， 或称胜妙天，色绿，次譬。 人修二十善功，二根净者，生此天。 释云忉利天。 帝须阿那田。 正音保玄道灵，天正内文须阿，隐音那田。 四字秘天之紫房官，主度魂更生。 清明何童天， 异号光天，色黑，次室。 人修四十善功，三根净者，生此天。 一作河童。 释云夜摩天。 帝元育齐京。 正音明生九真。 天王隐讳元育，真人内文齐京。 四字秘天之九晨宫，主布政教。 玄胎平育天， 异号梵天，或称忉利。 色赤，次危，人修六十善功，四根净者生此天。 释云兜率陀天。 帝刘度内鲜。 正音飘翰默然。 天帝隐名刘度内鲜。 四字秘天之元景宫，主召魔举仙。 元明文举天， 或云化乐，色苍，次虚。 人修八十善功，五根净者，生此天。 释云乐变化天。 帝丑法轮。

Those of transcendent disposition who delight only in ease and comfort, supposing that purity and non-action alone constitute cultivation, are gravely mistaken. How could they attain the union of yin and yang within the divine chamber? In accordance with what each is destined to deliver, the Way of the Golden Elixir demands true effort, and rewards follow in proportion to merit. With ten parts of effort comes ten parts of fruition; even a single lapse yields but a fragmented reward. Though one’s practice be most secret and one’s deeds unknown, yet in the vastness of the Great Brahma Heaven, all is strictly examined and recorded.

A universal proclamation is made to the Three Realms—Desire Realm, Form Realm, and Formless Realm—which are also the Three Realms of Heaven, Earth, and Water. The boundless divine homeland, the ten directions’ infinite worlds, are likewise the divine courts of the Three Realms, the palaces of the sacred springs and hidden valleys. In the north lies the Great Sea, the bowstring-qi of the north. *Ming* (命) means the wondrous, the lead, the yang within yin, the bowstring-qi of the tiger. As the *Classic* states: “Abide in non-desire to observe its mystery; abide in desire to observe its gateway.” Thus the ancients said: “He who writes talismans without knowing the gateway invites the mockery of spirits.” *Laozi* says: “The gateway is dark and obscure, yet within it lies essence; this essence is most true; within it lies trust.” This trust is the talismanic trust. It is the primordial talismanic mandate, wherein the true qi of the Primordial Beginning harmonizes with the ancestral qi of the Gate of Life.

Why is this so? The human body is endowed with the ancestral qi of the Primordial Beginning at birth, yet in the prime of life, one stumbles into the realm of intoxication and dreams, and this qi flees and is lost. For the cultivator, one must first refine the yin within yang to retain true mercury, then refine the yang within yin to seek true lead. In a single moment of concentration, the Elixir coalesces, and one may hope for ascension and promotion. The Northern Capital is the root of nature, where true mercury flourishes. The Cold Pool is the Gate of Life, where true lead flourishes. When lead and mercury unite, nature and life merge, and one must seize the moment with a single thought to guard the body and the hun-soul. If the form is whole and the hun-soul restored, the pulse halts and qi ceases, the Reverted Elixir begins to form—thus one can subdue demons, ensure promotion, and pass through the Southern Palace for ranking. The so-called withered corpse and dying hun-soul, refined by this lead-fire, attain the wondrous transformation of divine immortality and become perfected beings.

To deliver the living body—this single phrase revealed by the Heavenly Worthy clarifies the essence of the Reverted Elixir. For this scripture speaks not only for the dead, but for the living practitioner who receives this true qi for deliverance. Moreover, in the living body, yin and yang may be made whole, and the workings of creation grasped. If the practitioner, within this mortal frame, can invert the Five Phases and cultivate this Great Elixir to become a lofty immortal, then one may endure for kalpas unending, revolving through the ages, sharing the lifespan of Heaven, forever escaping the Eight Difficulties, transcending the Desire Realm, Form Realm, and Formless Realm, rising above the Four Kinds of Heavenly Beings, and roaming freely in the Upper Clarity.

Xue Youqi said: The Upper Clarity has thirty-six heavens, whose heavenly emperors are equal in Dao to the Primordial Beginning, their ranks arrayed in the Jade Clarity. Thus it is said that the Jade Perfected reside beyond the Formless Realm, outside the bounds of creation, moving by the qi of Brahmanic contemplation, passing in and out without obstruction. They are not like the thirty-two heavens confined within the Three Realms. Hence it is called the Brahmanic practice. The ode states:

The Heavenly Emperors and Jade Perfected of the six-six heavens,
When the Elixir is complete and the Dao perfected, share Heaven’s years.
Form and spirit both wondrous, their merit fulfilled,
For kalpas unending they endure as Upper Immortals.

Some versions mistakenly attribute the name of this Heavenly Emperor to the *Primordial Numinous Writ, Upper Chapter*. Yet they fail to recognize that the *Heavenly Duke’s Scripture* states: The Great Brahma Heaven has its own *Numinous Writ, Upper Chapter*, along with the *Observing Awareness* and the *Coiled Dragon Seal Script*, contained within the *Numinous Writ, Middle Chapter*. The Former Shu edition sometimes places it in the Lower Chapter—this too is incorrect. The Azure Perfected said: One should follow the *Heavenly Duke’s Scripture*. This is correct.

The Eight Heavens of the East are formed from the Primordial Beginning’s accumulation of ninefold yang Brahmanic qi. Six heavens belong to the Desire Realm, and two to the Form Realm. The Heavenly Emperors’ regalia are all azure.

The Supreme August Yellow-Pervaded Heaven, also called the Pure Heaven or the Witnessing History. Its color is yellow, next to Kui and Bi. Those who cultivate the ten virtues and purify a single sense faculty are reborn here. The Buddhists call this the Heaven of the Four Heavenly Kings. The Emperor’s name is Yu Jian Yu Ming. The correct pronunciation is Kai Xuan She Ming. The Heavenly Emperor’s inner name is Yu Lan; the demonic emperor’s hidden meaning is Yu Ming. These four characters are secret to the Purple Ultimate Palace of Heaven, which governs the Register of Longevity.

The Supreme Brightness Jade-Perfected Heaven, also called the Victorious and Wondrous Heaven. Its color is green, next to Pi. Those who cultivate twenty virtues and purify two sense faculties are reborn here. The Buddhists call this the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Xu A Na Tian. The correct pronunciation is Bao Xuan Dao Ling. The Heavenly Emperor’s inner text is Xu A; the hidden sound is Na Tian. These four characters are secret to the Purple Chamber Palace of Heaven, which governs the deliverance of souls for rebirth.

The Luminous River Lad Heaven, also called the Radiant Heaven. Its color is black, next to Shi. Those who cultivate forty virtues and purify three sense faculties are reborn here. Alternately called the River Lad. The Buddhists call this the Suyāma Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Yuan Yu Qi Jing. The correct pronunciation is Ming Sheng Jiu Zhen. The Heavenly King’s hidden name is Yuan Yu; the perfected one’s inner text is Qi Jing. These four characters are secret to the Nine Dawns Palace of Heaven, which governs the promulgation of governance and teachings.

The Mysterious Womb Nurturing Heaven, also called the Brahmanic Heaven or the Trāyastriṃśa. Its color is red, next to Wei. Those who cultivate sixty virtues and purify four sense faculties are reborn here. The Buddhists call this the Tuṣita Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Liu Du Nei Xian. The correct pronunciation is Piao Han Mo Ran. The Heavenly Emperor’s hidden name is Liu Du Nei Xian. These four characters are secret to the Primordial Scenery Palace of Heaven, which governs the summoning of demons and promotion of immortals.

The Primordial Brightness Literary Flourishing Heaven, also called the Transformative Joy. Its color is blue-green, next to Xu. Those who cultivate eighty virtues and purify five sense faculties are reborn here. The Buddhists call this the Nirmāṇarati Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Chou Fa Lun.

The correct pronunciation is Kai Sheng Shu. The Heavenly Emperor’s inner name is Nei Wen Chou, with the alternate name Fa Lun. These three characters are secret to the Moon Palace of Heaven, governing the circulation of primordial qi.

The Upper Bright Seven Luminaries Ma Yi Heaven, also called Transformative Joy, referring to the utmost of sensual pleasure. Its color is black, next to Nü. Those who cultivate one hundred virtues and purify six sense faculties are reborn here. The Buddhists call this the Parinirmita-vaśavartin Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Tian Huai Yan. The correct pronunciation is Yan Xu Ming; the Heavenly Emperor’s inner sound is Tian Huai, with the hidden name Yan. These three characters are secret to the Great Yin Palace of Heaven, governing the deliverance of those in dark distress.

The Void Transcending Heng Heaven, also called Initial Brahman. Its color is blue-green, next to Niu. Though the heavenly beings here have purified their six sense faculties, they remain bound by the dust of form and thus ascend to this heaven. The Buddhists call this the Brahmā-pāriṣadya Heaven of the First Dhyāna. The Emperor’s name is Zheng Ding Guang. The correct pronunciation is Jing Wu Qiao; the Heavenly Emperor’s inner name is Zheng Ding Guang. These three characters are secret to the Great Mystery Palace of the Archer, governing the supreme Dao.

The Supreme Ultimate Meng Yi Heaven, also called Upper Brahman. Its color is purple, next to Dou. Those whose coarse dust of form is purified ascend here. It is also called the First Dhyāna Heaven. The Buddhists call this the Brahmā-purohita Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Qu Yu Jiu Chang. The correct pronunciation is A Nan Jing Ming. The Heavenly King’s hidden name is Qu Yu, with the complete name Jiu Chang. These four characters are secret to the Mystery Capital Palace of Heaven, governing the refinement and deliverance of decayed remains.

**The Eight Southern Heavens**
The Primordial Beginning accumulates the three yang breaths of Brahman to form eight heavens, belonging to the Form Realm. Four heavens pertain to coarse dust, and four to fine dust. Their regalia consist of blue crowns, red tassels, and vermilion robes.

The Crimson Bright Harmonious Yang Heaven, also called Lesser Light. Its color is white, next to Ji and Dou. Those whose second coarse dust is purified ascend here. It is also called the First Dhyāna Heaven. The Buddhists call this the Mahābrahmā Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Li Jin Shang Zhen. The common correct pronunciation is Zhi An Bao Xian; the Heavenly King’s hidden name is Li Jin Shang Zhen. These four characters are secret to the Ever-Bright Palace of Heaven, governing the refinement of immortals into perfected beings.

The Mysterious Bright Reverent Flourishing Heaven, also called Resounding Light. Its color is yellow, next to Ji. Those whose third coarse dust is purified are reborn here. It is also called the Second Dhyāna Heaven. The Buddhists call this the Parītta-ābha Heaven. The Emperor’s name is Kong Yao Chou Yin. The correct pronunciation is Fei Yin Qi Ling; the Heavenly Emperor’s inner name is Kong Yao Chou Yin. These four characters are secret to the Eastern Florescence Palace, responding to and transforming all things.

The Radiant Bright Ancestral Fluttering Heaven, also called Immeasurable Light. Its color is green, next to Wei. Those whose fourth coarse dust is purified are reborn here. chunks.original_text: 或云广乐。 色黄，次翼。 天人细尘虽净，尚余轻染，生此天。 亦号四禅天。 释云无想。 帝招真童。 正音回翘威。 天君秘号招真童。 三字秘天之大赤宫，主度有善功之魂。 始皇孝芒天， 或云上妙。 色缘，次张。 天人一轻染净，升此天。 释云无烦恼天。 帝萨罗娄王。 正音君华大权。 玉真隐文萨罗娄王。 四字秘天之大丹宫，主披夜开幽。 太皇访重浮容天， 或云色究竟天。 色青，次星。 以色尘渐除，故云色究竟。 二轻染净，升此天。 释云元热天。 帝闵巴狂。 正音惠威光。 帝君内文闵巴狂。 三字秘天之华盖宫主召魔集真。 无思江由天， 或号最上妙。 色赤，次柳。 天人三轻染净，升此天。 释云善见天。 帝明梵光。 正音郎明法元。 帝君内号明梵光。 三字秘天之明堂宫，主开度善魂。 上揲阮乐天， 或号自在。 色苍，次鬼。 天人四轻染净，升此天。 释云善现天。 帝勃勃监。 正音郁无真星。 天帝内文勃勃，内号监。 三字秘天之运灵宫，品类天人。 无极昙誓天， 异号大自在，亦云不还。 色黑，次井。 天人五轻染净，升此天。 释云色究竟天。 帝飘弩穹隆。 正音飞在虚英。 天魔内文飘弩，天君隐讳穹隆。 四字秘天之中无宫，主度仙。 北方八天 元始积五阳梵炁以成。 四天为无色界天，四天为种民天，青冕、白旒、皂服。 皓庭霄度天， 异号不空。 色碧，次参井。 天人轻染虽净，尚余结习，升此天。 释云无边空处天。 帝慧觉昏。 正音无清明。 帝君内音慧觉昏。 三字秘天之琼瑶宫，主技度学人。 渊通元洞天， 异号大不空。 色紫，次参。 天人色尘都忘，但有心识，升此天。 释云无边识处天。 帝梵行观生。 正音洗权道光。 天君内音梵行，隐讳观生。 四字秘天之真元宫，主度学人。 太文翰宠妙成天， 异号非想。 色白，次觜。 天人心识两忘，炁观渐妙，升此天。 释云无所有起天。 帝那育丑瑛。 正音灵熏慧光。 帝魔内文那育丑瑛，四字秘天之灵幽宫，主统理之事。 太素秀乐禁上天， 异号非非想。 色黄，次毕。 天人结习渐忘，炁观转妙，升此天。 释云非非想天。 帝龙罗觉长。 正音阳威曜清。 天帝内文龙罗觉长。 四字秘天之九灵宫，主领录魔王。 太虚无上常融天， 异号不动。 色缘，次昴。 天人结习顿忘，渐入神观，升此天。 释云不动天。 帝总监鬼神。 正音摄灵真。 天帝摄魔内音，总监鬼神。 四字秘天之力福官，主校学 人功过。 太释玉隆腾胜天， 异号大不动天。 色青，次胃。 天人结习顿忘，神观转妙，升此天。 释云大不动天。 帝眇眇行元。 正音空微道明。 帝君隐号眇眇行元。 四字秘天之日盖宫主召集仙圣。 龙变梵度天， 异号上妙天。 色赤，次娄。 天人清净无染，证不空果，升此天。 释云上妙天。 帝运上玄玄。 正音掬灵妙光。 天王内文运上，玉真总音玄玄。 四字秘天之灵宝宫，进仙成圣。 太极平育贾奕天， 异号最上妙。 色苍，次奎。 天人洞入道妙，证无上玄觉，升此天。 释云最上妙天。 帝大择法门。 正音永玄久生。 天王总文大择法门。 四字秘天之天宝宫，普度学人。 三十二天，，三十二帝，诸天隐讳，诸天隐名，天中空洞，自然灵章。 诸天隐韵，天中之音，天中之尊，天中之神，天中大魔，天中之灵。 九和十合，变化上 清。 无量之奥，深不可详。

The Supreme Release Jade Eminence Soaring Victory Heaven,

chunks.original_text: 敷落神真，普度天人。 上阳子曰：天帝内文、隐名、色服、根尘，皆天尊矜悯下愚，命天真皇人注释，下教於未闻者。 见《洞神经》、《内音经》、《龙蹻经》、《本际经》、《天公经》 等，黄曾至七曜六天为欲界，即下界也。 初出，凡欲未除，天中之人，触物染着。 初上二天，身交为欲。 其次二天，接手为欲。 又次五天，以口为欲。 又次六天，眼视为欲。 以色欲故，交接阴阳，故云欲界。 因其欲乐，衰相易见，寿命终尽，复沦诸趣，若渐修习，欲乐顿除，升入色界，名小乘道。 如大劫交，火从昆仑根起，焚烧世界，焰冲和阳天，元炁溃散，天乃沦坏。 越行至昙誓天为色界，即中界也。 此天之人有六色十八尘。 一尘净，升一天； 十八尘净，升无色界天。 若稍贪着，复堕欲界，名中乘道。 如大劫交水，自东井起，洪泉鼓波，漂至极风天。 元炁溃散，天乃沦坏。 皓庭至秀乐四天，为无色界，即上界也。 尘染俱净，乃升此天。 《太真科》曰：无色界中，至真无情，不交阴阳，人若化生，但啖真炁，无复形质。 修至一天，唯存心识，若心识除，次第而升。 炁观道成，洞入自然，升种民天。 释云菩提萨捶天，大乘道也。 如大劫交，水火不到，唯风浩荡。 孝芒至霄度六天，为风所坏，元洞至秀乐，元炁散而复合，更无劫数。 常融至平育四种民天，洞入真道，乃升此天，为最上乘。 如大劫交，三界坏尽，此天复生圣人，以为民种，故号种民。 若丹成道备，经功满就，则升上清天也。 夫天帝魔神灵章之秘，皆空洞之炁结成，一切神灵凭之变化，犹还丹资元始祖炁，九和十合之功，以成金胎。 胎婴变化而身入上清矣。 无量之奥，此丹最为神化之奥，深隐而不可详述。 敷落，神真敷散也。 落，布也。 乃散真文，布置诸天，令其执持，普度天人，皆成妙道。 此道用、世法之通释也。 颂曰：三十二总天是尘，色心都寂现全身。 九和十合经功满，金阙宫中侍玉宸。 今日欣庆受度，历关诸天，请灭三恶，斩绝地根，飞度五户，名列太玄。 魔王保举，无拘天门。 东斗主算，西斗记名。 北斗落死，南斗上生，中斗大魁，总监众灵。 青帝护魂，白帝侍魄，赤帝养炁，黑帝通血。 黄帝中主，万神无越。 青天魔王，巴元丑伯。 赤天魔王，负天担石。 白天魔王，反山六目。 黑天魔王，监丑朗馥。 黄天魔王，横天担力。 五帝大魔，万神之宗，飞行鼓从，总领鬼兵。 麾幢鼓节，游观太空。 自号赫奕，诸天齐功，上天度人，严摄北酆。 神公受命，普扫不祥，八威吐毒，猛马四张。 天丁前驱，大帅仗旛。 掷火万里，流铃八冲。 敢有干试，拒遏上真，金钺前戮，巨天后刑。 屠割鬼爽，风火无停，千千截首，万万剪形。 魔无干犯，鬼无妖精，三官北酆，明检鬼营。 不得容隐，金马驿程。 普告无穷，万神咸听。 三界五帝，列言上清。 上阳子曰：前言今日校录者，是学人炼己以积功。 此言今日欣庆受度者，乃炼炁以还丹。 大修行人最不易得者，今日也； 铅遇癸生，今日也； 黄芽生处，今日也； 既得今日，是得其时。 又有其才而有其人，此为欣庆受度也。

The divine perfected scatter and spread, universally delivering heavenly beings and humans.

Master Shangyang says: The Heavenly Emperor’s inner scriptures, hidden names, colored robes, and root-dust—all these the Heavenly Honored One, in compassion for the benighted, commanded the Heavenly Perfected Sovereign to annotate, descending to teach those who have not yet heard. See the *Cavernous Spirit Sutra*, *Inner Sound Sutra*, *Dragon’s Soaring Sutra*, *Root-Boundary Sutra*, *Heavenly Duke Sutra*, and others. Huang and Zeng reached the Seven Luminaries and Six Heavens of the Desire Realm—this is the lower realm. At first emerging, with worldly desires not yet extinguished, the people of these heavens touch things and become stained. In the first two heavens, bodily union is desire. In the next two, hand-clasping is desire. In the following five, speech is desire. In the next six, eye-gazing is desire. Because of desire for form, yin and yang intermingle, hence it is called the Desire Realm. Due to their indulgence in desire, signs of decay become apparent, lifespans end, and they sink back into the various destinies. If one gradually cultivates and abandons desire, ascending into the Form Realm, this is the Small Vehicle Dao.

When the great kalpa turns, fire arises from the root of Kunlun, burning the world. Flames surge to the Harmony-Sun Heaven, primordial qi disperses, and the heavens collapse. Passing through to the Vow-Swearing Heaven marks the Form Realm—this is the middle realm. The people of these heavens possess six colors and eighteen dusts. When one dust is purified, one ascends to a heaven; when all eighteen dusts are purified, one ascends to the Formless Realm. If one clings even slightly, one falls back into the Desire Realm—this is the Middle Vehicle Dao.

When the great kalpa turns with water, it arises from the Eastern Well, vast springs churning waves that flood to the Ultimate Wind Heaven. Primordial qi disperses, and the heavens collapse. From the Radiant Court to the Four Heavens of Elegant Joy is the Formless Realm—this is the upper realm. Only when all dust-stains are purified does one ascend to these heavens. The *Great Perfected Regulations* states: In the Formless Realm, the utmost perfected are without emotion, do not intermingle yin and yang, and if humans are transformed and born there, they only consume true qi, no longer possessing physical form. When one cultivates to a heaven, only the mind-consciousness remains; if the mind-consciousness is extinguished, one ascends step by step. When qi is observed and the Dao is accomplished, one penetrates into spontaneity, ascending to the Seed-People Heaven. The Buddhists call this the Bodhisattva-Striving Heaven—the Great Vehicle Dao.

When the great kalpa turns, neither water nor fire reaches it, only wind vast and surging. From Filial Might to the Six Heavens of Cloud-Soaring, the wind destroys them; from Primordial Cavern to Elegant Joy, primordial qi scatters and then recombines, with no further kalpas. From Constant Fusion to the Four Seed-People Heavens of Level Nurturance, penetrating into the true Dao, one ascends to these heavens—this is the Most Supreme Vehicle. When the great kalpa turns and the Three Realms are utterly destroyed, these heavens give birth again to sages as the seed of the people, hence they are called the Seed-People.

The secrets of the Heavenly Emperor, demons, spirits, and numinous chapters are all formed from the qi of emptiness and cavernousness. All spirits rely on them for transformation, just as the returning elixir depends on the primordial ancestral qi, the work of nine harmonizing with ten, to form the golden embryo. The embryo transforms, and the body enters the Upper Clarity. Of boundless mysteries, this elixir is the most wondrous and transformative, deeply hidden and beyond full explication.

"Scattering and spreading" refers to the divine perfected dispersing the true scriptures, arranging them throughout the heavens, commanding them to be upheld, universally delivering heavenly beings and humans, all attaining the wondrous Dao. This is the comprehensive explanation of the Dao’s application and worldly dharma.

The ode says:
The thirty-two heavens in total are dust,
When form and mind are both quiescent, the whole body appears.
Nine harmonizes with ten, the scriptural work complete,
In the Golden Watchtower Palace, one attends the Jade Emperor.

Today, joyously celebrating this deliverance, passing through the barriers of all heavens, we request the eradication of the Three Evils, severing the root of earth, flying through the Five Passes, with one’s name recorded in the Great Mystery. The Demon Kings vouch for you, unbound by the Heavenly Gates. The Eastern Dipper governs lifespan, the Western Dipper records names. The Northern Dipper casts down death, the Southern Dipper bestows life, the Central Dipper’s Great Chief oversees all spirits. The Azure Emperor guards the hun-soul, the White Emperor attends the po-soul, the Vermilion Emperor nurtures qi, the Black Emperor circulates blood. The Yellow Emperor presides at the center—none of the myriad spirits transgress him.

The Azure Heaven Demon King is Ba Yuan Chou Bo.
The Vermilion Heaven Demon King bears the heavens and carries stones.
The White Heaven Demon King reverses mountains with six eyes.
The Black Heaven Demon King oversees the ugly and fragrant.
The Yellow Heaven Demon King bears the heavens with horizontal strength.

The Five Great Demon Emperors are the lords of all spirits, flying and drumming in procession, commanding ghostly soldiers. Waving banners and beating drums, they roam and observe the great void. Proclaiming themselves resplendent, all heavens share in the merit. Ascending to heaven to deliver people, they strictly govern the Northern Feng. The Divine Duke receives the mandate, universally sweeping away inauspiciousness. The Eight Mighties spew poison, fierce horses spread in four directions. Heavenly Soldiers lead the way, great marshals wield banners. Casting fire for ten thousand miles, flowing bells in eight directions. Should any dare to test or obstruct the perfected, the golden axes strike first, the giant天后 metes out punishment. Slaughtering and severing ghostly brilliance, wind and fire never cease. Thousands upon thousands of heads are cut off, ten thousand upon ten thousand forms are sheared. Demons dare not trespass, ghosts dare not be monstrous. The Three Officials of the Northern Feng inspect the ghostly camps—none may conceal themselves, the golden horse’s courier route. Universally proclaiming without end, all spirits heed.

The Five Emperors of the Three Realms report to the Upper Clarity.

Master Shangyang says: The earlier mention of "today’s recording" refers to the practitioner refining the self to accumulate merit. This mention of "today’s joyous deliverance" refers to refining qi to return the elixir. For the great cultivator, the rarest attainment is today; when lead meets the arising of gui, today; where the yellow sprout arises, today. Having attained today is having attained the proper time. Moreover, possessing both the talent and the person—this is the joyous deliverance.

The hidden rhymes of the heavens are the sounds within the heavens, the revered within the heavens, the spirits within the heavens, the great demons within the heavens, the numina within the heavens. chunks.original_text: 历关诸天，若欲天人交感，必先言语通诚，请灭三恶，先杜妄缘，斩绝地根，坚刚真性，采炼元始之梵炁，飞度五户以还元，而名列于太玄。 天门者，命门也。 当入室时，魔王监真举事，使无拘滞天门。 青阳初回，束斗主算。 金华吐绽，西斗记名。 取坎中阳，北斗落死。 补离中缺，南斗上生。 炁归黄庭，中斗总监众灵也。 青帝姓常，讳精明，护魂，治肝。 白帝姓混，讳蓐收，侍魄治肺。 赤帝姓炎，讳洞丹，养炁，治心。 黑帝姓玄，讳明萌，通血，治肾。 黄帝姓麻，讳忠慎，中主黄堂，制御万神。 《大洞玉帝箓》云：五帝与天地同存，阴阳始判，化生五行。 大修行人，五帝降神，而炼金液，降炁以结胎婴。 青天魔王姓斌，讳齿成。 赤天魔王姓佛，名由肃。 白天魔王姓赤，名张市。 黑天魔王姓徐，名直事。 黄天魔王姓天门，名波狂。 皆主贪欲，耗摇神炁，故呼魔王。 五帝大魔，即天王也，即人身五官也。 发施生育之功，主持金丹妙道，承天尊勅摄之命，各现帝相，故称五帝。 若居欲界，以色、声、香、味、触魔试学人，故云大魔，万神之宗，为一身之主宰。 天尊昔降此五魔，有《御魔总真灵文》令五帝符吏分卫五方。 青帝符吏名启华，赤帝符吏名明真，白帝符吏名茂成，黑帝符吏名守元，黄帝符吏名升冥，各安其方，守卫灵文，以御魔试。 道用则四帝大魔属彼，涵元始梵炁，亦称诸天，亦号金公，亦曰太乙，亦名白虎。 唯东方青帝大魔属此，握生杀之柄，亦称本命元神，亦号无位真人，亦名金刚神王。 飞行鼓从，彼四帝大魔飞行三界，鼓集部从，总领欲界鬼兵以示侄欲之道。 魔试学人，麾憧鼓节，此青帝大魔，麾起旛幢，鼓动旌节，虽居色界，不为欲乱，禀受元始梵炁真命，察恶劝善，故曰游观太空。 自号威雄赫奕之独尊，与彼四帝诸天齐其生育之功。 上天度人，四帝诸天其中最善者，曰上天其施度人，妙化必先严行。 摄起北都罗酆，检举爱根，以炼还丹。 庶令神公受命。 神公即我元神，号马龙氏，讳廓奕。 其禀受元始梵炁真命，一切扫去贪淫不祥之鬼。 八威吐毒，八威乃眼、耳、鼻、舌、身、意六识，并合藏传送为八识，号曰八威。 吐去色、声、香、味、触法之毒害，不令恼乱，然后金刚神王驾猛马以四张，遣天丁前驱，勇猛而进饬，大帅仗旛，坚固而行，掷火万里，则光烁烁； 流铃八冲，则圆陀陀； 彼四帝诸天若稍有干试，拒上天度人之道，遏元始一炁之真，使不能还元，则金刚神王以金钺而前戮，巨天力士伏巨戈而后刑，屠割五浊之淫鬼，急如风火，以无停盖半时之功，要疾速之意。 千千截首，千妖屏进，万万剪形，万怪逃形； 彼无干试违犯。
chunks.translated_text:
Passing through the barriers of all heavens, should one desire communion between heaven and humanity, one must first establish sincere communication, beseech the eradication of the Three Evils, sever false karmic ties, cut off the root of earthly existence, and fortify the true nature with steadfast resolve. Gathering and refining the primordial Brahman qi of the Origin, one soars through the Five Gates to return to the origin, thereby inscribing one’s name in the Great Mystery.

The Heavenly Gate is the Gate of Destiny. When entering the chamber, the Demon Kings oversee the true undertaking, ensuring the Gate of Destiny remains unobstructed. As the Green Yang first returns, the Dipper of the East governs reckoning. When the Golden Flower blooms, the Dipper of the West records names. Drawing the yang from Kan, the Northern Dipper marks death. Mending the deficiency in Li, the Southern Dipper bestows life. When qi returns to the Yellow Court, the Central Dipper oversees all spirits.

The Green Emperor, surnamed Chang, styled Jingming, guards the hun-soul and governs the liver. The White Emperor, surnamed Hun, styled Rushou, attends the po-soul and governs the lungs. The Red Emperor, surnamed Yan, styled Dongdan, nurtures qi and governs the heart. The Black Emperor, surnamed Xuan, styled Mingmeng, circulates blood and governs the kidneys. The Yellow Emperor, surnamed Ma, styled Zhongshen, presides over the Yellow Hall at the center, commanding all spirits.

The *Register of the Jade Emperor of the Great Cavern* states: The Five Emperors exist coeval with heaven and earth; when yin and yang first divided, they transformed and gave rise to the Five Phases. For the great cultivator, the Five Emperors descend their spirits to refine the golden liquid, infusing qi to congeal the fetal embryo.

The Demon King of the Green Heaven, surnamed Bin, styled Chicheng. The Demon King of the Red Heaven, surnamed Fo, named Yousu. The Demon King of the White Heaven, surnamed Chi, named Zhangshi. The Demon King of the Black Heaven, surnamed Xu, named Zhishi. The Demon King of the Yellow Heaven, surnamed Tianmen, named Bokuang. All preside over greed and desire, depleting and agitating the spirit-qi, hence they are called Demon Kings.

The Five Emperors and Great Demons are the Heavenly Kings, corresponding to the five organs of the human body. They bestow the power of generation and nurturing, presiding over the wondrous Dao of the golden elixir, carrying out the edicts of the Heavenly Worthy to subdue and command. Each manifests in imperial form, thus they are called the Five Emperors. Dwelling in the Desire Realm, they test practitioners with the demons of form, sound, scent, taste, and touch, hence they are called Great Demons, the ancestors of all spirits and the sovereigns of the body.

Long ago, the Heavenly Worthy descended these five demons, and in the *Comprehensive Divine Writ for Subduing Demons*, commanded the talisman-officers of the Five Emperors to guard the five directions. The talisman-officer of the Green Emperor is named Qihua; of the Red Emperor, Mingzhen; of the White Emperor, Maocheng; of the Black Emperor, Shouyuan; of the Yellow Emperor, Shengming. Each secures their direction, safeguarding the divine writ to repel demonic trials.

When the Dao is in practice, the Four Emperors and Great Demons submit to it, containing the primordial Brahman qi. They are also called the Myriad Heavens, the Golden Duke, the Grand Unity, or the White Tiger. Only the Great Demon of the Green Emperor of the East belongs here, wielding the handle of life and death. He is also called the Original Spirit of Destiny, the Positionless True Person, or the Vajra Divine King.

Soaring in flight, drumming in procession, the Four Emperors and Great Demons traverse the Three Realms, rallying their retinues to assemble the ghostly troops of the Desire Realm, demonstrating the path of lustful folly. When demons test the practitioner, they brandish banners and beat drums. This Great Demon of the Green Emperor, waving his pennants and striking his standards, though dwelling in the Form Realm, is not swayed by desire. Endowed with the true mandate of primordial Brahman qi, he inspects evil and exhorts goodness, thus he is said to roam and observe the great void. He styles himself the sole sovereign of awe-inspiring majesty, sharing in the generative power of the Four Emperors and the Myriad Heavens.

When the heavens deliver humanity, among the Four Emperors and the Myriad Heavens, the most virtuous is said to be the one who, in delivering humanity, ensures that wondrous transformation begins with strict conduct. He summons the Northern Capital of Fengdu, inspects and severs the root of attachment, to refine and return the elixir. Thus, the Divine Duke receives his mandate.

The Divine Duke is our original spirit, styled Malongshi, named Kuoyi. Endowed with the true mandate of primordial Brahman qi, he sweeps away all inauspicious ghosts of greed and lust. The Eight Mighties spew forth poison—the Eight Mighties being the six senses of eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind, combined with the storehouse and transmission consciousnesses to form the eight consciousnesses, called the Eight Mighties. They expel the poisonous harm of form, sound, scent, taste, touch, and dharmas, preventing disturbance and disorder.

Then the Vajra Divine King mounts a fierce steed with four steeds abreast, dispatching Heavenly Ding as vanguard, advancing with valor and discipline. The great marshal wields his banner, marching with steadfast resolve. Casting fire for ten thousand leagues, its light blazes brilliantly; the flowing bells of the Eight Directions resound with perfect roundness. Should the Four Emperors and the Myriad Heavens dare to interfere, obstructing the heavens’ deliverance of humanity and hindering the true qi of the primordial Origin from returning to the origin, the Vajra Divine King advances with his golden axe, while the mighty Heavenly Warriors wield their massive halberds in punishment. They slaughter the lustful demons of the Five Turbidities with the swiftness of wind and fire, without pause for even half an hour, emphasizing urgency and speed.

A thousand thousand heads are severed, a thousand demons retreat in disarray; ten thousand ten thousand forms are cut down, ten thousand specters flee in terror. Those who do not interfere or transgress remain unharmed.

chunks.original_text: 三官，三元也。 北酆，真性也。 则三元专制真性，洞明检按鬼妖营窟，不得容隐。 元始梵炁，金马黄道也。 驿程，急递也。 使此炁驰逐黄道而归神室，普告无穷。 一炁所临，万神听令。 三界即三田五帝，即五官皆列言，奏功于上清也。 以世法则如经所言，不释亦明。 颂曰：赫奕威雄正令行，魔无干犯鬼无精。 一些祖炁还丹就，三界列言奏上清。 元洞玉历，龙汉延康。 眇眇亿劫，混沌之中，上无复色，下无复渊。 风泽洞虚，金刚乘天。 天上天下，无幽无冥。 无形无景，无极无穷。 溟涬大梵，寥廓无光。 赤明开图，运度自然。 元始安镇，敷落五篇。 赤书玉字，八威龙文，保制劫运，使天长存。 梵炁弥罗，万范开张，元纲流演，三十二天。 轮转无色，周回十方。 旋斗历箕，回度五常。 三十五分，总炁上元。 八景冥合，炁入玄玄。 上阳子曰：二章为经之脉，为丹之髓。 何也？ 本章是炼金液还丹事，故示赤文为采药之具。 十方浮空而来，齐到帝前，乃聚精会神，至今日欣庆受度，方乃合丹。 既得一炁还元，则身中五斗五帝效职驱邪，逐去阴魔鬼炁，故示万万剪形之功。 《老子》曰：下德为之，而有以为者。 本章之谓也。 此章是炼玉液大丹事，故示玉历为纪元之始。 所以无幽无冥，无形无影者，盖炁初回而未帖，得元始梵炁，安镇则万范开张，以至万炁齐仙也。 《九品经》曰：昔混元溟涬，诸天未分，元始笔形，五劫初化，乃命梵元祖晨道君肇录天元，运乘五劫。 故元洞者，以成祖炁； 玉历者，以纪天元。 自一炁化分，三因成九，若龙若挺，蟠曲九道，漠漠无极，总九阳祖炁之元，太上乃运梵合炁，开始青天元祖炁。 故东方得九炁以分天境，劫号龙汉。 南方得三炁以分境，劫号赤明。 中央得十二炁以分天境，劫号上皇。 西方得七炁以分天境，劫号延康。 北方得五炁以分天境，劫号开皇。 五劫既周，昊天成象； 一炁混道，八景流光。 八帝示形，九霄分化，结元洞五阳之炁，为玉历。 乃命天真皇人，以玉历纪元洞之初劫运流复之本，天真天民学仙功绩，升退之道。 青元真人曰：天地生成，始於龙汉，终於延康。 几成几坏，莫可亿度。 故云眇眇。 每劫运壤，天地荡散，山海消融，物象一空，无复形质，唯元洞之炁混然不分，沌然始构，是云混沌。 当此之时，暗包真一之水，而五行未胚； 上无色象，下无渊极； 上风下泽，空洞虚无，金刚之炁乘载天根。 幽冥，言隐显形影，言物象。 穷极，言分际。 溟涬，言旷荡。 当其混沌之中，天上天下，隐显旷荡，莫分物象。 分际未别，唯大梵之炁寥廓，未有光影。 及后金风炁摩而生火，四象化合而生土，博载天地，长养万物，此谓三境高真，过度灾劫。 乃比众生，沉滞生死，轮转无穷。 喻金丹返本，如经劫运之难。 今幸梵炁还元，尚无形象。 赤明开图，赤明元年，玉历定纪。 天地、日月、山川、物象分判生长，亦犹还丹之有位也。 四序推迁，各得其所，故曰运度自然，亦犹还丹之元为也。 元始安镇，敷落五篇。 元始观梵炁结形，刻玉成云篆天章，载妙元神真道五者，故云五篇。 悟其妙者入其妙，悟其元者入其元，悟其神者入其神，悟其真者入其真，悟其道者入其道；
chunks.translated_text:
The Three Officials are the Three Origins. The Northern Fengdu is the true nature. Thus, the Three Origins exclusively govern the true nature, penetratingly illuminating and inspecting the lairs of ghosts and demons, allowing no concealment. The primordial Origin’s Brahman qi is the Golden Horse and the Yellow Path. The post route is swift transmission. This qi races along the Yellow Path to return to the divine chamber, universally proclaiming without end. Wherever this qi arrives, the myriad spirits heed its command. The Three Realms are the Three Fields and the Five Emperors, which are the Five Officials, all arrayed in speech to report their merits to the Supreme Clarity.

By worldly standards, as the scripture states, it is clear even without explanation.

The ode says:
Resplendent and majestic, the true command prevails,
Demons dare not transgress, ghosts lose their might.
Once the ancestral qi returns and the elixir is complete,
The Three Realms report in ranks to the Supreme Clarity.

The *Primal Cavern Jade Chronicle* spans the Dragon Han and Yan Kang eras. Through countless eons, within the primordial chaos, above there was no color, below no abyss. Wind and marsh pervaded the void, the Vajra qi rode the heavens. Between heaven above and heaven below, there was no darkness, no obscurity, no form, no shadow, no limit, no end. The vast Brahman qi stretched boundlessly, without light.

When the Crimson Clarity unfolded the chart, the kalpas turned naturally. The Primordial Origin settled and stabilized, unfolding the Five Scriptures. Crimson writings on jade, the eight mighty dragon scripts, preserved and regulated the kalpic cycles, ensuring the heavens endured forever. The Brahman qi suffused the cosmos, myriad patterns unfolded, the primordial net flowed and evolved, forming the thirty-two heavens. Revolving without form, they circled the ten directions. The Dipper rotated past the Winnowing Basket, cycling through the Five Constants. Thirty-five divisions gathered the qi of the Upper Origin. The Eight Sceneries merged in darkness, qi entered the profound mystery.

Master Shangyangzi said: This second chapter is the pulse of the scripture, the marrow of the elixir. Why? This chapter concerns the refinement of the golden liquid and the return of the elixir, thus revealing the crimson script as the tool for gathering the medicine. From the ten directions, they float through the void to arrive together before the Emperor, where they gather essence and unite spirit. Only today, rejoicing in deliverance, do they finally compose the elixir. Once the primordial qi returns to the origin, the Five Dipper Emperors within the body perform their duties, driving away evil and expelling the yin demons and ghostly qi, thus demonstrating the merit of "ten thousand ten thousand forms cut down."

*Laozi* says: "Inferior virtue acts with deliberate purpose." This describes the present chapter. This chapter concerns the refinement of the jade liquid great elixir, thus revealing the *Jade Chronicle* as the beginning of the kalpic record. The absence of darkness and obscurity, form and shadow, arises because the qi, having just returned, has not yet settled. Once the Primordial Origin’s Brahman qi stabilizes, myriad patterns unfold, leading to the ascension of the myriad qi as immortals.

The *Nine Grades Scripture* says: In ancient times, during the primordial chaos before the division of the heavens, the Primordial Origin first took shape. In the fifth kalpa, the initial transformation began, and the Brahman Origin Ancestral Dawn Dao Lord was commanded to record the celestial origin, governing the five kalpas. Thus, the *Primal Cavern* signifies the completion of the ancestral qi, while the *Jade Chronicle* records the celestial origin.

From the division of the primordial qi, the three causes formed the nine. Like dragons or stalks, they coiled through the nine paths, boundless and infinite, encompassing the origin of the nine yang ancestral qi. The Most High then harmonized the Brahman qi, initiating the ancestral qi of the Azure Heaven. Thus, the East received nine qi to divide its celestial realm, the kalpa named Dragon Han. The South received three qi to divide its realm, the kalpa named Crimson Clarity. The Center received twelve qi to divide its celestial realm, the kalpa named Supreme August. The West received seven qi to divide its realm, the kalpa named Yan Kang. The North received five qi to divide its celestial realm, the kalpa named Kai Huang. Once the five kalpas had run their course, the vast heavens took form. The primordial qi merged with the Dao, the Eight Sceneries radiated light. The Eight Emperors manifested, the Nine Empyreans differentiated, coalescing the five yang qi of the Primal Cavern into the *Jade Chronicle*. The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign was then commanded to record the initial kalpic cycles of the Primal Cavern, the origin of the revolving kalpas, and the merits of the Heavenly Perfected and Heavenly People in cultivating immortality, along with the path of ascent and retreat.

The Azure Origin Perfected said: The formation of heaven and earth began in the Dragon Han and ended in the Yan Kang. How many times have they nearly formed, nearly collapsed? Beyond reckoning. Hence, it is called "countless." With each kalpic destruction, heaven and earth dissolve, mountains and seas melt away, all phenomena vanish, leaving no trace of form or substance. Only the qi of the Primal Cavern remains undivided, indistinctly beginning its construction—this is called the primordial chaos. At this time, the true unity of water was enveloped in darkness, the five phases yet unformed. Above, there was no color; below, no abyss. Above, wind; below, marsh. The void was pervaded by emptiness, the Vajra qi bearing the root of heaven. "Obscurity" refers to what is hidden and manifest; "form and shadow" refer to phenomena. "Limit" refers to boundaries. "Vast expanse" describes boundless space.

Within the primordial chaos, between heaven above and heaven below, hidden and manifest, boundless and vast, phenomena were indistinguishable. Boundaries were undefined, only the vast Brahman qi stretched endlessly, without light or shadow. Later, when the golden wind qi rubbed to generate fire, the four images combined to produce earth, which bore heaven and earth and nurtured the myriad beings. This is called the Three Realms’ lofty perfected ones transcending calamitous kalpas. Compared to sentient beings, mired in birth and death, endlessly revolving, the return of the golden elixir to the origin is like enduring the trials of kalpic cycles. Now, fortunately, the Brahman qi has returned to the origin, yet remains without form or image.

When the Crimson Clarity unfolded the chart, in the first year of Crimson Clarity, the *Jade Chronicle* established the record. Heaven and earth, sun and moon, mountains and rivers, phenomena and forms divided and grew—just as the elixir finds its place. The four seasons progressed, each in its proper order, thus it is called "the kalpas turn naturally," akin to the primordial work of the elixir.

The Primordial Origin settled and stabilized, unfolding the Five Scriptures. The Primordial Origin observed the Brahman qi coalescing into form, carving jade into cloud-seal celestial scripts, bearing the five wondrous elements of the primordial spirit and true Dao. Thus, it is called the Five Scriptures. Those who awaken to its wonders enter its wonders; those who awaken to its origin enter its origin; those who awaken to its spirit enter its spirit; those who awaken to its truth enter its truth; those who awaken to its Dao enter its Dao.

chunks.original_text: 故尽妙合元，尽元合神，尽神合真，尽真合道。 字经火炼，故云赤书。 八威龙文，文列苍龙、巨虬、金师、麒麟、白虎、玄豹、丹蛇、巨獬之状，是云八威。 其文保制劫运，使天长存也。 梵炁弥罗，元炁所化曰梵炁。 先天地立，为大道根，元始资之而御运，天地赖之以生成，弥覆三界，罗络诸天。 两仪既张，物象咸布，故云万范开张，梵炁为元化之纲，流演於三十二天，如轮运转，从无色界周回十方，自斗至箕，回度五常，以日月五星合二十八宿，故云三十五分。 总受高上天元之炁，八景冥然，交合以成玄功，故云炁入玄玄。 皆喻还丹将结胎婴也。 颂曰：无形无影却寻综，一炁周回显圣功。 最是金丹灵妙处，开张万范广神通。 玄中太皇，上帝高真，泛景太霞，啸咏洞章。 金真朗郁，流响云营，玉音摄炁，灵风聚烟，紫虚郁秀，辅翼万仙。 千和万合，自然成真； 真中有神，长生大君。 无英公子，白元尊神，太乙司命，桃康合延，执符把箓，保命生根。 上游上清，出入华房，八冥之内，细微之中。 下镇人身，泥丸绛宫。 中理五炁，混合百神。 十转回灵，万炁齐仙。 仙道贵生，无量度人。 上开八门，飞天法轮，罪福禁戒，宿命因缘。 普受开度，死魂生身，身得受生，上闻诸天。 诸天之上，各有生门。 上阳子曰：此明金丹道用。 玄中，天心也，即人身正中之心。 太皇，元始也，即祖炁，曰道宝。 上帝，道君也，即金母，曰经宝。 高真老君也，即丹体，曰法宝。 是为一体三宝。 释云清净法身，是性圆满报身，是智千百亿化身，是行性与命合，阴悿阳舒，泛景太霞，啸咏洞章。 梵炁始生，泛然涵泳于元和之中。 金公乍还，快畅啸咏於洞章之句。 金真朗郁，金炁周行，流响云营。 炁营鄞鄂，玉音摄炁，玉液煎铅，灵风聚烟。 铅为汞制，紫虚郁秀，汞结紫花，辅翼万仙。 功行外备，千和万合，炼成一块，自然成真。 胎婴已成，真中有神，胎已凝神，长生主心，无英主肝，白元主肺，太乙主头，司命主神，桃康主脾，合延主肾。 执符把箓，炼炁合神。 上游上清，梵炁上行，出入华房，自顶至踵，头有三华之庭，体有 曲密之房。 八冥之内，皆炁通行，细微之中，无所不至。 下镇人身，升泥丸，下绛宫； 中理五炁，住黄庭，合百神，十转，而百灵回我，十月而万炁齐仙。 身外有身，真人出现，仙道贵乎长生，太上无量度人。 八门有长生之门，法轮乃运转之道。 凡世有罪福，宿命仙家，唯禁戒功缘，形神普受开度，死魂悉得生身。 此身得受长生，姓名上闻诸天，诸天校绿功行，随品定其生门。 功高则金阙侍宸，行满则上仙品级。 上阳子南岳侍赵老师，闻人诵《度人经》，问曰：何云金刚？ 乘天师曰：要莫糊涂，你且从头说来。 我先问你，混洞赤文是何物？ 就起揖问师曰：我闻这四字，便一身冷汗。 言下即悟，把此经一串透过。 师却曰：你知金刚乘天了也。 曰：通身是汗。 师曰：参须实参，悟须实悟，更向上说句来。 曰：如今超无色界了。 师鸣指一下，曰：如是，如是，这般话头，道是机锋，不怕罪福禁戒，忒恁泄露。 经旨所恃，将来过平育天魔王却肯保举也。 此经尊妙不可称量，故为三洞上品，道藏之首。
chunks.translated_text:
Thus, exhausting wonder merges with the Primordial Origin; exhausting the Primordial Origin merges with spirit; exhausting spirit merges with truth; exhausting truth merges with the Dao.

The script is refined by fire, hence called the "Red Writ." The Eight Mighty Dragon Scripts depict the forms of the Azure Dragon, Giant Wyrm, Golden Master, Qilin, White Tiger, Dark Leopard, Vermilion Serpent, and Great Xiezhi—these are the Eight Might. Their script safeguards against kalpic destruction, ensuring the heavens endure forever.

The Brahman qi pervades all, transformed from the primordial qi. Established before heaven and earth, it is the root of the Great Dao. The Primordial Origin relies upon it to govern the cosmos; heaven and earth depend on it for generation and completion. It blankets the Three Realms and envelops the myriad heavens. Once the Two Modes unfolded, all phenomena and forms spread forth—thus it is said, "the ten thousand patterns open and expand." The Brahman qi is the guiding principle of primordial transformation, flowing through the Thirty-Two Heavens like a turning wheel. From the Formless Realm, it circulates through the ten directions, from the Dipper to the Winnowing Basket, revolving through the Five Constants. With the sun, moon, five planets, and twenty-eight constellations, it forms the Thirty-Five Divisions. Receiving the qi of the Supreme Heavenly Origin, the Eight Luminaries merge in profound obscurity to accomplish the mysterious work—thus it is said, "qi enters the Mysterious of Mysterious." All this is likened to the elixir’s formation of the fetal embryo.

The ode states:
Though formless and traceless, seek its thread,
A single qi circulates, revealing sacred work.
Most wondrous is the numinous elixir’s place—
Expanding the ten thousand patterns, vast are its divine powers.

Within the Mysterious, the Supreme August One, the Lofty Perfected of the Emperor,
Drifts upon the grand auroras, chanting the cavernous chapters.
The Golden Perfected shines resplendent, its echoes flowing through the cloud camps;
Jade tones gather qi, numinous winds amass mist.
The Purple Void flourishes in elegance, aiding the myriad immortals.

A thousand harmonies, ten thousand unions—naturally perfected in truth;
Within truth dwells spirit, the Great Lord of Longevity.
The Peerless Duke, the White Prime Honored Spirit,
The Great One who Oversees Destiny, Peach Vitality and Union Longevity,
Grasp talismans and hold registers, preserving life and rooting existence.
Ascending to the Supreme Clarity, entering and exiting the Flowery Chamber,
Within the Eight Obscurities, amid the subtlest realms,
They descend to guard the human body, settling in the Muddy Pellet and Crimson Palace.
Centering the five qi, blending the hundred spirits,
Ten revolutions return the numinous, ten thousand qi unite in immortality.
The immortal Dao values life, boundlessly delivering beings.

Above, the Eight Gates open, the Dharma Wheel of Flying Heaven turns.
Sin and fortune, prohibitions and precepts, karmic causes and conditions—
Universally received and delivered, the dead soul revives in a new body.
Once the body attains rebirth, its name ascends to the myriad heavens.
Above the heavens, each has its Gate of Life.

Master Shangyang said: This elucidates the application of the golden elixir’s Dao.
The "Mysterious Within" is the Celestial Heart, the true center of the human body.
The "Supreme August One" is the Primordial Origin, the ancestral qi—called the Treasure of the Dao.
The "Emperor" is the Lord of the Dao, the Golden Mother—called the Treasure of the Scriptures.
The "Lofty Perfected" is the Venerable Lord, the elixir’s body—called the Treasure of the Dharma.
Together, they form the Three Treasures as One.

The Buddhist explanation speaks of the pure Dharma-body as essence, the perfect Reward-body as wisdom, and the thousand hundred million Transformation-bodies as practice. Essence and life unite; yin contracts while yang expands. Drifting upon the grand auroras, chanting the cavernous chapters—
The Brahman qi first arises, floating and swimming within primordial harmony.
The Golden Duke suddenly returns, joyously chanting the verses of the cavernous chapters.
The Golden Perfected shines resplendent, golden qi circulating, its echoes flowing through the cloud camps.
Qi camps in brilliance; jade tones gather qi—jade liquid refines lead, numinous winds amass mist.
Lead restrains mercury; the Purple Void flourishes in elegance—mercury congeals into purple blossoms, aiding the myriad immortals.
With external merits complete, a thousand harmonies and ten thousand unions smelt into one mass—naturally perfected in truth.
The fetal embryo formed, within truth dwells spirit—the embryo has consolidated spirit.
The Everlasting Lord governs the heart; the Peerless governs the liver; the White Prime governs the lungs; the Great One governs the head; the Overseer of Destiny governs the spirit; Peach Vitality governs the spleen; Union Longevity governs the kidneys.
Grasping talismans and holding registers, refining qi to unite with spirit,
Ascending to the Supreme Clarity, Brahman qi rises upward, entering and exiting the Flowery Chamber from crown to sole.
The head has the Three Flowery Courts; the body has the Curved and Secret Chambers.
Within the Eight Obscurities, qi circulates everywhere; amid the subtlest realms, it reaches all places.
Descending to guard the human body, ascending to the Muddy Pellet, descending to the Crimson Palace;
Centering the five qi, dwelling in the Yellow Court, uniting the hundred spirits.
Ten revolutions return the hundred numinous powers to me; ten months unite the ten thousand qi in immortality.
A body beyond the body—the Perfected One manifests.
The immortal Dao values longevity; the Most High boundlessly delivers beings.
The Eight Gates include the Gate of Longevity; the Dharma Wheel is the path of revolving transformation.
The worldly have sins and fortunes; the immortals of karmic destiny rely solely on precept merits and causal conditions.
Form and spirit universally receive deliverance; all dead souls attain rebirth.
This body achieves longevity, its name ascending to the myriad heavens.
The heavens review merits and deeds, determining the Gate of Life according to rank.
Those with great merit serve in the Golden Towers; those with perfected conduct ascend to the ranks of immortals.

Master Shangyang of the Southern Marchmount, attending Master Zhao, heard someone recite the *Scripture of Deliverance* and asked: "What is meant by 'Vajra'?"
The Heaven-Riding Master replied: "Do not be confused. Let us begin from the start.
First, I ask you: what is the *Chaotic Crimson Writ*?"
The disciple bowed and asked: "Upon hearing these four words, my whole body broke into a cold sweat."
At that moment, he awakened, penetrating this scripture in one stroke.
The master then said: "Now you understand the Vajra Heaven-Riding."
The disciple replied: "My entire body is drenched in sweat."
The master said: "Inquiry must be true inquiry; awakening must be true awakening. Speak further of what lies beyond."
The disciple said: "Now I have transcended the Formless Realm."
The master snapped his fingers and said: "Thus, thus! Such words are the thrust of the sword’s edge. Neither sin nor fortune, prohibitions nor precepts—how recklessly you reveal them!
The scripture’s essence relies on this. In the future, even the Demon King of the Yutian Heaven will surely endorse you."
This scripture’s sublimity is beyond measure, hence it is the supreme treasure of the Three Caverns and the foremost of the Daoist Canon.
