chunks.original_text: 东方八天 广生高映，觉元洞虚。 应玄九真，化交肇图。 交灵运构，宗范玄都。 感变总括，威昭自成。 缘岑迁景，皇道含明。 天琳耀权，炁晶育魂。 融罗负立，圆英隐旻。 期巨神包，洪纲告宁。 南方八天 章炎通泛，坚敷澄宗。 虚象玄华，龙阳舞穹。 微生霄艳，渊大凝冲。 元关三纽，大梵飞空。 隐觉隆益，天伦庆呈。 神户缠络，真元散精。 净握冥照，回合升迁。 导骞宴云，灵应腾天。 西方八天 刚泽微控，阴峻孤仪。 贯炁明素，宸洞开微。 周化幽应，澄虚帝台。 平遐揖虚，恢茂童池。 结飙临育，丽无散开。 阳通百六，沉芒隐阶。 幽廓冥默，真峰会灵。 坚丕顺道，告命骞林。 北方八天 龙安洞变，纯阳隐玄。 方本还炁，象伏高员。 神变惠化，解炼灵根。 赤精纯道，成号威尊。 利云友常，亿劫中丘。 郁城琼垒，谣音庆流。 受位玉室，大宪通幽。 玄章焕落，纲轮乃周。 龙章凤篆正文　道君撰 东方八天 观觉郁褴，大明紫灵。 九神度魂，开辟玉真。 阿奕炜烨，飞天流音。 轮景帝常，都灵颐臻。 豁落大有，庆云启灵。 七耀辉魔，恬懀敷荣。 虚无上首，天启弥宸。 四吁员象，濯曜腾精。 南方八天 焕赫洞阳，浮景玉光。 七灵谣歌，世元紫堂。 罗英散景，曜明玉房。 八景总兽，韶玉摄精。 九都骞郁，飞生上灵。 密罗净境，馥育空轮。 灌沃黄华，霐运玄明。 神宫开廓，延宛丹庭。 西方八天 大猷浮景，真定化元。 蜓宛素眇，玉梁澄烟。 萧峙结嵎，景罗七缠。 秀盘三府，流辉九玄。 寂然虚邈，飞华拂軿。 晨滥绿籍，太漠由延。 阿丘九度，六龙舞辕。 蓊蔼浮罗，紫精馥渊。 北方八天 溟涬太有，九机化乾。 覆形厚德，元河沦精。 育英明陀，景辰眇云。 大隗总监，秀乐禁天。 紫虚陀丘，劫量交前。 碧霞韵梵，眇眇游元。 六变运量，馘绝恶愆。 恢寂玄漠，万度成仙。 如上玉字一篇，乃龙章凤篆，正文皆诸天内名隐讳。 以玉简金书，秘于天之三十二宫，以镇三十二天。 诵念若勤，即获应感。 元始灵书中篇　道君撰 东方八天 亶娄阿苍，无想观音。 须延明首，法揽菩云。 稼那阿奕，忽诃流吟。 华都曲丽，鲜菩育臻。 答落大梵，散烟庆云。 飞洒玉都，明魔上门。 无行上首，回跖流玄。 阿陀龙罗，四象吁员。 亶娄阿苍无和观音。 元始以梵炁结此八字，而成云篆，以镇皇曾天。 玉京有亶楼，上承玄都宫，堂楼之监名阿那。 天中游冶台名苍无，乃虚无之境。 和，乃日月之户。 观，天帝讳。 音，即歌音。 谓每朝会，阿那先登直楼，呜大法鼓，集诸天真，朝元始於虚无之境，开日月之户。 元始命天帝观觉主长生箓，领众真登苍台，歌洞章之音，开度天人。 上阳子曰：灵书玉字，乃金丹异名，故云中篇。 训释言辞，明还丹之妙用，故云隐语。 学人到此，先具智慧眼，必有领悟处。 须延明首、法揽菩昙八字，云篆镇玉完天。 此天阙名须延，都候号曰明首，四真人名法揽菩昙。 凡当大劫交，元始命须延开玉府，纳诸仙圣，明首导诸天，主持梵炁。 於是法轮引籍，揽觉度魂，菩提转轮，昙颐扬旛。 自然九地开光，学人皆得受度。 稼那阿奕、忽诃流吟八字，云篆镇何童天。 稼那掌籍，真人阿奕，七宝琼林。 忽，飞天神王内名。 诃，释呼元始为摩诃。
chunks.translated_text:
The Eight Heavens of the East:
Vast and life-generating, their radiance soars high, awakening the primordial through emptiness. Responding to the Nine Perfected of Mystery, their transformative interplay begins the cosmic design. As numinous forces interweave and structures take form, they establish the ancestral model of the Mystic Capital. Embracing all transformations in their totality, their majestic power manifests spontaneously. Traversing peaks and shifting light, the Imperial Dao enfolds luminosity. The celestial jade gleams with authority, its qi crystallizing to nurture souls. Merging and unfolding, the circular essence conceals itself within the heavens. Awaiting the embrace of the colossal spirits, the grand net proclaims tranquility.

The Eight Heavens of the South:
Flourishing with blazing brilliance, they firmly unfold and clarify their lineage. The empty image of Mystery’s blossom, the Dragon-Yang dances across the vault. Subtle life arises in the dawn’s splendor, while the profound and vast congeal in stillness. The Three Nodes of the Primordial Pass, the Great Brahma soars through space. Hidden awakening brings abundant growth, as celestial kinship celebrates its manifestation. Divine portals entwine in networks, dispersing the essence of True Origin. In purity they grasp the obscure illumination, revolving and ascending in union. Guiding the soaring clouds in festive repose, the numinous response ascends to heaven.

The Eight Heavens of the West:
Firm and lustrous, subtly restrained, their yin stands solitary in solemnity. Piercing qi illumines purity, as the imperial cavern unfolds its subtlety. Encompassing transformation in hidden response, the Emperor’s Terrace clarifies the void. Extending peace to distant realms, they honor the flourishing Child’s Pool. Binding the whirlwind to nurture, their beauty remains undispersed. Yang connects to the Hundred and Six, as submerged radiance conceals its steps. In the vast and silent obscurity, the true peaks gather the numinous. Firm and majestic, they follow the Dao, proclaiming their mandate to the soaring forests.

The Eight Heavens of the North:
The Dragon’s Peace transforms in hidden change, Pure Yang conceals itself in mystery. The square root returns to qi, as images submit to the lofty round. Divine transformations bestow benevolent change, refining the numinous root. The Red Essence embodies the pure Dao, assuming the title of Majestic Honored One. Beneficent clouds accompany the eternal, amidst the Central Mound of kalpas. Towering jade fortresses, their odes resound in joyous flow. Receiving their positions in the Jade Chamber, the Great Statute penetrates the obscure. The Mystic Chapters gleam and scatter, as the net’s wheel completes its cycle.

The Dragon-Script and Phoenix-Seal Orthodox Text — Composed by the Dao Lord

The Eight Heavens of the East:
Contemplation awakens in lush abundance, the Great Radiance of Purple Numinosity. Nine spirits ferry souls, opening the jade perfection of creation. Ah Yi shines resplendently, as flying heavens stream their sounds. The wheel of light becomes the Emperor’s constancy, as the capital’s numen attains fulfillment. The vast expanse of Great Possession, as auspicious clouds initiate the numinous. The Seven Luminaries illuminate demons, spreading tranquility in flourishing glory. At the summit of emptiness and non-being, heaven’s mandate extends boundlessly. The Four Exhalations round the images, washing and ascending in radiant essence.

The Eight Heavens of the South:
Resplendent and blazing, penetrating Yang, floating light becomes jade’s brilliance. The Seven Numinous Ones chant their odes, as the kalpic origin establishes the Purple Hall. The net’s essence scatters light, illuminating the Jade Chamber. The Eight Sceneries gather their beasts, as the Shao Jade captures essence. The Nine Capitals soar in lush abundance, giving flight to the upper numina. The dense net purifies the realm, nurturing the empty wheel. Irrigating the Yellow Blossom, the vast movement revolves in mystic clarity. The divine palace unfolds in vastness, extending the cinnabar courtyard.

The Eight Heavens of the West:
The Great Plan floats in light, as true stability transforms the origin. Graceful and subtle, the jade beam clarifies the mist. Towering and erect, they bind the valleys, as light nets the Seven Coils. The Three Treasuries flourish in elegance, streaming radiance through the Nine Mysteries. Serene and distant in emptiness, flying blossoms brush the canopy. Dawn overflows the green registers, as the Great Desert extends its course. The Aligned Mounds ascend ninefold, as six dragons dance upon the axle. Lush and misty, the floating net, as purple essence perfumes the abyss.

The Eight Heavens of the North:
The Primordial Expanse of Great Possession, as the Nine Mechanisms transform Qian. Covering forms with profound virtue, the Primordial River submerges its essence. Nurturing the flourishing Mingtu, as light and stars drift in subtle clouds. The Great Hidden One oversees all, as the flourishing music guards heaven. The Purple Void of the Mingtu Mound, as kalpic measures intersect in the forefront. Azure radiance chants the Brahma tones, drifting subtly through the origin. Six transformations revolve their measures, severing evil transgressions. Vast and tranquil in mystic desert, ten thousand crossings achieve immortality.

The above jade script, in Dragon-Script and Phoenix-Seal, comprises the hidden and taboo names of the inner heavens. Inscribed on jade tablets in golden script, they are secreted within the thirty-two palaces of heaven to guard the thirty-two heavens. Diligence in recitation and invocation ensures responsive resonance.

The Numinous Writ of the Middle Chapter of the Primordial Beginning — Composed by the Dao Lord

The Eight Heavens of the East:
Danlou Acang, Wu Xiang Guanyin.
Xuyan Mingshou, Falan Poutan.
Jiana Ayi, Huhe Liuyin.
Huadu Quli, Xianpu Yuzhen.
Daluo Dafan, Sanyan Qingyun.
Feisa Yudu, Mingmo Shangmen.
Wuxing Shangshou, Huizhi Liuxuan.
Atuo Longluo, Sixiang Xuyuan.
Danlou Acang Wuhe Guanyin.

The Primordial Beginning wove these eight characters from Brahma qi into cloud-seals to guard the Heaven of August Antiquity. Within the Jade Capital stands the Danlou Tower, which upholds the Mystic Capital Palace, where the overseer of halls and towers is named Ana. The wandering terrace within heaven is called Cangwu, the realm of emptiness and non-being. *He* signifies the gate of sun and moon. *Guan* is the taboo name of the Heavenly Emperor. *Yin* denotes the sound of song. Thus, at each courtly assembly, Ana first ascends the tower, striking the great Dharma drum to gather the perfected of the heavens, paying homage to the Primordial Beginning in the realm of emptiness and non-being, opening the gate of sun and moon. The Primordial Beginning commands the Heavenly Emperor to observe and oversee the Register of Longevity, leading the host of perfected to ascend the Cang Terrace, chanting the sounds of the Cavern Chapters to initiate the deliverance of heavenly beings.

The Upper Yang Master states: The jade script of the Numinous Writ is another name for the Golden Elixir, hence it is called the Middle Chapter. Its explanatory phrases elucidate the wondrous workings of the Reverted Elixir, thus they are termed hidden language. At this stage, the practitioner must first possess the eye of wisdom, for there will surely be points of realization.

Xuyan Mingshou, Falan Poutan—these eight characters in cloud-seals guard the Heaven of Jade Perfection. The gate of this heaven is named Xuyan, and its capital overseer is titled Mingshou. The Four Perfected Ones are named Falan Poutan. Whenever a great kalpic transition occurs, the Primordial Beginning commands Xuyan to open the Jade Treasury, admitting the immortals and sages, while Mingshou guides the heavens to sustain Brahma qi. Thereupon, the Dharma Wheel draws the registers, embracing awakening to ferry souls; the Bodhi Wheel turns, as Poutan raises the banner. Naturally, the Nine Earths radiate light, and all practitioners receive deliverance.

Jiana Ayi, Huhe Liuyin—these eight characters in cloud-seals guard the Heaven of Harmonious Youth. Jiana oversees the registers, the Perfected One Ayi of the Seven-Jewel Jade Grove. *Hu* is the inner name of the Flying Heavenly Divine King. *He* interprets as invoking the Primordial Beginning as Mahā.

chunks.original_text: 流，布也。 吟歌也。 元始嘘呵元梵之炁，充满阿奕七宝之林，自成灵音，流布万天。 稼那举籍，以定生死，飞天大圣度脱天人。 华都曲丽，解菩育臻八字，云篆镇平育天。 华都，东极青华之都，一名太乙青华之门。 曲，洞章之歌。 丽，乃玉女名。 鲜是庆云。 菩，楼名。 育，帝讳。 臻，至也。 元始居太乙华都，命仙圣领诸玉女，登菩楼歌洞章，庆云四集，育帝始至。 开度长夜，召魔举仙。 答落大梵，散烟庆云八字，云篆镇文举天。 答落，宫庭名。 大梵，曲，赦恩。 散烟庆云，天中梵炁，元始游答落之庭，开大梵之赦，放宥罪魂，收摄元炁，故得梵炁还元，结成祥烟庆云，而归金胎神室。 飞洒玉都，明魔上门八字，云篆镇摩夷天。 飞，飞天； 洒，神速； 玉，玉真； 都，酆都。 明，命也； 魔，魔王； 上门，上帝金门。 元始与飞天众圣演说妙道，自龙汉至延康，洒然神速，一会即了。 当此之时，玉真开长夜之府，酆都度八难之魂，勅命魔王保举身朝上帝金门。 无行上首，回跖流玄八字，云篆镇越衡天。 元始以虚无妙道，流行梵炁，钢维八极，上以弥罗诸天，首环北帝之宫。 苦大劫交运，应数周。 上帝回施流晨之光华，跖履玄空以布化。 阿陀龙罗，四象吁贠八字，云篆镇蒙翳天。 天中山名阿，山中楼名陀，空峰山名龙，日月光曰罗。 故天真呼日为濯罗。 四，四极。 象，象车。 吁，南昌帝讳。 贠，日中童名。

"Flow" signifies dissemination; "chant" signifies song. The Primordial Beginning exhales the qi of the primordial Brahma, filling the Seven-Jewel Grove of Ayi, naturally forming numinous sounds that flow and spread through the ten thousand heavens. Jiana raises the registers to determine life and death, while the Flying Heavenly Great Sage delivers the celestial beings.

Huadu Quli, these eight characters in cloud-seals guard the Heaven of Harmonious Nurture. *Hua* refers to the Eastern Marchmount’s Azure Flower Capital, also named the Gate of the Great One’s Azure Flower. *Du* signifies the hymns of cavernous chapters. *Qu* is the name of a Jade Maiden. *Li* denotes auspicious clouds. *Pu* is the name of a tower. *Yu* is the imperial taboo name. *Zhen* means "to arrive." The Primordial Beginning, dwelling in the Great One’s Azure Flower Capital, commands the immortals and sages to lead the Jade Maidens, ascending the Pu Tower to chant cavernous hymns as auspicious clouds gather on all sides and the Yu Emperor first arrives. The long night is enlightened, demons are summoned, and immortals are raised.

Daluo, these eight characters in cloud-seals guard the Heaven of Literary Elevation. *Daluo* is the name of a palace courtyard. *Great Brahma* refers to the hymn of amnesty. *Scattered mist and auspicious clouds* signify the Brahma qi within the heavens. As the Primordial Beginning roams the courtyard of Daluo, opening the Great Brahma’s amnesty, pardoning sinful souls, and gathering the primordial qi, the Brahma qi returns to its origin, coalescing into propitious mist and auspicious clouds to return to the Golden Womb’s divine chamber.

Feisa Yudu, these eight characters in cloud-seals guard the Heaven of Majestic Tranquility. *Fei* denotes the Flying Ones; *sa*, divine swiftness; *yu*, Jade Perfected; *du*, Fengdu. *Ming* signifies command; *mo*, demon kings; *shangmen*, the Golden Gate of the Supreme Emperor. The Primordial Beginning, with the Flying Heavenly Host of Sages, expounds the wondrous Dao from the Dragon Han to the Yan Kang eras, swiftly and divinely, completing the assembly in an instant. At this time, the Jade Perfected opens the long night’s repository, Fengdu delivers souls from the eight adversities, and the demon kings are commanded to escort and present themselves at the Supreme Emperor’s Golden Gate.

Wuxing Shangshou, these eight characters in cloud-seals guard the Heaven of Transcendent Balance. The Primordial Beginning, with the wondrous Dao of emptiness and non-being, circulates the Brahma qi, binding the eight poles, and above, envelops the heavens of Miro. At the head stands the palace of the Northern Emperor. When the great kalpic transition occurs and the destined cycle completes, the Supreme Emperor returns the flowing radiance of dawn, treading the dark void to disseminate transformation.

Atuoluo Long, these eight characters in cloud-seals guard the Heaven of Veiled Brilliance. *A* is the name of a mountain in heaven; *tuo*, the name of a tower within the mountain; *long*, the name of the Empty Peak Mountain; *luo* signifies the light of sun and moon—thus the Heavenly Perfected call the sun Zhuoluo. *Four* refers to the four extremities; *xiang*, the chariot of symbols; *xu*, the taboo name of the Southern Flourishing Emperor; *yun*, the name of the solar child.

chunks.original_text: 阿山，龙山，势相交通，炁与玉清相属，九折而上连，接陀楼日月之光，普照四极，真人俱乘象车，下度学人，引谒南丹吁帝以求真阳之火，炼度生身。 吁帝即命日中负童以九阳金精之华，灌炼其体，如上所释，化凡证圣。 天尊慈悲，悯怜愚昧，降此灵书玉字隐语，使上士行灵书之道而顿悟，中士闻玉字之玄而渐修，下士诵隐语之经而求福，此之谓灵宝大梵之妙也。 颂曰：妙哉《灵宝度人经》，云篆天章閟玉清。 阿奕华都行梵炁，幽冥闻此获更生。 南方八天 南阎洞浮，玉眸诜诜。 梵形落空，九灵推前。 凙菩台，绿罗大千。 眇莽九丑，韶谣缘邅。 云上九都，飞生自骞。 那育郁馥，摩罗法轮。 霐池无镜，揽姿运容。 馥朗廓奕，神缨自宫。 南阎洞浮、玉眸诜诜，八字云篆，镇和阳天。 南方丹天世界，有流火之庭，飞阎焕乎八方，中有洞阳宫，火炁炎浮玉眸，火之膏质诜诜大盛，光明交映，炼度学人。 梵形落空、九灵推前八字，云篆镇恭华天。 元始自龙汉暨延康，从劫至劫，化生人物，皆凝大梵之炁以成形。 一神变现，不受胎育，从空而生。 玉都九灵真人散金花于推前之台，啸咏洞章，开度天人。 凙菩台、绿罗大千，八字云篆，镇宗飘天。 凙，天中山名。 ，道君内讳。 菩，飞天内音，台，凙山之阳有玉台。 绿罗，月宫玉妃名绿罗。 广寒玉嫔名罗英，日宫仙童 名濯罗，扶桑灵童名贠。 大千，南阎浮提为大千世界。 凡一千世界为小千，一千小千为中千，一千中千为大千。 以三次言千，而曰三千。 凙山，众龙所伏，中有黄房，君所居。 从劫至劫，不灭不生，时领飞天大圣，登玉台、歌洞章，以度天人。 绿罗玉妃，光照大千世界，其形如玉，美艾不艳，乘大梵之炁，理大阴度数，以应天元，无有差忒。 若大劫交，日月俱会，玉台含光潜耀以俟劫运再开。 复元运化、金液炼形之士，於此寻下手处。 眇莽九丑、韶谣缘邅，八字云篆，镇皇笳天。 眇莽，混沌之状。 九丑，大力鬼兽。 韶，魔王名。 谣即谣歌。 缘，南斗内讳。 邅，北斗隐名。 天地未分，其状眇莽，九兽之鬼，齐天而生，考人善恶。 魔王复谣歌以心恼试学人，若居欲境，虽艳色冶容而心愈坚固，转色界，为神仙境界。 变欲心为清净道心，则北斗除其黑籍，南斗与注仙名，保举之司引入此天。 金华山求太乙合同符契以游宴诸天也。 云上九都、飞生自骞八字，云篆镇堂耀天。 云上，神王讳； 九都，玄台名。 飞生，更生大神名； 自骞，从入骞林也。 飞天神王云上焚百和香，散五云花。 太真玉郎执十绝旛，一日三回。 回旛一周，则诸天帝齐集九都台下，绕台三匝，诵咏洞章，开度学人。 若识此歌音，则更生大神开不死之门，流长生之炁，炼其形魂，从而保举入骞林，游玄台。 又二十四年，行圆功满，得上朝玄都。 那育郁馥、摩罗法轮八字，云篆镇端靖天。 那，天中侍郎； 育，天阙空轮。 郁馥，斗中仙童； 摩罗，天中魔王； 法轮，天宫法轮。 侍郎那主四时之炁，运天阙空轮，正天分度。 若大劫交，法轮十转，万神俱至，郁馥唱礼，一唱则万神齐礼。 魔王歌洞章之曲，受度学人。 霐池无镜、搅姿运容八字，云篆镇恭庆天灵，神龙之渊； 持，龙渊都监。

The A Mountain and Dragon Mountain, their forces interlinked, their qi conjoined with the Jade Purity, ascend in ninefold turns to connect with the Tower of Tuo, where the light of sun and moon shines universally upon the four extremities. The Perfected all ride the chariot of symbols to descend and ferry learners, guiding them to pay homage to the Southern Cinnabar Yu Emperor and seek the fire of true yang, refining and delivering their living bodies. The Yu Emperor then commands the solar child bearing the flower of ninefold yang golden essence to bathe and refine their forms, as explained above, transforming the mortal to attain sagehood.

The Heavenly Venerable, moved by compassion for the benighted, bestows this numinous script of jade characters and hidden language, so that superior practitioners may follow the Way of the Numinous Script and attain sudden enlightenment; middling practitioners may hear the mystery of the jade characters and cultivate gradually; and lesser practitioners may recite the scripture of hidden language to seek blessings—this is called the wondrous subtlety of the Great Brahma’s Numinous Treasure.

*Eulogy:*
How wondrous the *Scripture of Numinous Treasure Delivering Humanity*!
Cloud-seal celestial chapters are concealed in the Jade Purity.
The radiant capital of A spreads flowing Brahma qi,
And the netherworld, upon hearing this, gains rebirth.

**The Eight Heavens of the South**
**Nanyan Dongfu**, Jade Eyes shimmering.
The Brahma form descends into emptiness; the Nine Numinous advance.
The Terrace of Duo and Wei, the Green Gauze of the Great Thousand.
Vast and boundless, the Nine Uglies; the Shao chants wind along the margin.
Above the clouds, the Nine Capitals—flying life soars of itself.
Nayu’s lush fragrance, Mara’s Dharma Wheel.
The Mirrorless Pool of Hong; seizing posture, moving countenance.
Fragrance bright and expansive; the divine tassel self-contained.

**Nanyan Dongfu, Jade Eyes shimmering**—these eight characters in cloud-seals guard the Heaven of Harmonious Yang. The Southern Cinnabar Heavenly Realm holds the Court of Flowing Fire, where flying portals blaze across the eight directions. At its center lies the Cavernous Yang Palace, where fiery qi flames upon the jade pupils, the rich essence of fire flourishing in great splendor. Light and brilliance intermingle to refine and deliver learners.

**The Brahma form descends into emptiness; the Nine Numinous advance**—these eight characters in cloud-seals guard the Heaven of Reverent Florescence. From the Dragon Han kalpa to the Yan Kang kalpa, from eon to eon, the Primordial Beginning transforms and gives life to beings, all congealing the great Brahma qi to form their shapes. A single spirit manifests without undergoing gestation, born from emptiness. The Nine Numinous Perfected of the Jade Capital scatter golden flowers upon the Terrace of Advancement, whistling and chanting cavernous hymns to deliver heavenly beings.

**The Terrace of Duo and Wei, the Green Gauze of the Great Thousand**—these eight characters in cloud-seals guard the Heaven of Ancestral Drift. *Duo* is the name of a mountain in heaven; *Wei* is the inner taboo name of the Dao Lord. *Pu* is the inner sound of the flying heavens; *Terrace* refers to the jade terrace on the southern slope of Duo Mountain. *Green Gauze* is the name of the Jade Consort of the Moon Palace. The Jade Concubine of Broad Cold is named Luo Ying; the solar child of the Sun Palace is named Zhuoluo; the numinous child of Fusang is named Yun. The *Great Thousand* refers to the Southern Jambu Continent as the Great Thousand World. A thousand worlds form a Small Thousand; a thousand Small Thousands form a Middle Thousand; a thousand Middle Thousands form a Great Thousand. Speaking thrice of thousands, it is called the Three Thousand. Duo Mountain is where all dragons submit; at its center lies the Yellow Chamber, the dwelling of the Wei Lord. From eon to eon, it neither perishes nor arises, and in due time, it leads the flying heavenly sages to ascend the Jade Terrace, sing cavernous hymns, and deliver heavenly beings. The Green Gauze Jade Consort illuminates the Great Thousand World; her form is like jade, beautiful yet not alluring. She rides the great Brahma qi, governing the calculations of the Great Yin to correspond with the celestial origin, without error. When the great kalpic transition occurs and sun and moon converge, the Jade Terrace conceals its light and silently shines, awaiting the reopening of the kalpic cycle. Those who restore the primordial transformation and refine their forms with golden liquid seek their starting point here.

**Vast and boundless, the Nine Uglies; the Shao chants wind along the margin**—these eight characters in cloud-seals guard the Heaven of August Reed Pipes. *Vast and boundless* describes the state of chaos. The *Nine Uglies* are mighty demonic beasts. *Shao* is the name of a demon king; *chants* refer to demonic songs. *Margin* is the inner taboo name of the Southern Dipper; *Zhan* is the hidden name of the Northern Dipper. Before heaven and earth divided, their state was vast and boundless; the nine demonic beasts of the Uglies were born equal to heaven, examining human good and evil. The demon king further sings songs to vex and test learners. If one dwells in the realm of desire yet remains steadfast in heart despite alluring beauty and seductive charm, transforming the realm of desire into the realm of the divine, turning desire into the pure mind of the Dao, then the Northern Dipper removes their name from the black register, and the Southern Dipper inscribes their name as an immortal, with the supervising office guiding them into this heaven. They seek the Golden Flower Mountain to obtain the Taiyi Unification Talisman and roam the various heavens in revelry.

**Above the clouds, the Nine Capitals—flying life soars of itself**—these eight characters in cloud-seals guard the Heaven of Hallowed Radiance. *Above the clouds* is the taboo name of the Divine King; the *Nine Capitals* is the name of the Mystic Terrace. *Flying life* is the name of the Great God of Rebirth; *of itself* refers to entering the Forest of Soaring. The Flying Heavenly Divine King burns hundredfold harmonious incense above the clouds and scatters five-colored cloud flowers. The Jade Lad of the Great Perfected holds the Ten Absolute Banners, circling thrice daily. Each revolution of the banner gathers all the heavenly emperors beneath the Terrace of the Nine Capitals, who circumambulate the terrace thrice, chanting cavernous hymns to deliver learners. If one recognizes this song, the Great God of Rebirth opens the gate of deathlessness, flowing the qi of eternal life to refine their form and soul, and then recommends them to enter the Forest of Soaring and roam the Mystic Terrace. After twenty-four years, when their merit is complete, they may ascend to pay homage at the Mystic Capital.

**Nayu’s lush fragrance, Mara’s Dharma Wheel**—these eight characters in cloud-seals guard the Heaven of Upright Tranquility. *Na* is the celestial attendant; *Yu* is the empty wheel of the heavenly gate. *Lush fragrance* is the immortal child of the Dipper; *Mara* is the demon king of heaven; *Dharma Wheel* is the Dharma Wheel of the heavenly palace. The attendant Na governs the qi of the four seasons, turning the empty wheel of the heavenly gate to regulate the divisions of heaven. When the great kalpic transition occurs, the Dharma Wheel turns ten times, and all spirits gather. The lushly fragrant one intones the rites, and with a single chant, all spirits bow in unison. The demon king sings the melody of the cavernous hymns to deliver learners.

**The Mirrorless Pool of Hong; seizing posture, moving countenance**—these eight characters in cloud-seals guard the Heaven of Reverent Celebration, the abyss of the divine dragon. *Hong* is the name of the dragon abyss; *Chi* is the supervisor of the Dragon Abyss.

chunks.original_text: 无镜，神王名； 搅姿，天门名； 运容，玄和玉女名。 九龙伏于深渊，都监常含金罂，运东井黄华天元真一之水，灌炼天人，无镜开长夜之府，度其九祖，升超天门。 然后运容玉女，开导学人，炼之以朱灵之炁，濯之以玄和之津。 变炼其体，灌注其形。 馥朗廓奕，神缨自宫八字，云篆镇极瑶天。 馥朗，玄台山名； 廓奕，神公内号神。 缨，紫微灵童名； 自宫，升紫微宫。 谓神公郭奕与元始同生，为玄炁之祖，常歌洞章於馥朗之台，神缨灵童引导学人升紫微宫，上朝元始。 大修行人炼己纯净，凝玉眸流火之膏，乘绿罗大梵之炁，居欲境而九丑不能考过，入金华而太乙即与合同； 霐持开治炼之场，运容灌玄和之液，朱灵炼质，黄华荡形，飞生更生，神缨导引，升入紫微宫也。 颂曰：妙哉《灵宝度人经》，玉简金书蒨上清。 郁馥敬躬申唱礼，神公廓奕保仙名。 西方八天 刀利禅猷，婆泥咎通。 宛薮涤色，太眇之堂。 流罗梵萌，景蔚萧嵎。 易邈无寂，宛首少都。 阿褴郁竺，华漠延由。 九开自辩，阿那品首。 无量扶盖，浮罗合神。 玉诞长桑，栢空度仙。 刀利禅猷、婆泥咎通八字，云篆镇孔升天。 刀利，南方世界。 禅，黎国名。 猷，好生君名。 婆泥，洞阳宫灵童名。 咎通，魔王内讳。 元始於刀利世界禅黎国洞阳宫，火炼真文，洞焕万天，化此世界，为大福堂。 一切罪魂咸令升入，学人道成，则猷君度命，婆泥炼魂； 魔王咎通，敬受所事，不敢遏绝生门。 宛薮涤色、太眇之堂八字，云篆镇皇崖天。 宛薮，天帝内号。 涤，涤荡。 色，色界。 太眇之堂，即天中大福堂，乃天之秘府，中隐大洞自然之文。 皇崖天帝主开大漠之经，理治天炁，每领诸仙游行色界。 诸天出入上清之府，荡涤秽气，开度学人。 行业高者，得乘景云之车，上生太眇之堂。 流罗梵萌、景蔚萧码八字，云篆镇极风天。 流，天王讳。 罗，月后名。 梵，飞天真人内音。 萌，元始天王内名。 景皇，四极上真； 蔚秀，景霄仙人； 萧嵎，劫仞之宫。 即西方白素元君，奥室流君，正九霄之炁，月后主游宴之仪，飞天开九霄之关，萌君为梵炁之祖，景皇蔚秀，开治萧嵎之宫。 学人解悟此音，方可驭丹龙之辔，以升九皇之台。 易邈无寂，宛首少都八字，云篆镇孝芒天。 易邈，始皇帝讳。 无寂，天中庭名。 宛首，道君内音。 少都，日中童名。 始皇天帝自龙汉至赤明劫，居虚无寂寂之庭，奉道君而演奥，明妙法以度人。 灵童少都流以飞霞之彩，灌以日华之精。 阿褴郁竺、华漠延由八字，云篆镇浮容天。 阿褴，天帝隐讳。 郁默，魔王内名。 竺，欲界。 华，色界。 漠，渺漠。 延，东鬼之庭。 由，禁鬼之房。 郁魔隐现，或居欲界，或居色界，恼乱天人，渺漠难制。 帝君阿褴登九层之楼，歌洞章以摄之。 於是众魔应响而束身，群鬼诣由而伏形。 九开自辩、阿那品首八字，云篆镇江由天。 天地未判，三炁混沌，九度初开，阴阳男女自然明辩。 帝君阿丘常登龙山九玄之都，劲诸飞天那邪游空，开度善根之人，品度其魂，入飞仙之上首。 无量扶盖、浮罗合神八字，云篆镇阮乐天。 无量，天中大圣。 扶，更生君名。 盖，此天宫名。 浮，幽魂之呼。 罗，大罗。 合，合庆。 神，神公。
chunks.translated_text:
The Mirrorless is the name of a divine king; *Seizing Posture* is the name of the Heavenly Gate; *Moving Countenance* is the name of the Mysterious Harmony Jade Maiden. Nine dragons crouch in the abyss, and the Supervisor of the Dragon Abyss ever holds a golden flask, channeling the Yellow Flower Heavenly Primordial True Unity’s water from the Eastern Well to refine and temper the celestial beings. The Mirrorless opens the long-night repository to deliver their nine generations of ancestors, ascending beyond the Heavenly Gate. Thereafter, the Moving Countenance Jade Maiden guides the learners, refining them with the crimson numinous *qi* and bathing them in the fluid of Mysterious Harmony. Their bodies are transmuted, their forms infused. *Fragrant Radiance, Vast Brilliance*—these eight cloud-seals guard the Ultimate Jade Heaven. *Fragrant Radiance* is the name of the Mysterious Terrace Mountain; *Vast Brilliance* is the inner title of the divine lord. *Tassel* is the name of the Purple Tenuity numinous child; *Self-Palace* means ascending to the Purple Tenuity Palace. The divine lord Guo Yi was born together with the Primordial Beginning and is the ancestor of the mysterious *qi*. He ever chants the cavernous hymns upon the Fragrant Radiance Terrace, while the Tassel numinous child leads learners to ascend to the Purple Tenuity Palace and pay homage to the Primordial Beginning. The greatly cultivated practitioner, having refined the self to purity, congeals the jade pupils into flowing fire-ointment, rides the green silk of the Great Brahma *qi*, and dwells within the realm of desire without the Nine Shameful Ones being able to examine his transgressions. Entering the Golden Flower, he immediately unites with the Grand Monad. The *Hong* Supervisor opens the refining ground; the Moving Countenance pours the fluid of Mysterious Harmony; the crimson numinous refines the substance; the Yellow Flower washes the form. Reborn and regenerated, guided by the Tassel, they ascend into the Purple Tenuity Palace.

The ode says:
How wondrous the *Scripture of the Numinous Treasure for Salvation of Humanity*!
Jade tablets and golden writ adorn the Highest Clarity.
The lushly fragrant one bows in reverence to intone the rites,
While the divine lord Vast Brilliance safeguards the immortal name.

**The Eight Heavens of the West:**
*Daoli Chanyou, Poni Joutong. Wansou Dise, Taimiao’s Hall. Liuluo Fanmeng, Jingwei Xiaoyu. Yimiao Wuji, Wanshou Shaodu. Alan Yuzhu, Huamo Yanyou. Jiukai Zibian, Anapin Shou. Wuliang Fugai, Fuluo Heshen.*

*Daoli Chanyou* and *Poni Joutong*—these eight characters in cloud-seals guard the Heaven of Ascending Aperture. *Daoli* is the southern world; *Chan* is the name of the Li state; *You* is the name of the Lord of Good Birth. *Poni* is the name of the numinous child of the Cavernous Yang Palace; *Joutong* is the inner taboo of the demon king. In the *Daoli* world of the Li state’s Cavernous Yang Palace, the Primordial Beginning fired the true writ to illumine the myriad heavens, transforming this world into the Great Blessing Hall. All sinful souls are thereby enabled to ascend and enter. When learners attain the Dao, the Lord of Good Birth delivers their lives, Poni refines their souls, and the demon king Joutong reverently receives his charge, daring not obstruct the gate of life.

*Wansou Dise* and *Taimiao’s Hall*—these eight characters in cloud-seals guard the Heaven of August Precipice. *Wansou* is the inner title of the Heavenly Emperor; *Di* means to cleanse; *Se* refers to the realm of form. *Taimiao’s Hall* is the Great Blessing Hall within heaven, the secret repository of heaven wherein lies the great cavern’s natural writ. The Heavenly Emperor of August Precipice presides over the opening of the great desert’s scriptures, governing the heavenly *qi*. He often leads the various immortals to wander the realm of form. The various heavens enter and exit the Highest Clarity’s repository, cleansing impure *qi* and opening the path for learners. Those whose conduct is lofty may ride the cloud chariot to ascend and be born in Taimiao’s Hall.

*Liuluo Fanmeng* and *Jingwei Xiaoyu*—these eight characters in cloud-seals guard the Heaven of Ultimate Wind. *Liu* is the taboo of the Heavenly King; *Luo* is the name of the Lunar Consort; *Fan* is the inner sound of the Flying Heavenly Perfected; *Meng* is the inner name of the Primordial Beginning Heavenly King. *Jinghuang* is the Highest Perfected of the Four Poles; *Weixiu* is the Perfected of the Radiant Empyrean; *Xiaoyu* is the palace of kalpic measure. This is the White Primordial Sovereign of the West, the Recondite Chamber Flowing Lord, who rectifies the *qi* of the Nine Empyreans. The Lunar Consort presides over the rites of feasting and wandering; the Flying Perfected opens the passes of the Nine Empyreans; the Meng Lord is the ancestor of the Brahma *qi*; the Jinghuang and Weixiu open and govern the Xiaoyu Palace. Only when learners comprehend this sound may they rein the cinnabar dragon’s bridle to ascend the terrace of the Nine August Ones.

*Yimiao Wuji* and *Wanshou Shaodu*—these eight characters in cloud-seals guard the Heaven of Filial Purity. *Yimiao* is the taboo of the First Emperor; *Wuji* is the name of the heavenly courtyard. *Wanshou* is the inner sound of the Dao Lord; *Shaodu* is the name of the solar child. From the Dragon Han to the Vermilion Bright kalpa, the Heavenly Emperor of the First Beginning dwells in the courtyard of emptiness and silence, serving the Dao Lord to expound the profound and elucidate the wondrous Dharma to deliver humanity. The numinous child Shaodu flows with flying rosy clouds and irrigates with the essence of solar splendor.

*Alan Yuzhu* and *Huamo Yanyou*—these eight characters in cloud-seals guard the Heaven of Floating Repose. *Alan* is the hidden taboo of the Heavenly Emperor; *Yumo* is the inner name of the demon king. *Zhu* is the realm of desire; *Hua* is the realm of form; *Mo* is the vast and distant; *Yan* is the courtyard of eastern ghosts; *You* is the chamber that restrains ghosts. The Yumo demon king appears and vanishes, sometimes dwelling in the realm of desire, sometimes in the realm of form, harassing and disturbing the heavenly beings, vast and distant and difficult to control. The Emperor Alan ascends the nine-tiered tower to chant the cavernous hymns and subdue them. Thereupon, the multitude of demons respond to the echo and bind themselves, while the host of ghosts prostrate their forms before You.

*Jiukai Zibian* and *Anapin Shou*—these eight characters in cloud-seals guard the Heaven of Riverine Flow. Before heaven and earth were divided, the three *qi* were in chaos. When the nine openings first emerged, yin and yang, male and female naturally became distinct. The Emperor Aqiu ever ascends the Dragon Mountain’s Nine Mysteries capital to command the flying heavenly ones to roam the void, opening the path for those of good roots. Their souls are graded and ranked, entering the foremost rank of flying immortals.

*Wuliang Fugai* and *Fuluo Heshen*—these eight characters in cloud-seals guard the Heaven of Joyous Music. *Wuliang* is the great sage of heaven; *Fu* is the name of the Lord of Regeneration; *Gai* is the name of this heavenly palace. *Fu* is the cry of the hidden souls; *Luo* is the Great Web; *He* means to join in celebration; *Shen* refers to the divine lord.

chunks.original_text: 无量大圣总统飞天，皆受品量而升进之。 更生君居盖宫，主长夜之箓，定善恶之根，度诸幽魂升大罗天，与神公合庆也。 玉诞长桑、栢空度仙八字，云篆镇昙誓天。 玉诞，玉都。 长桑，扶桑骞林。 栢，栢陵。 空，空洞。 度仙，度人成仙。 玉都有骞木扶桑之林，鹰覆诸天，叶皆紫字金书。 每神风吹返魂之草，则朵林鼓百籁之音，一如天尊昔栢陵说法时，林木自成空洞之歌。 有灵鸡栖于上，一鸣则天下鸡皆呜。 於是青霞扶摇，太阳乃升，诸飞天真听鸡初鸣，上登玉台，探五方之云牙，吸咽三晨之光，以度学仙之人。 上根之士，一志清净，虽居竺华之境，郁魔不能恼乱，乃得少都灌真，流罗主宴，桑林鼓籁，太阳流晖以成还丹也。 颂曰：妙哉《灵宝度人经》，八角垂芒晃太清。 太眇之堂无色界，长桑林下咽华精。 北方八天 玃无自育，九日导乾。 坤母东覆，形摄上玄。 陁罗育邈，眇炁合云。 飞天大丑，总监上天。 沙陁劫量，龙汉瑛鲜。 碧落浮黎，空歌保珍。 恶奕无品，洞妙自真。 元梵恢漠，幽寂度人。 玃无自育、九日导乾八字，云篆镇霄度天。 飞天玃无，自龙汉溟涬之间，乘运而出，时与育帝乘凤车游九玄之乡，转九机之度，以应劫运之数。 大劫交，则日华童子停光运化，回度天常之乾道，开导和炁也。 坤母东覆、形摄上玄八字，云篆镇元洞天。 坤母，大阴九灵仙母。 东覆，东海理水神名。 形，地机。 摄，召也。 上，上告。 玄，玄都。
chunks.translated_text:
The Great Sage of *Wuliang* governs all flying heavens, who ascend and advance according to their graded ranks. The Lord of Regeneration resides in the *Gai* Palace, presiding over the registers of the Long Night, determining the roots of good and evil, and ferrying all hidden souls to the Great *Luo* Heaven to join the Divine Lord in celebration.

The eight characters *Yudan Changsang* and *Bokong Duxian* in cloud-seals guard the *Tan Shi* Heaven. *Yudan* is the Jade Capital; *Changsang* is the *Fusang* Forest of Ascending Trees; *Bo* is *Boling*; *Kong* is the Void; *Duxian* means to ferry humans to immortality. Within the Jade Capital stands the *Fusang* Forest of Ascending Trees, its canopy overspreading all heavens, its leaves inscribed with golden characters in purple script. Whenever the divine wind stirs the *fan hun* grasses, the forest sways with the music of a hundred pipes, just as when the Heavenly Worthy once expounded the *Dao* in *Boling*, and the trees spontaneously sang in the Void. A numinous rooster perches above, and when it crows, all roosters under heaven respond. Then, azure mists swirl upward, the sun ascends, and the flying *zhen* immortals, hearing the rooster’s first crow, mount the Jade Terrace. They gather the cloud-teeth of the five directions and inhale the light of the three dawns to ferry those who study immortality.

Those of the highest root, single-minded in purity, though dwelling in the land of *Zhu Hua*, remain undisturbed by demonic chaos. They receive the *Shaodu*’s *guan zhen* elixir, attend the *Liuluo*’s feast, hear the *Sanglin*’s pipes, and bathe in the sun’s flowing radiance to refine the returning cinnabar.

*Ode:*
Marvelous is the *Lingbao Duren Jing*,
Its eight corners casting rays to illumine the Great Clarity.
The Hall of the Subtle and Remote transcends the realm of form,
Beneath the *Changsang* Forest, one imbibes the essence of flowers.

**The Eight Heavens of the North**
*Juewu Ziyu* and *Jiu Ri Daoqian*—
*Kunmu Dongfu* and *Xing She Shangxuan*—
*Tuoluo Yumiao* and *Miaoqi Heyun*—
*Feitian Dashou* governs the heavens above.
*Satuo Jieliang*, *Longhan Yingxian*—
*Biluo Fuli*, chanting in emptiness to preserve the precious.
The wicked and base, without rank, attain spontaneity in the wondrous Void.
The primordial *fàn* vast and boundless, in profound stillness, ferries humanity.

The eight characters *Juewu Ziyu* and *Jiu Ri Daoqian* in cloud-seals guard the *Xiaodu* Heaven. The flying heaven *Juewu* emerged from the primordial chaos of *Longhan Mingxing*, borne by the turning of the kalpa. At times, it accompanies the *Yu* Emperor in a phoenix chariot to roam the Nine Mysteries’ realm, revolving the nine mechanisms of destiny to align with the kalpa’s reckoning. When the great kalpa shifts, the Solar Flower Lad halts his radiance to transform and revolve the constant *qian* Dao of heaven, opening and guiding the harmonious *qi*.

The eight characters *Kunmu Dongfu* and *Xing She Shangxuan* in cloud-seals guard the *Yuandong* Heaven. *Kunmu* is the Great Yin’s Ninefold Numinous Immortal Mother; *Dongfu* is the name of the Eastern Sea’s water-governing deity; *Xing* is the earth’s mechanism; *She* means to summon; *Shang* is to report above; *Xuan* is the *Xuandu*.

chunks.original_text: 九灵仙母主治东极扶朵旸谷之渊，总持地机，旋转元气。 天关地机转动一周，则溢水三千三百度，度极则天地炁交，九海混一，众水弥天，东覆大神主治昆仑之顶，填涸巨海，过东井之源，使地机不沦。 如劫交则坤母出东井，召鸟母於龙门，制会河源，上诣帝前，申告劫会，乃以凤车乘载学人，升于昆仑，以朝玄都。 上阳子曰：妙经者，上妙之首经也。 道藏万八千篇，妙在度人一卷； 度人一经，妙在灵书一篇。 灵书之中，显此八字，奚谓元始秘隐，玄妙至此，忒杀泄尽天机。 天尊广大慈悲，世人尽自疑信。 噫，经为至人说也。 至人则能用此经也。 故清河老人颂之曰：玃无乘运应乾元，旋转九运保天根。 劫终鸟母会龙门，学人乘凤升昆仑。 羽林受符拜新恩，云衣缥缈朝帝轩。 金液还丹之妙，至人於此具眼。 陁罗育邈、眇炁合云八字，云篆镇妙成天。 陁，飞天名。 罗，月之光。 育，妙成天主讳。 邈，羽林监神名。 谓陁与育俱生云阿之岭，抱月之光，治羽林军。 羽林军在北，云阿岭在南，时勅邈监游行三界，保度学仙之人，诣羽林军，受符信乘。 吵然梵炁与诸天合景，结云炁以为衣，炼月光而实腹。 飞天大丑、总监上天八字，云篆镇禁上天。 飞天，神王。 大丑，都录之司宗伯。 总监，飞天神王麾下二神名。 上天，升天也。 飞天神王总上天劫会之运，管三界都录之司，时勅总监二神，总录长夜之府，升幽魂於天界，使与道以合真。 沙陁劫量、龙汉瑛鲜八字，云篆镇常融天。 此天有沙兰宫。 陁，丘山。 劫量，随劫铨量。 龙汉，初劫名； 瑛，神王讳； 鲜，日童名。 吉沙兰宫吃丘山，系玉清紫微别馆，新得受度而功未圆者，常巨万人，停散其中。 皆龙汉时人，随劫运交，诠量其功而诣上宫，学人若明此音，则瑛君察功行而度品，鲜童灌日精以炼形也。 碧落浮黎、空歌保珍，八字云篆，镇腾胜天。 碧落，天霞也。 浮黎，天王讳。 空，天中侍宸名。 歌，大洞之音。 天王步虚，碧霞开而乘飞云之笔； 侍宸一啸，灵风扇而成大洞之歌。 引导诸仙，上朝七宝，保持下学，珍爱灵书。 恶奕无品，洞妙自珍八字，云篆镇梵度天。 恶奕，天帝内音。 无，太无真人。 天帝恶奕自元始祖劫修行，超出三界，位入玉虚，时勅太无真人，大开长夜之府，品度罪魂，使其洞明宿命，净尽恶根，上升妙化之福堂，自乐至真之妙道也。 元梵恢漠、幽寂度人八字，云篆镇贾奕天。 元始大梵之炁，恢漠广大难穷，高而空浮，悬而不落。 虽幽而莫见，乃能变化； 虽寂然不动，感而遂通。 其中有真，真中有精。 其精甚真，妙不可名。 颠之倒之，逆施五行，度无量人以成还丹之道也。 大修行人，真心坚固，信受奉行，即得性命混融，形神俱妙，超凡入圣，积行累功，以证高仙上圣之位也。 颂曰：天尊说法度天人，大梵灵书显至真。 好是真经灵验处，大罗天上总安身。 道言：此诸天中大梵隐语，无量之音，旧文字皆广长一丈。 天真皇人昔书其文以为正音。 有知其音，能斋而诵之者，诸天皆遣飞天神王下观其身，书其功勤，上奏诸天，万神朝礼，地祇侍门，大勋魔王保举上仙。 道备克得，游行三界，升入金门。 此音无所不辟，无所不禳，无所不度，无所不成，天真自然之音也。

The Ninefold Numinous Immortal Mother governs the Eastern Ultimate, the *Fuduo* Yang Valley’s abyss, holding dominion over the earth’s mechanism and revolving the primordial *qi*. When the Heavenly Pass and earth’s mechanism complete one revolution, the overflowing waters reach three thousand three hundred *du*; when this measure is exhausted, heaven and earth’s *qi* intermingle, the nine seas merge as one, and the waters inundate the heavens. The great deity *Dongfu* presides over the summit of Kunlun, filling the vast seas and traversing the source of the Eastern Well, ensuring the earth’s mechanism does not sink. When the kalpa shifts, the *Kun* Mother emerges from the Eastern Well, summoning the Bird Mother at the Dragon Gate to regulate the river’s source. Ascending before the Emperor, she reports the kalpa’s convergence, then bears the disciples in a phoenix chariot to ascend Kunlun and pay homage at *Xuandu*.

Master Shangyang said: The *Miao Jing* is the foremost of the most wondrous scriptures. Among the eighteen thousand scrolls of the Daoist Canon, the wonder lies in the *Du Ren* scroll; within the *Du Ren Jing*, the wonder lies in the *Ling Shu* scroll. In the *Ling Shu*, these eight characters are revealed—how could the Primordial Beginning’s secret mysteries, so profoundly subtle, be so utterly exposed as to exhaust heaven’s mechanisms? The Heavenly Worthy, in boundless compassion, allows the world’s people to doubt or believe. Alas! The scripture is spoken for the perfected. Only the perfected can employ this scripture. Thus, the Elder of Qinghe praised it in verse:

*Juewu* rides the turning to align with the *qian* origin,
Revolving the nine revolutions to preserve heaven’s root.
When the kalpa ends, the Bird Mother meets at the Dragon Gate,
Disciples ride the phoenix to ascend Kunlun.
The Feathered Forest receives the talisman and bows to new grace,
In cloud robes ethereal, they pay homage at the Emperor’s hall.
The marvel of golden liquid and returning cinnabar—
The perfected behold this with discerning eyes.

*Tuoluo Yumiao* and *Miaoqi Heyun*, eight characters in cloud-seals, guard the *Miaocheng* Heaven. *Tuo* is the name of a flying immortal; *luo* is the moon’s radiance; *yu* is the personal name of the *Miaocheng* Heaven’s lord; *miao* is the name of the Feathered Forest’s overseer. It is said that *Tuo* and *Yu* were both born on the Cloud Alas Ridge, embracing the moon’s light, and govern the Feathered Forest army. The Feathered Forest lies in the north, while the Cloud Alas Ridge is in the south. At times, the Emperor commands *Miao* to patrol the Three Realms, safeguarding and guiding those who study immortality to the Feathered Forest army to receive talismans and credentials. Their resplendent *fan qi* merges with the myriad heavens’ luminosity, weaving cloud-*qi* into robes and refining moonlight to fill their bellies.

The Great Ugly Flying Immortal and the *Zongjian Shangtian*, eight characters in cloud-seals, guard the Forbidden Upper Heaven. *Feitian* is the divine king; *Dashou* is the registrar of the ancestral ministry. *Zongjian* are the names of two deities under the Flying Immortal Divine King. *Shangtian* means ascending to heaven. The Flying Immortal Divine King oversees the kalpa’s revolutions in the Upper Heaven, managing the Three Realms’ ancestral ministry. At times, he commands the two *Zongjian* deities to record the Long Night’s repository, raising the dark souls to the heavenly realm to merge with the Dao and unite with the true.

*Shatuo Jieliang* and *Longhan Yingshan*, eight characters in cloud-seals, guard the *Changrong* Heaven. This heaven contains the *Shalan* Palace. *Tuo* means hills; *jieliang* means measuring by the kalpa’s reckoning. *Longhan* is the name of the first kalpa; *ying* is the divine king’s personal name; *shan* is the Solar Lad’s name. The auspicious *Shalan* Palace rests upon the hills, a detached palace of the Jade Purity Purple Tenuity. Those newly received into the ranks of the delivered, whose merits remain incomplete, often number in the tens of thousands and dwell scattered within. All are people from the *Longhan* kalpa; as the kalpa’s revolutions shift, their merits are assessed to ascend to the upper palaces. If disciples comprehend this sound, *Ying* the Lord examines their conduct and merits to deliver them by rank, while the *Shan* Lad bathes them in solar essence to refine their forms.

*Biluo Fuli* and *Kongge Baozhen*, eight characters in cloud-seals, guard the *Tengsheng* Heaven. *Biluo* is the celestial rosy clouds; *Fuli* is the Heavenly King’s personal name; *Kong* is the name of the celestial attendant; *ge* is the sound of the Great Cavern. When the Heavenly King steps in emptiness, the rosy clouds part, and he rides the flying cloud’s brush; with one cry from the celestial attendant, the divine wind fans forth, forming the Great Cavern’s song. They guide the immortals to ascend and pay homage at the Seven Treasures, preserving and cherishing the scriptures for those who study below.

*Eyi Wupin* and *Dongmiao Zizhen*, eight characters in cloud-seals, guard the *Fandu* Heaven. *Eyi* is the Heavenly Emperor’s inner sound; *wu* is the Supreme Nonbeing Perfected. The Heavenly Emperor *Eyi*, since the Primordial Beginning’s ancestral kalpa, has cultivated the Dao, transcending the Three Realms to enter the Jade Void. At times, he commands the Supreme Nonbeing Perfected to widely open the Long Night’s repository, ranking and delivering sinful souls, enabling them to clearly understand their past lives, purify their evil roots, ascend to the wondrous transformation’s blessed hall, and naturally delight in the most true and wondrous Dao.

*Yuanfan Huimo* and *Youji Duren*, eight characters in cloud-seals, guard the *Jiayi* Heaven. The Primordial Beginning’s great *fan qi* is vast and boundless, difficult to fathom—lofty and floating in emptiness, suspended yet not falling. Though secluded and unseen, it can transform; though still and unmoving, it responds and connects. Within it lies the true; within the true lies the essence. Its essence is most true, wondrous beyond naming. Inverting and overturning, reversing the Five Phases, it delivers countless beings to achieve the Way of returning cinnabar. Those of great cultivation, with steadfast true hearts, who faithfully receive and practice this, will attain the fusion of nature and life, the marvel of both form and spirit, transcending the ordinary to enter sagehood, accumulating deeds and merits to realize the rank of lofty immortals and supreme sages.

A verse praises:
The Heavenly Worthy expounds the Dao to deliver heaven’s people,
The great *fan* and numinous scripture reveal the utmost true.
How fine is the wondrous efficacy of this true scripture—
In the Great Luo Heaven above, all find their abode.

The Dao speaks: These great *fan* hidden words within the heavens, the boundless sounds, were once written in characters a *zhang* in length. The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign of Old transcribed their script to establish the correct sounds. Those who know these sounds and purify themselves to recite them will have the myriad heavens dispatch Flying Immortal Divine Kings to observe their bodies, record their diligent merits, and report to the heavens. The ten thousand spirits will pay homage, earth deities will attend at the gates, and the great demon kings will protect and recommend them as immortals. When their Dao is complete and they attain perfection, they may wander the Three Realms and ascend through the Golden Gate. These sounds repel all, exorcise all, deliver all, and accomplish all—such are the Heavenly Perfected’s natural sounds.

chunks.original_text: 故诵之致飞天下观，上帝遥唱，万神朝礼，三界侍轩，群妖束首，鬼精自亡。 琳琅振响，十方肃清，河海静默，山岳吞烟，万灵振伏，招集群仙。 天无氛秽，地无妖尘，冥慧洞清，大量玄玄也。 上阳子曰：此经结处，乃太极真人所述。 旧文字皆广长一丈，谓龙汉之初，元始以梵炁结成文。 一丈，乃天地之成数。 太极真人述云：天真皇人昔书其文，以为正音。 此灵书乃大道之根，还丹之主。 有知其音，盖此隐语，非中下士所能颖悟。 若至圣大根、神仙种子，得师点破，即解其音。 一闻百悟，欣庆无量，更不迟疑，内斋外戒，信受奉行。 故太上曰：上士闻道，勤而行之。 夫行道之人，神明护门，魔鬼潜迹。 人能齐诵此经，则飞天神王下观其身果清净否，又书其功果勤行否。 若其身果然清净，欲不能干，魔不能试； 又其功果然勇猛坚固，精进勤行不怠，则万神自然朝礼，地只为之侍门，魔王亦行保举。 俟其道备丹成，修行至经，功满德就，身外有身，高超三界，升入金门。 此音随人所行，行之勤者，得道成仙； 诵之勤者，所求如愿。 是以辟禳度拔，无所不成也。 故诵之致飞天下。 观夫诵经者，必斋心戒欲，扫地更衣，焚香端坐，收视存神方可诵经。 诚心精致，浑无杂想，故能感召飞天下观，书其功勤。 上帝遥唱，感其精专。 今人手执素珠，其心妄想，何所不至。 而口哺哺以为诵经，岂得万神朝礼，三界侍轩！ 又且反招殃谴而不可逭。 此音，世法之谓。 自保举上仙至地无妖尘，乃玉晨道君，前叙已详。 太极真人於此结经，重为宣，以成灵宝度人功德。 若以道用，则飞天下观乃神返身中； 上帝遥唱，是脱胎神化。 轩，万神朝礼，一炁朝元； 三界侍轩，三元内守。 群妖束首，魔鬼伏降，鬼精自亡，尸怪殄灭。 琳琅振响，和炁斯应。 十方肃清，内外贞白。 河海静默，性寂情冥。 山岳吞烟，脉住炁停。 万灵振伏，阳神出现。 招集群仙，功成道备。 天无氛秽，广大遍周。 地无妖尘，光明清静。 冥慧洞清，慧一作惠，四字乃证，结经之义。 幽冥溥烛，慧照无边。 惠及一切，洞焕太空。 升清虚渺渺之天，更无拘滞； 广大量玄玄之妙，莫尽赞扬也。 颂曰：一卷真经字五千，重重密密总敷宣。 要知妙道功圆好，结习都忘证上仙。 元始灵书下篇　　天真皇人撰 东方八天 森甪储云，九魂炼精。 枳默窥玦，浮枚臼迹。 鹿几扬房，碧提酇回。 池滇党负，蚑逭谒携。 澡章变瑜，兰伴碧坏。 亢傍野生，极中昆清。 曜展洞涸，寂无眇凝。 素倚虚罗，皇达元灵。 南方八天 炎度绰堂，大霄瑶隅。 历遐荐漪，周扃加图。 披峣蹊朦，觚亶浑都。 戟芸荼炫，井欺持蒲。 掌维迮仪，奕光琅璀。 扁缕益但，幽微毕雷。 涓湟寔东，赤曜丛稽。 玉玄演侯，栢璖至规。 西方八天 镐正左适，婆泥杀灵。 悲招均疆，洎南缠魁。 静夷损光，混元觉缘。 道守岑遥，绵征知宣。 太灵湮漠，炳和卢随。 哲京常华，墟咸坚沙。 栗铎黜株，会衍球裴。 卓云青府，业睹般基。 北方八天 洼孩蒙甘，翠宇九阑。 萧钩涟兴，龙汾神关。 沟沦泬魔，豁蛮祈通。 玄寥亢息，无知肆明。 蟒修吉夕，馥坛时畎。 汤长敷昌，匪庸谨济。 朝康圣宽，秘法侈宜。 广帝理生，卫肇宏人。
chunks.translated_text:
Thus, when one recites them, Flying Immortals descend to observe; the Supreme Emperor sings from afar, the myriad spirits pay homage, the Three Realms attend in reverence, all demonic beings bow their heads, and ghostly essences perish of themselves. The resonant jade-like tones reverberate, the ten directions grow solemn and clear, rivers and seas fall silent, mountains and peaks swallow their mists, and the ten thousand spirits tremble in submission, summoning the assembly of immortals. The heavens are free of defilement, the earth is without demonic dust, dark wisdom shines with clarity, and the vastness of the mysterious profundity is boundless.

Master Shangyang said: This concluding passage of the scripture was composed by the Perfected Sovereign of the Great Ultimate. The ancient characters, each a *zhang* in length, were formed at the dawn of the Dragon Han era, when the Primordial Beginning wove them from the qi of the Brahma-sound. A *zhang* is the perfect measure of heaven and earth. The Perfected Sovereign of the Great Ultimate recounted: The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign of Old transcribed these characters to establish the correct sounds. This sacred script is the root of the Great Dao and the master of returning cinnabar. Those who know its sounds—this hidden language—are not of middling or lesser capacity, for they cannot fathom its subtleties. Only those of supreme sagely roots, the seeds of immortals, upon receiving their master’s illumination, may grasp its sounds. At first hearing, they awaken to a hundred insights, their joy boundless, and without hesitation, they purify themselves inwardly and observe the precepts outwardly, faithfully receiving and practicing it. Thus, the Most High said: The superior person, upon hearing the Dao, diligently practices it. For those who practice the Dao, divine luminaries guard their gates, and demonic beings withdraw into hiding. When one recites this scripture in harmony, Flying Immortal Divine Kings descend to observe whether their body is truly pure, and record whether their merits and diligence are steadfast. If their body is indeed pure, desire cannot disturb them, and demons cannot test them. If their merits are truly vigorous and unwavering, their progress diligent and unceasing, then the myriad spirits will naturally pay homage, earth deities will attend at their gates, and demon kings will protect and recommend them. When their Dao is complete and their elixir perfected, their cultivation reaching the scripture’s essence, their merits fulfilled and virtue perfected, they will attain a body beyond the body, transcend the Three Realms, and ascend through the Golden Gate. These sounds respond to one’s practice: those who practice diligently attain the Dao and become immortals; those who recite diligently have their wishes fulfilled. Thus, they repel, exorcise, deliver, and accomplish all—nothing is beyond their power. Therefore, recitation summons the descent of Flying Immortals.

Observe those who recite the scripture: they must purify their minds, abstain from desires, sweep the ground, change their garments, burn incense, sit upright, withdraw their gaze, and concentrate their spirit before recitation may begin. With sincere and focused intent, free from stray thoughts, they can summon the descent of Flying Immortals to observe and record their diligent merits. The Supreme Emperor sings from afar, moved by their devotion. Yet today, people hold prayer beads while their minds wander, their thoughts scattered, their mouths merely murmuring as if reciting the scripture—how can they expect the myriad spirits to pay homage or the Three Realms to attend in reverence? Instead, they invite calamity and retribution that cannot be evaded. These sounds are the essence of the world’s dharma.

From "protect and recommend as immortals" to "the earth is without demonic dust" was previously expounded in detail by the Jade Dawn Dao Lord. Here, the Perfected Sovereign of the Great Ultimate concludes the scripture, reiterating and proclaiming it to complete the merit of the *Lingbao* deliverance. When applied in Daoist practice, the descent of Flying Immortals signifies the spirit returning to the body; the Supreme Emperor’s distant song is the transformation of the embryo spirit. The carriage of the myriad spirits paying homage is the primordial qi returning to the origin; the Three Realms attending in reverence are the three origins guarded within. Demonic beings bow their heads, ghosts and demons submit and descend, ghostly essences perish of themselves, and corpse anomalies are eradicated. The resonant jade-like tones harmonize with the qi’s response. The ten directions grow solemn and clear, inner and outer purity prevail. Rivers and seas fall silent, nature is tranquil and emotions stilled. Mountains and peaks swallow their mists, the pulse ceases and qi settles. The ten thousand spirits tremble in submission, the yang spirit manifests. Immortals are summoned and assembled, the Dao is perfected and merits fulfilled. The heavens are free of defilement, vast and all-pervading. The earth is without demonic dust, radiant and serene. Dark wisdom shines with clarity—*minghui* (or *minghui*, the four characters signify the scripture’s concluding meaning)—illuminating the unseen, wisdom boundless. Grace extends to all, the vast emptiness resplendent. Ascending to the ethereal and distant heavens, free from all constraints; the vastness of the mysterious profundity’s wonders cannot be fully extolled.

A hymn says:
*A scroll of true scripture, five thousand characters,*
*Layered and dense, all proclaimed in full.*
*To know the wondrous Dao’s perfect merit,*
*All habits forgotten, one attains the immortal’s rank.*

chunks.original_text: 天真皇人梵炁玄辽天宝自然八合之音，主治世会地垒洪泽变灾厄难。 诵咏之者，禳辟妖祥，清挣道炁，无不宁也。 地官奉书，百灵畏敬，神朱写文，服佩明验，施之於至学，不宣於下俗也。 太极真人颂 神灵焕层虚，梵罗屯碧霄。 元始九龙驾，皇人按青轺。 灵光叶万真，珠影开阳寥。 出示灵宝篇，福德由是招。 洞玄隐高严，玉音泛云璈。 无量匪得思，道海生波济。 法义同涓流，滋植成嘉苗，用以振穷饥，教兴卫中朝。 帝尊寿亿年，太平灭兵刀。 稽首望玉宸，灵华散金毫。 太极真人曰： 太上玉宸大道君居紫霞之上，七映之天，纪录玄文。 玉妃捧经，金童散香，太乙执巾，玉郎侍筵。 龙吟虎嗥，庆云蒙霭。 十方天真大神、上圣高真、妙行真人、无极飞天神王、三界大魔、九天丈人，无鞅数众，吟咏玉经，皈依太上灵宝妙法，昌运流行，亿劫长存。 元始无量度人上品妙经解注卷下竟 诵经毕，咒曰： 上皇太真，使我升灵。 清斋澡炼，诵咏金经。 七玄披散，上朝太虚。 延年长存，克名录书。 闭目咽液三过，叩齿三通，复炉咒曰： 臣诵经已讫，向来所出臣身中三五功曹、左右官使者、侍香金童、传言玉女、五帝直符、直日香官，各三十二人。 各还金房玉室，在左还左，在右还右； 毋令差互，后召复到，一如故事。

The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign chants the Brahman-qi of the Vast and Distant Celestial Treasure, the Spontaneous Eightfold Harmonic Sound, governing the kalpas of the world, the earth’s ramparts, the floods and marshes, and the transformations of calamities and adversities. Those who recite and intone it dispel inauspicious omens, purify and refine the Dao-qi, and know no disturbance. The Earthly Offices present the scripture; the hundred spirits revere and obey. The Vermilion Gods transcribe the text; wearing or bearing it brings manifest verification. Applied to the utmost study, it is not proclaimed to the vulgar below.

**Ode of the Supreme Pole Perfected**
Divine spirits gleam in layered voids,
Brahmanic nets gather in azure skies.
The Primordial Beginning’s nine dragons draw the chariot,
The Sovereign holds the reins of the blue carriage.
Luminous radiance harmonizes with the myriad Perfected,
Pearl shadows unfold in the vast and desolate.
Revealing the *Lingbao* scriptures,
Fortune and virtue thereby summoned.
The *Dongxuan* conceals lofty solemnity,
Jade tones ripple like cloud-borne zithers.
Boundless, beyond thought’s reach,
The Dao-ocean surges with saving waves.
Dharma-meaning flows like a rivulet,
Nurturing and fostering fine sprouts.
Used to relieve the destitute and hungry,
Teaching flourishes to guard the central court.
The August Thearch’s life spans myriad years,
Great Peace extinguishes blades of war.
Bowing my head, I gaze toward the Jade Palace,
Divine blossoms scatter from golden brushes.

**The Supreme Pole Perfected says:**
The Supreme Jade Palace Great Dao Lord abides above the Purple Mist, in the Heaven of Sevenfold Radiance, recording the mysterious script. Jade consorts bear the sutras; golden lads scatter incense. The Great Unity holds the towel; jade youths attend the banquet. Dragons chant, tigers roar; auspicious clouds veil the mists. The Ten Directions’ Heavenly Perfected Great Spirits, Supreme Sages and Lofty Perfected, Wondrously Practiced Realized Ones, Boundless Flying Heavenly Spirit-Kings, Great Demons of the Three Realms, and the Nine Heavens’ Elders—innumerable hosts—chant the Jade Sutra, take refuge in the Supreme *Lingbao* Wondrous Dharma, and ensure its flourishing circulation, enduring for kalpas uncounted.

*Explication of the Primordial Beginning’s Peerless Upper Scripture on the Salvation of Humankind, Volume the Lower, concludes.*

After reciting the sutra, intone the incantation:
"Supreme August Perfected,
Enable my ascent to the numinous.
Purify with fasts and refinement,
Recite and intone the Golden Sutra.
The Seven Mysteries unfurl,
Ascend to the Great Void.
Prolong years and endure,
Inscribe my name in the celestial records."

Close the eyes, swallow saliva thrice, knock the teeth thrice, then recite the furnace incantation:
"Your servant has finished reciting the sutra. The Three and Five Functionaries of my body, the Attendants of the Left and Right Offices, the Incense-Bearing Golden Lads, the Message-Transmitting Jade Maidens, the Five Thearchs’ Direct Talismans, and the Fragrance Officers of the Day—thirty-two each—return to their golden chambers and jade halls. Those on the left return to the left; those on the right return to the right. Let none err or stray. When summoned again, return as before, in accordance with ancient precedent."

chunks.original_text: 再叩齿三通，念： 向来听经卫经圣众，解坛散席，各复所司。 神风静默，山海肃清。 千邪伏匿，百灵护形。 心拜，咽液，叩齿，收经。 上阳子曰：天尊说经以度迷人，世人若不沉迷，天尊奚肯漏露。 夫人之生，禀父精母血，成其躯壳。 及乎年壮，与嗜欲俱，却将所受之精流于爱河欲海。 丧之早者，不满下寿； 丧之迟者，不满中寿； 丧之晚者，不满上寿。 若欲身安寿永，唯当绝欲宝精。 人之寿命，主乎精气。 犹灯之有油，如鱼之有水； 油枯灯灭，水涸鱼亡。 奈何愚人以苦为乐，见色弃生，岂知精竭，命亦随逝。 天尊慈悯，说出此经，可以炼丹，使人知回其气、知还其元、知宝其身、知永其寿。 然遇者不及，智者过之。 何以故？
chunks.translated_text:
Once more knock the teeth thrice and recite:
"Those who have come to hear and guard the sutra, dissolve the altar and disperse the assembly, each returning to their posts.
The divine winds grow still and silent,
Mountains and seas stand solemn and clear.
A thousand evils hide in submission,
A hundred spirits shield this form."

Bow in reverence, swallow saliva, knock the teeth, and close the sutra.

Master of Supreme Yang says: The Heavenly Worthy preached the sutra to deliver the deluded. Had mortals not been sunk in confusion, would the Heavenly Worthy have revealed it?
When a person is born, they receive their father’s essence and mother’s blood to form their bodily shell. As they reach maturity, desires arise with them, and the essence they were endowed with flows into the rivers of love and seas of lust. Those who lose it early do not reach the lower span of life; those who lose it later do not reach the middle span; those who lose it late do not reach the upper span. If one wishes for bodily peace and enduring life, they must only cut off desire and treasure their essence.

A person’s lifespan is governed by essence and qi—
Like a lamp with its oil, like a fish with its water.
When the oil is spent, the lamp goes out;
When the water dries, the fish perishes.
Yet how is it that fools take suffering for joy,
Seeing beauty and casting life aside?
How could they know that when essence is exhausted,
Life too slips away?

The Heavenly Worthy, moved by compassion, expounded this sutra to teach the refinement of the elixir, that people might learn to return their qi, restore their origin, treasure their bodies, and perpetuate their years. Yet those who encounter it fail to grasp it, while the wise pass it by. Why is this so?

chunks.original_text: 智者曰：生必死，死则已，又何地狱之信哉。 是云过之。 愚者曰：不修善，不作恶，饥则饭，困则眠，此即天堂，更有何道。 是云不及。 虽然，经与至人授也，道与上士说也。 上士至人、诵经行道、积行累功，功高则身超大罗，行满则臣事三境也。 颂曰：此经秘在大罗天，玉女持花侍法筵。 经足丹成功行满，鸾翔凤舞驾云軿。
chunks.translated_text:
The wise say: "Life must end in death, and death is final—why believe in hell?" This is what it means to pass it by. The foolish say: "Do no good, commit no evil, eat when hungry, sleep when weary—this is heaven itself. What other Way is there?" This is what it means to fail to grasp it.

Yet this sutra was transmitted by perfected beings, and the Dao expounded to superior practitioners. When superior practitioners and perfected beings recite the sutra, practice the Way, accumulate deeds, and amass merit—when their merit is lofty, their bodies ascend beyond the Great Luo Heaven; when their practice is complete, they serve as ministers in the Three Realms.

A hymn says:
This sutra is hidden in the Great Luo Heaven,
Jade maidens hold flowers beside the Dharma feast.
When the sutra is mastered, the elixir perfected, and practice fulfilled,
Phoenixes soar and simurghs dance, chariots ride the clouds.
